TI RETRACTED: An Analysis of the Growth of Fire-Damaged Pinus koraiensis
   Trees in a Northern Temperate Forest (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Groundfire; Tree ring analysis; Radial growth; competition; climate
ID MIXED-CONIFER FOREST; BOREAL FOREST; DYNAMICS; USA; FREQUENCY; REGIMES
AB This paper evaluates the effects of a groundfire on the radial growth of fire tolerance species Korean pine (Pinus koraiensis) trees growing in the Changbai Mountain Nature Reserve which occurred more than 90 years. The study material includes damaged and undamaged sample trees approximately with the same age. The trees are growing in close vicinity to each other and are subject to the same climatic conditions. The study material is rather homogenous and allowing analysis of the long-term effects of ground fire on the growth of important tree species. Two tree-ring chronologies from 25 fire-damaged and 24 undamaged trees were analyzed. The results showed that temperature and precipitation during the previous winter had a significant effect on the mean annual radial growth of both groups. Trees which had been damaged by an old fire were more sensitive to the negative effect of high summer temperatures and to the positive effect of high spring temperatures than the undamaged group. In contrast to previous studies, their growth was also considerably more affected by competition than the growth of the undamaged individuals. The study material is rather homogenous and probably unique, allowing such a temporal and spatial analysis of the long-term effects of a ground fire on the growth of an important tree species in a northern temperate forest. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Photocatalytic Activities of TiO2 Modified by
   Poly(fluorene-co-bithiophene) under Visible Light (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Photocatalytic; TiO2; Polymer; Photosensitizer; Visible light
ID SEMICONDUCTOR PARTICULATE SYSTEM; ORGANIC POLLUTANTS; TITANIUM-DIOXIDE;
   AQUEOUS-MEDIUM; DEGRADATION; PHOTODEGRADATION; POLYMER; NANOPARTICLES;
   IRRADIATION; OXIDATION
AB Photocatalytic removal of phenol was studied using the photocatalyst poly(fluorine-co-bithiophene) (PFB)/TiO2 under visible light. After two hours irradiation with a three watts GaN LEDs (light emitting diode) cluster, about 75% removal of phenol. the degradation reaction showed the firs-order behavior and the reaction rate constants (k) of PFB/TiO2 was calculated to be 0.0169 min(-1). Diffuse reflectance spectra showed that the absorbance range of PFB/TiO2 was expanded from 387 nm (TiO2) to above 500 nm. Photoluminescent spectra and photoluminescent quantum efficiency indicated that electrons were transferred from PFB to the conduction band of TiO2. The surface modification using PFB did not decrease the photocatalytic activity of TiO2 under the UV light irradiation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Quick and sensitive determination of gene expression of
   hormone-sensitive lipase by real-time PCR (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Energy; Lipid deposition; Hormone-sensitive lipase; mRNA express;
   Real-time-PCR
ID OBESITY; HOMEOSTASIS
AB Background Obesity results from an imbalance between energy intake and energy expenditure, which leads to a pathological accumulation of adipose tissue, but the underlying mechanism at gene level is far from being elucidated.
   Methods Pig primary adipocytes were cultured in vitro and the expression of HSL was detected by real-time PCR.
   Results The high concentrations of glucose group significantly cut down the mRNA expression of HSL (P<0.01) rather than in the others.
   Conclusion Our results provide significant data for that confirm an association between different glucose level and HSL expression in preadipocytes. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study on purification of electrolytic solution in Alkaline
   Leaching (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE alkaline leaching solution; impurities elements; purification
AB In this paper, purification of impurities elements in alkaline leaching solution are researched. The experimental results indicate that the removal rate is 82.3 percent adopting Na2S to remove Pb element in the leaching solution at the optimum conditions which the temperature is for 70 degrees C, purification time is for 90min, aging time is for 48h. The removal rate is 21.1 percent adopting Fe-2(SO4)(3) to remove the As element in the leaching solution at the conditions which the concentration of Fe-2(SO4)(3) is for 1g/L, temperature is for 90 degrees C, agitation time is for 1h. The removal rate is 39.9 percent adopting Na2SiO3 to remove the Al element in the leaching solution at the conditions that the concentration of Na2SiO3 is for 1.5g/L, temperature is for 90 degrees C, agitation time is for 1h. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Accounting and Analysis of the Cost of Air Pollution Control
   in Urban (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE air pollution control; the cost of pollution control accounting;
   environment valuation in physical terms and monetary terms; the virtual
   control cost; the index of pollution control cost deduction from GDP;
   environmentally adjusted domestic product; the control cost per- unit
AB With the analysis model of control cost per-unit, the cost of air pollution control was accounted in Xi'an from 2000 to 2007 in this paper. Based on the accounting results, the gross amount and the structure of control cost were analyzed. Environmental economic indicators were used in analytical process, such as the virtual control cost, the index of pollution control cost deduction from GDP and the environmentally adjusted domestic product. The results showed that the key control pollutants are smoke and SO2. The ratio of the virtual control cost to actual control cost showed that the air pollution control expenditure remains inadequate, so the investment for air pollution control should be increased progressively. The index of pollution control cost deduction from GDP in air pollution was less than the national average. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Quality assessment of MS/MS spectra using variable selection
   and support vector machine (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Quality assessment; MS/MS; mRMR; Variable Selection; Support Vector
   Machine; Computational Proteomics
ID MASS-SPECTROMETRY DATA; PROTEIN IDENTIFICATION; PROTEOMICS; PEPTIDE;
   THROUGHPUT; DATABASE
AB High-throughput proteomics experiments produce large amounts of MS/MS data, but many are of too low quality to be utilized. Filtering out the low quality MS/MS spectra is one of the strategies to increase computational speed of database searching. We investigate the variables proposed in previous literatures, and collect 63 features for our study, including 8 new variables proposed in this paper. MRMR is used to select important variable set for 4 kinds of mass spectrometer platforms: Thermo LTQ-FT, LTQ LCQ, and Waters/Micromass QTOF. A Support Vector Machine based method is used to assess the quality of MS/MS spectra. Datasets from different mass spectrometers are applied to test the accuracy of our method. In order to prove the capability of our method, we compare it with msmsEval on the test datasets, and the results show that our method achieves higher accuracy and better performance than msmsEval. The programs can be obtained from the authors by request. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Synchronization of electrically coupled chaotic neuronal
   networks (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE synchronization; chaotic; neuronal network; Master Stability Function;
   electrical synapse; coupling strength
AB Synchronization of electrically coupled chaotic neuronal networks with various topologies is explored in this paper. A general synchronization condition of chaotic neuronal network is obtained by using Master Stability Function method first. Then the condition is applied in chain, ring, star and global coupling networks respectively, while numerical simulations are also performed to check the effectiveness of the condition. It is shown that Master Stability Function method is effective for determining synchronization condition of diffusively coupled neuronal networks and networks with various topologies have different synchronization abilities, which means the speed of information circulation varies a lot in different types of neuronal networks in human brain. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Phase synchronization of a small-world neuronal network
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE phase synchronization; neuronal network; small-world; heterogeneity;
   coupling strength
ID COUPLED NEURONS; CHAOS; MODEL
AB Synchronization of coupled neurons is thought to be important for information communication in neuronal systems. In this paper, phase synchronization of an electrically coupled small-world neuronal network is explored. A small-world Hindmarsh-Rose neuronal network is set up first and then the effects of various network parameters and the heterogeneity of the network on phase synchronization are discussed with some biological explanations. It is demonstrated that the necessary coupling strengths for phase synchronization decrease with the increase of the number of neurons, the degree of nodes and the connection density, and the network heterogeneity has an adverse effect on the synchronizability of the neuronal network. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Synchronization in Two Coupled Fitzhugh-Nagumo Neurons with
   Time Delay (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fitzhugh-Nagumo neurons; synchronization; time delay; sufficient
   conditions
AB In this paper, we propose a method for studying synchronization in two coupled Fitzhugh-Nagumo(FHN) neurons without or with time delay. Some sufficient conditions for synchronization in the coupled FHN neurons without or with time delay are obtained by an untied method. We avoid using the Lyapuonv functional method to deal with synchronization problem in delay differential system. Simulation results illustrate our analysis. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: The Weakly Self-Affine Algorithm for Recognition of tmRNA
   Functional Domains (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE signal segmemtation; Weakly self-affine functions; Recognition; tmRNA
   functionl domains
ID ESCHERICHIA-COLI; RNA
AB It is presented a new approach for the identification of RNA molecules functional domains. Based on the use of weakly self-affine functions, Our method allows to segmenting of the signal into parts and gives segmentation marks which are multifractally homogeneous. It is found that the method can be applied to estimate multifractal spectra for identification of tmRNA functional domains. In this application, The signal contains 1480 samples, we set sigma(j) = j(2) and j(0) = 6 and used the Daubechies 12 wavelet, a threshold of epsilon = 8 yields a modeling with three WSA functions, where 75% of the coefficients are processed. Our result show that tmRNA functional domains identification, the original signal and the model are visually almost indistinguishable. The segmentation is relevant since the marks almost perfectly coincide with the three functional domains of tmRNA secondary structure. The slight discrepancy between the position of the segmentation marks and the exact location of the units is due to the fact that, in the current implementation, the marks are restricted to be on dyadic points. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Yunnan Nationalities Univ, Sch Math & Comp Sci, Kunming 650031, Peoples R China.
RP Chen, XZ (reprint author), Yunnan Nationalities Univ, Sch Math & Comp Sci, Kunming 650031, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Synthesis and crystal structure of a mononuclear calcium(II)
   complex with 2, 2 '-(azinodimethylidyne)dibenzenesulfonate) (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Synthesis; crystal structure; Schiff base; calcium (II) complex
AB A Schiff base complex, Tetraaqua-2, 2'-(azinodimethylidyne) dibenzenesulfonate calcium(II), has been synthesized and structurally characterized by elemental analyses and X-ray diffraction. In the complex, the Ca(II) atom is six-coordinated by two O atoms from the two Schiff base ligands, 2, 2'-(azinodimethylidyne) dibenzenesulfonate and four O atoms from four coordinated water molecules, forming a slightly distorted octahedral CaO6 geometry. TI RETRACTED: Synthesis, spectral properties of
   DI-(2-methyl-8-hydroxyquinoline) zinc (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE 2-Methyl-8-hydroxyquinoline; zinc (II) complex; synthesis; spectral
   properties
ID ELECTROCHEMICAL-BEHAVIOR; SCHIFF-BASES; COMPLEXES; LIGANDS
AB The complex of di-(2-methyl-8-hydroxyquinoline) zinc (Zn(2-mq)(2)) was synthesized. The complex was characterized by elemental analysis, (HNMR)-H-1, (CNMR)-C-13, infrared, UV-vis, XRD and molar conductivity. The zinc (II) ion was found to coordinate to the oxygen atom of phenolic hydroxyl and nitrogen atoms of 2-methyl-8-hydroxyquinoline and the complex conformes to 1:2 metal-to-ligand stoichiometry. The fluorescence properties of the complex in solid and solution were studied. The complex exhibits yellow light under the excitation of UV light. The solvent factors influencing the fluorescent intensity are discussed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Molecular cloning and tissue-specific expression of the
   liver-type fatty acid binding protein (L-FABP) gene in goat (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE L-FABP; gene cloning; sequence analysis; tissue expression
ID ESCHERICHIA-COLI; SMALL-INTESTINE; RAT-LIVER; SWISS-MODEL; PURIFICATION;
   SEQUENCE; POLYMORPHISM; STABILITY; ISOFORMS; INSIGHTS
AB In order to understand the structure and function of L-FABP gene, reveal the effect on the fatty acid binding in goat, and find the molecule marker correlated with meat traits, the cDNA of L-FABP gene was cloned and sequenced from liver of goat by T-A clone techniques. The structure and function of L-FABP were analyzed by bioinformatics, and the gene expression profile in different tissues was examined by real-time PCR. The results showed that the full sequence of L-FABP cDNA is 405 bp, containing 384 bp coding region (CDS) encoding 127 amino acids. The secondary structure of the protein was mainly alpha-helixes, extended strands and beta-turns structure. The deduced amino acid sequence of L-FABP shared significant identity with the L-FABP from other mammals. The phylogenic tree based on L-FABP protein sequence was detected the closest relationship between cattle and pig. A predicted 3D model was constructed by homology modeling. An L-FABP specific product was generated by RT-PCR in various tissues, the amount of L-FABP mRNA in liver and kidney was higher than in heart and skeletal muscle, and it was faintly detected in lung. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Synchronization in two coupled Hindmarsh-rose neurons
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Hindmarsh-Rose neurons; synchronization; Kaplan-Yorke dimension;
   information
AB Synchronization in two coupled Hindmarsh-Rose (HR) neurons is considered. Whether the coupling forms between the two neurons are linear or not, synchronization in the two neurons always means the decrease of the Kaplan-Yorke dimension of the chaotic attractor of the neural system. According to frequency analysis, the two coupled HR neurons can change the output of the significance of the information and forms by adjusting coupling strength and form between them. TI RETRACTED: Bioinformatic analysis and characteristics of mel1a gene
   product from chicken (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Bioinformatic Analysis; Mel1A
ID FUNCTIONAL MELATONIN RECEPTORS
AB Melatonin (N-acetyl-5-methoxytryptamine), an indole hormone, regulates various biological functions through three different receptor subtypes (Mel-1a, Mel-1b, and Mel-1c), acting through melatonin receptors, is involved in numerous physiological processes including circadian entrainment, blood pressure regulation, oncogenesis, retinal physiology, seasonal reproduction, ovarian physiology, and most recently in inducing osteoblast differentiation. The MT1 (or Mel1A or MTNR1A) and MT2 (or Mel1B or MTNR1B) receptor subtypes are present in humans and other mammals, while an additional melatonin receptor subtype MT3 (or Mel1C or MTNR1C) has been identified in amphibia and birds. The Mel-1a and Mel-1b receptor subtypes are present in humans and other mammals, while an additional melatonin receptor subtype Mel-1c has been identified in amphibia and birds. The Mel-1a subtype is present in the pars tuberalis of the pituitary gland and the suprachiasmatic nuclei of the hypothalamus. In order to understand the structure and function of Mel1A gene, in this study, we sequenced Mel1A gene, did some bioinformatic and characteristics analysis of its product. The results showed that the full CDS sequence of Mel1A is 1062 bp, encoding 353 amino acids. The secondary structure of the protein was mainly a-helixes, extended strands, random coil and beta-turns structure. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research progress on melatonin receptor in poultry (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Melatonin Receptor; Research progress; poultry
ID MT(1) MELATONIN; OCULAR GROWTH; PINEAL-GLAND; CHICK; LOCALIZATION;
   SUBTYPES; BIOLOGY; ANTAGONISTS; RESPONSES; RHYTHMS
AB A melatonin receptor is a G protein-coupled receptor (GPCR) which binds melatonin. Three types of melatonin receptor have been cloned. The MT1 (or Mel1A or MTNR1A) and MT2 (or Mel1B or MTNR1B) receptor subtypes are present in humans and other mammals, while an additional melatonin receptor subtype MT3 (or Mel1C or MTNR1C) has been identified in amphibia and birds. The hormone melatonin is secreted primarily from the pineal gland, with highest levels occurring during the dark period of a circadian cycle. This hormone, through an action in the brain, appears to be involved in the regulation of various neural and endocrine processes that are cued by the daily change in photoperiod. This article reviews the research progress on melatonin receptor in poultry. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A phylogeny based on 13 mitochondrial protein coding genes
   (PCGs) within Tephritidae of Diptera (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Tephritidae; phylogeny; mitochondrial genomes
ID BACTROCERA SPECIES DIPTERA; DNA-SEQUENCES; MOLECULAR PHYLOGENY;
   FRUIT-FLY; GENOME; LEPIDOPTERA; YUNNAN; CHINA
AB The objective of this study was to infer phylogenetic relationships among 8 sequenced mitochondrial genomes within Tephritidae of Diptera. According to conserved (C) / variable (V) sites ratio test, we combined all 13 mtDNA protein coding genes (PCGs) into a single data set for use in determining phylogeny. The same gene regions of Pteronarcys princes, Lucilia sericata and Drosophila yakuba were used as outgroup. When MP and ML analysis were applied to the combined data set, they gave two fairly similar trees. Accorded with all previous morphological and molecular evidence, the monophyly of family Tephritidae was strongly recovered in our result. Our data set led to a likelihood tree in which B. dorsalis and B. papayae was provided relative closely relationship meanwhile B. carambolae formed a clade basal to them. This result agreed with Zhang et al. (2010) and Nadi et al. (2010). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE smart living space; smart community; pervasive computing
AB Smart living space is a new theory which is based in the context of pervasive computing and the theory of smart space. Currently there is no research in this area, but some of the best smart space theory&rearch can direct reference. Since the smart living space has a wide range of concept, we choose from the smart community to study the smart living space and take smart space as a breakthrough point and the smart space-related technologies can be used to build the smart living space. At last we take the smart classroom of TsingHua university as an example of the specific application. And make a conclusion that the research on smart living space is reality available but also faces many challenges and the socio-technical background of smart living space will be the future research emphasis. TI RETRACTED: Study on the correlation between mechanical characteristics
   and non-destructive testing of stress wave in poplar logs (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE poplar; logs; compressive properties; stress wave; non-destructive
   testing
AB The testing experiments to healthy poplar logs samplings whose diameter scopes were in 5-11cm and the length respectively were 10cm and 30cm were conducted by using Arbotom stress wave testing instrument and universal mechanics testing machine. The relationships between dynamic modulus of elasticity of stress wave and compression and bending properties were all studied in the poplar logs samplings. The results indicated that, in the 30cm poplar log samplings, the dynamic modulus of elasticity of stress wave had good linear correlation with the four indexes. However, in the 10cm samplings, the situation was a little different and the dynamic modulus of elasticity didn't have good linear correlation with MOE in compression parallel to grain and compression strength. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE ant; Alloy; FEM; Algorithm; TSP
AB We have used the metaphor of ant colonies to define "the Ant system", a class of distributed algorithms for combinatorial optimization. In this paper we analyze some properties of Ant-cycle, the up to now best performing of the ant algorithms we have tested. We report many results regarding its performance when varying the values of control parameters and we compare it with some FEM algorithms. TI RETRACTED: Based on immune algorithm single crystal finite element
   analysis (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE superalloys; immune; B-cells; Algorithm; ANSYS
ID SUPERALLOY; GAMMA
AB 1040 degrees C was studied during the period imposed 137MPa tensile creep nickel-base single crystal super alloys gamma/gamma the evolution of two-phase approach. ANSYS finite element method is using a single crystal alloy with / without external load when the Von Mises stress in the gland gamma 'two phase distribution. The comprehensive analysis of the formula, the coefficient values usually experience, not very accurate, this article dealing with Immune Algorithm coefficient. This algorithm uses orthogonal crossover to generate initial population and uses elitist-crossover to increase the good patterns of the population and uses hybrid mutation to increase the ability of local and global optimization. It has shown fascinating results when being used in the optimization of multimodal function. The results showed that: In the creep period, the corresponding cubic gamma' along the von Mises stress and strain energy density of the crystal face to form raft-like organizations. TI RETRACTED: Granularity fitness landscape and directed mutation in
   evolutionary algorithm (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Evolutionary algorithm; Granular computing; Granularity fitness
   landscape; Directive mutation operator
AB This paper introduces the granular computing thought and method into evolutionary algorithm. Take the solving process of the evolutionary algorithm as an information system; adopt the equivalent relation to divide the solution space and objective function, form subspace granule or objective function granule. On this basis, we proposed the conception of granularity fitness landscape. We use the methods of binary granular computing to find the relation between subspace granule and objective function granule, express the dependency of objective function to the individuals at macroscopic. Take this as foundation to carry out the mutation operator what was direct by granular fitness landscape, this operator can improve the convergence rate of the evolutionary algorithm remarkable. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yan Gaowei; Xie Gang; Zheng Zhong] Taiyuan Univ Technol, Coll Informat Engn, Taiyuan 030024, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Comparison of classification methods on imbalanced
   protein-protein interaction text set (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Protein-Protein Interaction; Imbalanced text classification; Machine
   Learning
AB Protein-protein interaction (PPI) network is essential to understand the fundamental processes governing cell biology. It is well known that document classification systems are potential to accelerate the curation process by retrieving PPI-related documents. However, it is usually a case that there is an imbalanced two class data set on text classification. Learning from imbalanced data sets is an important challenge to the machine learning community. In this paper, we compare the performance of several document classifiers on one PPI document set and vary the size of the number of positives and the ratio of the number of positives to the number of negatives on training set and testing set in the experiment. Through the experiment, we try to find what kind of classification algorithm is suitable for imbalanced PPI document classification. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Classification of meat freshness based on support vector
   machine (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011

DE Support vector machine; meat freshness; classification
ID BEEF TENDERNESS
AB The data of meat freshness classification based on the TVB-N content, total bacterial count, pH value and sensory scores of meat samples in decompression storeroom were reported in this paper. The experiments showed that any single physicochemical and sensory properties could not reflect the freshness of meat sample exactly. Therefore SVM was introduced to train the experimental data and built the model to predict the meat freshness. The results indicated that the obtained model could achieve high classification accuracy after the parameters were optimized by coarse and fine search. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.    2011

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ultraweak Luminescence; nonlinear domino effect; rapeseed
ID CELLS
AB There exsits generally the phenomenon about ultraweak photon emission from biological system in natural world. It was known that superweak luminescence exists in all animals and plants. The luminescence shows the important information of metabolism and energy transformation of the living biological organism. This passage did some research of rapeseeds' ultraweak luminescence based on nondestrucive testing. The experiment showed that luminescence intensity increased with the augment of mass, but the increase of luminescence intensity was not obvious when mass was augmented to a certain degree. It was nonlinear domino effect. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Establishment of an heterologous immunoassay to detect
   enrofloxacin residues (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Enrofloxacin; Artificial antigen; Polyclonal antibody; Indirect
   competitive ELISA; Heterologous; Poultry
ID LINKED-IMMUNOSORBENT-ASSAY; MASS-SPECTROMETRY; MULTIRESIDUE; WATER; MILK
AB A heterologous indirect competitive ELISA (icELISA) format has been developed for the determination of enrofloxacin (ENR) residues in poultry. For this purpose, carbodiimide active ester method was employed to synthesize the artificial antigen of ENR-BSA while mixed-anhydride technique was used to synthesize the coating antigen of ENR-OVA, to pursue the heterologous sensitivity. By the square matrix titration, the icELISA method was developed for the quantitative detection of ENR, based on the pAb. The Linear range was from 0.02 to 86.3 ng/mL, with LOD and IC50 value of 0.8 ng/mL and 0.01 ng/mL, respectively. After optimization, 5% of NaOH was used in the assay buffer and this ELISA system can tolerate methanol not higher than 30%. Of all the cross-reacting analogues, this assay exhibited a high cross-reactivity to Ciprofloxacin (83%), Pefloxacin (67%), Danofloxacin (63%), Sarafloxacin (59%), and Norfloxacin (49%). The correlation coefficients (R-2) between concentration spiked and concentration determined were 0.9975 in chicken muscle and 0.9959 in duck muscle, respectively. Therefore, this assay has the potential to be incorporated into a quantitative monitoring program for the rapid screening of ENR residue in poultry tissues. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [An Zhixing; Jiang Jinqing; Zhang Haitang; Liu Junwei; Fan Guoying] Henan Inst Sci & Technol, Coll Anim Sci, Xinxiang 453003, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: The exponent of self-thinning law varied: a model linking
   population spatial distribution and individual growth (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE self-thinning; spatial distribution; equilateral hexagon; fractal
   geometry
ID PLANT-POPULATIONS; FRACTAL DIMENSION; FOREST TREES; RAIN-FOREST;
   DENSITY; SIZE; DYNAMICS; PATTERNS; GEOMETRY; COMMUNITIES
AB The debate on which exponent was correct, -3/2 or -4/3, was still a puzzled question in population self-thinning. To unify these two exponents, a new model linking population spatial distribution and the individual growth was provided here. Based on the fact that space was occupied by individuals, we found that the basic structure of even-aged and mono-specific plant population was an equilateral hexagon, which was constituted of seven individuals. Furthermore, the individual volume, described with integration method, was proved to be proportional to power of length. In the fractal geometry opinion, the dimension of the section was fractal and varied between 1 and 2. So the exponent of self-thinning power law was a real number between -1 and -3/2. We concluded that -4/3 power law was not universal in self-thinning process, but a transient value in the range of -1 and -3/2. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Tang Yi; Jiang Deming] Inst Appl Ecol, Shenyang 110016, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Change in xylanase activity in peel and pulp of banana (Musa
   sp.) fruits during ripening and softening (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE banana fruit; ripening and softening; xylanase
ID MOLECULAR-WEIGHT; TOMATO FRUIT; EXPRESSION; SUGAR; GENE
AB Xylanase is the name given to a class of enzymes which degrade the linear polysaccharide beta-1,4-xylan into xylose. Xylan is one of the most abundant polysaccharides existing in nature. It consists of a backbone of beta-1,4-linked d-xylose, usually with branches of alpha-1,3-linked L-arabinose and alpha-1,2-linked D-glucopyranose. To find out whether xylanase plays important roles in banana fruit softening, the enzyme activities in peel and pulp, fruit firmness, respiration rate and ethylene release rate were assayed during banana softening. The results showed that xylanase activity increased suddenly synchronic to the appearance of the ethylene production peak at later stage, xylanase activity increased about 175 and 268 folds in peel and pulp in CK, 154 and 236 folds in peel and pulp in treatment, respectively, and activities in treatment were slightly lower than in control both in peel and pulp; while ethylene absorbent treatment postponed the reaching the peaks of xylanase activities, but did not change the pattern of it during storage, which means that its activity may be regulated by ethylene. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Xueping; Chen, Weixin] S China Agr Univ, Coll Hort, Guangzhou 510642, Guangdong, Peoples R China.
RP Chen, WX (reprint author), S China Agr Univ, Coll Hort, Guangzhou 510642, Guangdong, Peoples R China.
EM wxchen@scau.edu.cn
CR Brummell DA, 1997, PLANT PHYSIOL, V115, P717, DOI 10.1104/pp.115.2.717

TI RETRACTED: Photoelectrocatalytic performance of TiO2 film treatment of
   La(NO3)(3) (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE photocatalysis; photoelectrocatalysis; micro-arc oxidation; scarlet dye
ID ELECTRODES
AB Titanium oxide film (TiO2/Ti) were formed on the titanium surface by micro-arc oxidation(MAO) in Na3PO4 solution. Then the Titanium oxide film(TiO2/Ti) treatment by La(NO3)(3), The photocatalytic ability of titanium oxide coatings were evaluated by photocatalytic degradation of scarlet dye aqueous solution. Using the TiO2/Ti as anod electrode, the titanium as counter electrode, and with the UV lamp, constant current meter make up the photoelectrocatalytic reactor was built. The results show that the photocatalytic activity of the titanium oxide films was enhanced after La(NO3)(3) treatment. When La(NO3)(3) aqueous consistency is 0.1mol.L-1 and soak time is 12 hour, the scarlet dye concentration of 20mg/L, electrolyte concentration of 0.02 mol/L. The photoelectric degradation of scarlet dye is increased from 10.8% to 39.8% by the photoelectrocatalysis and La(NO3)(3) treatment TiO2/Ti film photoelectric degradation increased to 57.6% (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis gene encoding
   cycloartenol synthase isolated and introduced into tomato by
   Agrobacterium-mediated transformation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis; cycloartenol synthase;
   Agrobacterium-mediated transformation; CAS gene; Antisense; tomato
ID BIOSYNTHESIS; ARABIDOPSIS; EXPRESSION; INHIBITION; STEROLS
AB A CAS gene encoding cycloartenol synthase was cloned from Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis by homology based PCR method. The comparative analysis of full-length cDNA, using the BLASTN algorithm, showed that the cloned CAS gene shared more than 80% nucleotide sequence identity with the fragments from other plants encoding cycloartenol synthase. The CAS gene from Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis was cloned into the plant binary vector pBI121 in the antisense orientation and transformed into tomato (Solanum lycopersicum) by Agrobacterium tumefaciens mediated method. 8 transgenic plants were obtained. PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) and Southern blot analysis showed that the antiCAS gene had integrated into the genome of tomato. RT-PCR analysis of CAS gene inhibition in transgenic plants revealed that all the transgenic plants accumulated no detectable or extremely low levels of the CAS transcripts, whereas the CAS expression was obviously detectable in the non-transgenic plant. These results showed that the cloned CAS gene from Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis played an important role in plant cycloartenol synthase. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Uniqueness of a prey-predator model with predator saturation
   and competition (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE prey-predator model; positive solutions; uniqueness
ID POSITIVE SOLUTIONS; EQUATIONS; SYSTEMS; BIFURCATION
AB In this paper, we consider positive solutions of a prey-predator model with predator saturation and competition under homogeneous Dirichlet boundary conditions. The existence of positive solutions and present some sufficient and necessary conditions are established by using the standard fixed point index theory in cone. In particular, the uniqueness of positive solutions is obtained by means of Mathematics Analysis. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Comparative analysis of karyotypes among octoploid
   trititrigia and its original parents (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE T.aestivum; elytrigia intermedium; octoploid elytrigia; chromosome
   karyotype
ID YELLOW DWARF VIRUS; THINOPYRUM-INTERMEDIUM; RESISTANCE; WHEAT;
   POLYPLOIDS; LINES
AB This paper uses T. aestivum, elytrigia intermedium and their distant hybrid progeny octoploid trititrigia as the test materials, and makes comparative analysis of the chromosome karyotypes of the three species with which have phylogenetic relationships by chromosome tablet method. The results show that: T. aestivum yannong15 has the karyotype formula as 2n=6x=42=30m+12sm (4SAT), and its karyotype is 2A; Elytrigia intermedium has the karyotype formula as 2n=6x=42=16m+20sm (4SAT)+6st, and its karyotype is 3B; Their distant hybrid progeny octoploid trititrigia shannongTE0521 has the karyotype formula as 2n=8x=56=36m (2SAT)+20sm (2SAT), and its karyotype is 2B. According to the karyotype evolutionary theory by Stebbins and the nuclear-based cladistic method, as well as analysis of the 4 traits of the karyotype, the results shows that the evolution of the octoploid trititrigia is in the middle of its two original parents. It is in this paper gives the first report of the karyotype of octoploid rititrigia, and makes preliminary study on the chromosomes and genetic evolution relationships of octoploid trititrigia and its original parents. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Improved TFIDF weighting for imbalanced biomedical text
   classification (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Protein-Protein Interaction; Imbalanced text classification; Term
   weighting
AB The study of host pathogen protein-protein interactions (PPIs) is essential to understand the disease-causing mechanisms of human pathogens. A large number of scientific findings about PPIs are buried in the growing volume of biomedical literature. Document classification systems have been shown to have the potential to accelerate the curation process by retrieving PPI-related documents. However, it is usually a case that a small number of positive documents can be obtained manually or from PPI knowledge bases with literature-based evidence and there are a large number of negative documents. How to handle the imbalanced classification problem is becoming a hot topic in machine learning field. In this paper, we propose an Improved TFIDF (I_TFIDF) term weighting approach for imbalanced binary class text classification. It additionally considers two imbalanced factors (imbalanced occurring of term in two classes and imbalanced class distribution of training set). The proposed approach is compared with TFIDF term weighting approach utilizing Surport Vector Machine(SVM) machine learning on an imbalanced host pathogen protein-protein text corpora. The results demonstrate the proposed approach outperforms TFIDF approach and is obviously significant to improve the accuracy of classification of imbalanced data set. An automated classification system to identify MEDLINE abstracts referring to host-pathogen protein-protein interactions can been developed based on the experiment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Sentence extraction model on host pathogen protein-protein
   interaction documents (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Protein-protein interaction; Sentence extraction; Text classification
AB Protein-protein interactions (PPIs) are important in understanding the fundamental processes governing cell biology. However, a large number of scientific findings about PPIs are buried in the growing volume of biomedical literature. Sentence extraction system has the potential to accelerate the curation process by highlighting the PPI-related sentences. In this paper, we present a mixed model to extract the host pathogen PPI-related sentences based on 1360 host-pathogen protein-protein interactions documents and some tagged PPI-related sentences. The model includes three parts: Abstract-level classification, Sentence-Level classification, Knowledge rule matching. The results show that the proposed model is effective to extract host pathogen PPI-related sentences from the MEDLINE abstracts. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: MRI image denosing with fast nonlocal filtering (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE MR image; wavelet decomposition; nonlocal means; feature-preserving
ID NOISE; DIFFUSION
AB This paper presents a fast nonlocal means filtering method for medical MRI denoising. The noisy MR image is decomposed into different frequent sub-bands. Different strategies is performed to deal with wavelet coefficients: for the high frequent sub-bands, coefficients are processed with threshold; for the low frequent one, nonlocal means filtering is applied to removal noise. Experimental results on medical MRI images show that the the performance of the new method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on segmentation methods of brain using MRI images
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE MRI Images; Segmentation; Brain
AB This article makes a comparison between MRI image denoising methods. Self adaptation wiener filtering method is adopted as per image characteristics, and operations of grey level value technology and mathematical morphology are adopted to obtain head data. Regarding the segmentation of brain, the article raises a brain inspection method by constructing self adaptation template as per brain image characteristics and the geometric structure similarity between neighboring images. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Treatment Effect On Coking Wastewater Using Three-phase
   Biological Fluid-bed With New Ultrastructure Biological Carriers
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Biological Carrier; Ultrastructure; Three-phase Biological Fluid-bed;
   Coking Wastewater; COD
ID REACTOR
AB The degradation of COD and ammonia nitrogen (NH3-N) in coking wastewater was researched using the new ultrastructure biological carriers in three-phase aerobic biological fluid-bed. The results show that the optimum conditions of the new biological carriers are as follows: HRT of 20 h, neutrality skew alkaline pH (about 7.5) and dissolved oxygen (DO) of 2 similar to 5mg/L. Under the optimum conditions, the removal efficiency of COD and NH3-N can reach 82% and 87%, respectively, when the influent concentration of COD and NH3-N is about 3000 mg/L and 60mg/L. At the same time, comparison with the activated sludge process and common biological ceramist carriers, it is found that the most excellent treatment effect and the strongest resistance to impact are obtained under the condition of the shortest HRT in this new ultrastructure biological carriers reactor, and the effluent of two-stage reactors in series can reach the first national discharge standard, which will has a wide application prospect. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Na] NE Univ Qinhuangdao, Dept Environm Sci & Engn, Qinhuangdao 066004, Peoples R China.
RP Li, N (reprint author), NE Univ Qinhuangdao, Dept Environm Sci & Engn, Qinhuangdao 066004, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Using Variable Fuzzy Set Theory and Information Entropy for
   Air Pollution Risk Assessment in Beijing, China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Air pollution risk assessment; variable fuzzy set theory; information
   entropy; Beijing
ID SYNTHETIC EVALUATION; QUALITY
AB Considering that the air pollution risk assessment is a variable fuzzy concept with multiple indicators and classes and there is the limit for the weight value of variable fuzzy evaluation method, the variable fuzzy mathematics method and the information entropy are combined to evaluate the air pollution risk of different seasons in sixteen districts of Beijing in 2009. The multi-objective group decision-making problem under air pollution risk has been solved by variable fuzzy method and the weight problem has been modified by information entropy, which makes the evaluating results more objective. From quantitative assessment, the air pollution risk of winter season in south seven districts of Beijing was on the margin in 2009. Beijing needs to optimize energy structure by introducing and developing the use of cleaner high-quality energy to decrease air pollution risk grade on winter. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Wind Blow and Sand Burial Stress on Seedling
   Growth and Photosynthetic Properties of Caragana Microphylla (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wind blow; sand burial; growth; photosynthesis; transpiration
ID PLANTS; DUNES
AB A field sand burial experiment and a wind blowing experiment was conducted during 2006 and 2007 in the Horqin Sand Land to investigate the effects of wind blowing and sand burials on seedling growth and photosynthetic properties of Caragana microphylla. The results showed that 1) lightly sand burial (1/3 plant height) could synchronously hasten growth of stem and leaf and root and increase of biomass, moderate sand burial (2/3 plant height) only could stimulate root growth and biomass increase and restrain height growth; heavy sand burial (100% height) could result in death of most plant and poor growth of alive plant while all plant died under severe sand burial (130% plant height); 2) in the sweltering summer of Horqin Sand Land, it maybe not beneficial to photosynthesis and transpiration if moving speed of airflow is lower (2m s(-1), light air), suitable wind velocity (6m s(-1) gentle breeze) maybe beneficial to transpiration as well as photosynthesis. transpiration rate not also increased visibly, but also photosynthetic rate decreased in larger rang while wind velocity is >8.0m s(-1) which is not good for plant growth. 3) although C. microphylla as a dominant shrub of fixed sand has certain ability to adapt wind blowing and sand burial, but severe sand burial and strong wind blowing should resulted in severe damage so much as death to C. microphylla, so it pay much attention that don't plant C. microphylla in upper intensively areas of wind-sand activity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effect of Irrigation and Fertilizer on Sandy Grassland
   Productivity in Horqin Sandy Land, North China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Horqin Sandy Land; Biomass; Water consumption of vegetation; Water use
   efficiency; Irrigation and Fertilizer; Land productivity
AB A split-plot field experiment, with watering as main plot and with fertilizer as sub-plot, was carried out in degraded sandy grassland in Horqin Sandy Land. Four treatments (0mm, 30mm, 60mm and 90mm) for watering and four treatments (0 kg/hm(2), 150 kg/hm2, 375 kg/hm(2), 600 kg/hm(2)) for fertilizer as nitrogen were designed. Results showed that the soil water storage was significant affected by rainfall in this grassland. Watering factor had significant influence on the soil water storage in 0-30cm depths but no significant influence for deeper than 30cm soil layer. Both the watering and fertilizer took important roles in increasing biomass in degraded sandy grassland. The highest above-biomass appeared at the plot in 90mm with 128.3g/m(2) among watering treatments and at the sub-plot in 600 kg/ha with 147.3g/m(2) between fertilizer treatments, respectively. The water consumption and WUE of each of treatments was 379mm / 0.28 kg/mm.hm(2) in 90mm treatment, 350mm/0.38 kg/mm.hm(2) for 60mm treatment, 313mm / 0.34 kg/mm.hm(2) for 30mm treatment, and 294 mm /0.35 kg/mm.hm(2) for control (0mm), respectively. Based on comprehensive analysis, we can conclude that the basic amount of evapotranspiration in this grassland was 294mm. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Tong-Hui; Zhao, Ha-Lin; Zhao, Xue-Yong] Cold & Arid Reg Environm & Engn Res Inst, Lanzhou 730000, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Adsorption of Heavy Metalion in Metallurgical
   Wastewater by Sepiolite (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Heavy metal; pollution soil; mining activities; geoaccumulation
AB In this study, the sorption of heavy metals (Cu2+, Pb2+, Zn2+ and Cd2+) from simulated metallurgical wastewater by sepiolite under different dosage, pH, adsorption time and temperature conditions was investigated. The results showed that adsorption increased with the increase of adsorbent dosage until the adsorption equilibrium was reached. When the pH is 6, adsorption of heavy metal ions by sepiolite was in the order of Cu2+> Zn2+> Pb2+> Cd2+ and removal rates of the metal ion were 91%, 90%, 91%, 84%, respectively. The effect of adsorption time on adsorption was not significant. At room temperature, with the adsorption time 45 min, the adsorption of metal ions is almost saturated, adsorption of Cu2+, Pb2+, Cd2+ and Zn2+ was 13.05mg/g, 85.47mg/g, 62.36mg/g and 15.67mg/g, respectively. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhou, Xiuyan; Xue, Xiangxin; Jiang, Wenming] Northeastern Univ, Sch Mat & Met, Shenyang, Peoples R China.
RP Zhou, XY (reprint author), Northeastern Univ, Sch Mat & Met, Shenyang, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Perennial Trends of Wastewater Discharge and Pollutant
   Content in Rivers of Shanghai (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Shanghai; Water Environment; Water Pollution; Changjiang Estuary;
   Huangpu River; Shanghai Sea
AB Water Environment in Shanghai got more and more attentions. The hotspots are wastewater discharge and pollutant content in Changjiang and Huangpu rivers. From 1981 to 2009, the city wastewater discharge was fluctuated between 1800*10(6) ton and 2400*10(6) ton. Inside, the gross of industrial wastewater was trendily decreasing from more than 1300*10(6) ton at 1980s to about 700*10(6) ton recently years. The percent of industrial wastewater was decreasing continuously from 76.88% at 1981 to 28.42% at 2009. The gross of living wastewater was increasing trendily, it related with increasing of city population. In the same period, the living wastewater per year for per person was increasing from about 37 ton at the beginning of 1980s to 80 ton at recent year, about 1.2 times increasing in past 30 years. The month flux of chemical pollutant discharged by Changjiang River was between 259*10(3) ton to 2096*10(3) ton in recently years. The average pollutant gross carried by Changjiang River in year, was about 5934.5*10(3) ton among 2002 to 2009; about 83.68% was COD. Other pollutants were nutrients, oil, heavy metal and arsenic, the variability was larger with year. The month flux of pollutant carried by Huangpu River was 25.6*10(3) ton, more than 63% was COD averagely. The pollutant gross had an increasing trend year by year. Generally, the percent of pollutant from Huangpu River was about 3.6 to 4.4% compared with that in Changjiang River. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Numerical and Ecological Assessment of Plant Community'S
   Pattern in Most Environmentally Disturbed Areas of Northern Togo
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Diversity; plant community; DCA; Barkoissi; Galangashi; Oti-Keran; Togo
AB The 170 releves obtained from sampling investigation in Barkoissi, Galangashi and Oti-Keran protected areas (Northern Togo) were subjected to several multivariate analyses. The study has the aim to identify and to describe the main plant communities and the major environment factor which influence the species distribution. The Detrended Correspondence Analysis (DCA) and Hierarchical clustering were used to ordinate and to classify samples which led, to determine the major plant communities. The plant community was defined by Indicator Value such as fidelity and abundance. The results showed that seven plant communities were identified with the 170 releves. The releves were well distributed in DCA factorial plan formed by axe 1 and 2. The plant communities were distributed along the moisture gradient in the DCA ordination. The diversity indices in both plant communities are well significant and indicate a good distribution of species in the area. In overall, few plant communities show high similarity between them. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Feasible use of Cement Treated Crushed Waste Clay Brick
   Aggregate as Road Subbase (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Cement treated aggregate; Crushed waste brick; Subbase; Performance
ID CONCRETE
AB This Laboratory tests were conducted to investigate the possibility of using crushed waste clay brick as aggregates in cement treated materials for sub-base. In this study, Five kinds of aggregates which contained 0%, 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% crushed bricks were treated by 5% cement respectively. The results indicated that cement treated aggregates which contains crushed waste brick had a lower MDD and a higher OMC. This was mainly attributed to the lower density and higher water rate of crushed brick compared to those of natural aggregate. Moreover, the replacement of natural aggregate by crushed brick further decreased the UCS, tensile splitting strength and frost resistance index of cement treated aggregate and increased the thermal shrinkage coefficient of the cement treated aggregate slightly. Although the use of crushed waste bricks affected the mechanical properties of cement treated aggregate, the UCSs of all mixtures in this study were greater than 1.5 MPa, which is a minimum UCS requirements of cement treated aggregate sub-base material for asphalt pavement design specifications in China. The cement treated aggregate which contains crushed brick should be used cautiously in the frozen region due to its poor frost resistance performance. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Urban Area Vegetation Changing Assessment over the Last 20
   Years Based on NDVI (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE NDVI; Land change; Biomass; Lome
AB To assess land change around Lome urban and peri-urban areas, the logical technique of RGB-NDVI associated to unsupervised classification was applied to three satellite images of different dates. The normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) was computed for the three images to define high and low vegetation biomass. Then colour composites were generated by combining each date of NDVI with either the red, green and blue (RGB) image layers in an image. The output of the classified image was interpreted by the means of additive colour to detect biomass change (vegetation reduction and regeneration) across the landscape on the multitemporal NDVI classified colour composite. The analysis results show that, in a whole, there was a great change in land resources, especially between 1986 and 2001. The landscape dynamics, such us biomass degradation or restoration is more visible between 2001 and 2007. Althoug there was a small area so far well conserved, it remains under urbanization high pressure. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Life Cycle Simulation based Evaluation of End-of-life
   Management of Mechelectronic Product in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Household electrical appliance; Refrigerator; Reuse; Recycling; Life
   Cycle; Simulation
ID ELECTRONIC-WASTE
AB Given the growing stock of household electrical appliances, China is faced with an urgent challenge of management of household appliances massive disposal. Unfortunately, the majority of waste household appliances are now processed in small workshops mainly by manual disassembly and open incineration which are extremely polluting and health-harming in China. In response to the increasing environmental concerns over household appliance end-of-life treatment, The Regulations on the Administration of the Recovery and Disposal of Waste Electrical and Electronic Products (WEEE Regulations), was promulgated in 2009. To discuss the potential benefits from the implementation of the Regulations, a holistic understanding of the waste appliance recycling business and after-end-of -life markets is indispensable. This paper presents a life cycle simulation model to evaluate the potential environmental benefits from the improved end-of-life management. The proposed model provides a mathematical description of close-loop lifecycles and yields quantitative results of energy and raw material consumption and waste generation. Then, as a case study, the environmental benefits of household refrigerator recycling and reuse system compliant to the Regulations is analyzed based on comparison of simulation results of two scenarios respectively representing implementing and not implementing of the Regulations. The proposed model is expected to facilitate policy-and decision-making on product recycling and reuse. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Tao, Jing; Yu, Suiran] Shanghai Jiao Tong Univ, Sch Mech & Power Engn, 800 Dongchuan Rd, Shanghai 200240, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Review of Climate Change in the Arctic (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Arctic; sea ice retreat; atmospheric circulation; global warming
ID SEA-ICE; FRESH-WATER; BERING STRAIT; OCEAN; CIRCULATION; TRANSPORT;
   NORTH; PACIFIC; MODEL; HEAT
AB Dramatic changes in Arctic climate have been noted during the past century. Increasing oceanic temperature, ice melting and ocean freshening not only affect the Arctic but also become a global Environment Problem. We review the change of atmospheric climate, the retreat of sea ice, the freshwater loss and discuss the mechanisms that contributed to these changes. Then we analyze the interaction between the Arctic and the North Pacific and the interaction between the Arctic and the Atlantic. Finally we summarize the role that the climate change in the Arctic played in the global climate change. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Suburban-rural Contrasts of Radiation Budget in Beijing
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Shortwave radiation; Longwave radiation; Net radiation; Albedo; Beijing
ID CENTRAL-EUROPEAN CITY; ENERGY-BALANCE; MEXICO-CITY; URBAN AREAS; FLUXES;
   PARAMETERIZATION
AB Based on measurements of radiation fluxes at a suburban and a rural site in Beijing city simultaneously during the period from June to December in 2009, the contrastive characteristics and diurnal variations of radiation budget and surface albedo at different landscapes were analyzed. The results show that daily mean values of radiation components and net radiation in summer were higher than those in winter at study sites. Moreover, diurnal values of radiation components and net radiation were generally smaller at suburban than those at rural site, except for upward longwave radiation. Mean albedo values in summer was 0.149 at suburban and 0.152 at rural sites, which separately lower than 0.335 at suburban and 0.278 rural sites in winter, due to solar angle and surface seasonal characteristics. More radiation measurements to conduct at various urban land-use types are required in the further. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Dou Junxia; Liu Weidong; Xiong Bin] China Meteorol Adm, Inst Urban Meteorol, Beijing 100089, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: An Assessment on the Adaptation of ISO 14000 in the
   Fertilizer Industry of Bangladesh for the Sustainable Development
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ISO 14000; Chemical Fertilizer; Soil nutrient; Soil acidification;
   Environment; Sustainability; Adaptation scenario
AB To enhance the productivity of the land, different types of fertilizer is being used. Basically, different drivers like the demand of crops, variation in the price of output and changing relative factors are influencing to increase the use of fertilizer. However, increased use and unplanned production of fertilizer has an adverse impact on the environment. But that type of hidden cost is not possible to measure objectively. So, it seems plausible to internalize these types of cost. ISO 14000 is one that helps firm to reduce the adverse impact on environment. This paper explores the current situation of the fertilizer (chemical) sector of Bangladesh regarding the implementation of ISO 14000. Empirical results indicate that fertilizer sector is enjoying the growth without ensuring ISO 14000 properly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Life Cycle Energy Statistical Analysis Of Buildings By
   Literature Review (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Operating energy; Life cycle energy; Statistical analysis
ID PERFORMANCE
AB Based on life cycle theory, this article divided life cycle energy into embodied energy and operating energy, then analyzed case data on 63 buildings from 10 countries. First, this article applied linear regression analysis to build a linear model. High degree of coefficient of determination indicated high correlation existing between operating energy and life cycle energy. Further, the article employed one-sample t-test and compared the means of embodied energy in order to prove that low-energy buildings could reduce operating energy as well as embodied energy at present. At last, by one-way analysis of variance, this study showed the energy used in office buildings was much greater than that used in residential buildings. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
