TI RETRACTED: The Application Prospect Analysis of Superconducting HGMS
   Technology in Converter Dedusting Water Treatment (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE converter dedusting water; superconducting HGMS; flocculation; magnetic
   separation
AB The treatment process and progress specified to converter dedusting water quality are analyzed and discussed. Flocculation is conventional treatment of converter dedusting water, and the magnetic flocculation has been paid more and more attention. As a new sewage treatment technology, the superconducting high gradient magnetic separation (HGMS) has many advantages, such as small floor space, high efficiency, low operation cost, and energy saving, and so on. So the superconducting high gradient magnetic separation has wide application prospect in converter dedusting water treatment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Carbon Dioxide Capture Technology (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE carbon dioxide; capture; chemical absorption; Proportion Pressure Swing
   Adsorption (PPSA); flue gas; biogas
ID SWING ADSORPTION PROCESS; PLANT FLUE-GAS; CO2
AB Carbon dioxide is one of greenhouse gases. The development and application of carbon dioxide capture storage technology can not only alleviate the current pressure on the environment of global warming, but also can bring huge economic benefits. At present, the commonly methods of carbon dioxide separation are chemical absorption, physical absorption, membrane separation and adsorption separation. These Separation methods all have own characteristics in economy, selectivity and applicability. But Chemical Absorption Method and PSA are used more widely in industry. So several capture methods by chemical absorption or PSA were suggested for carbon dioxide emission form flue gas in coal-fired power plant, exhaust gas of industrial furnace or biogas. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: River Corridor Greenway in Urban Environment: Perception and
   Use of East Ho Chung River Greenway in Guangzhou (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE River corridor; Perception; use; East Ho Chung River; Greenway
ID RECREATION; SYSTEM
AB Recently river corridors in Guangzhou are being focused on as important natural networks in urban environment as well as cultural and recreational resources. This paper took East Ho Chung River Greenway in Guangzhou as an object to do some comprehensive evaluation of its built environment by the method of the post occupancy evaluation (POE), such as questionnaires, interviews and statistics. The questionnaire is divided into 6 categories, such as facilities, green space, signs and maps, transport, security and management, and recreational activities in external environment. Through the analysis, we identified six human dimensions in the studies: cleanliness, aesthetic, comfort, safety, suitability and hydrophilic property. As a result of this research, some problems on the evaluation were grasped by the hierarchy process analysis based on the six categories and user's six human dimensions. We concluded by discussing solutions of these problems, and suggested some proposals in design to meet the users' requirement for the future construction of greenway. This study aims to improve the quality of East Ho Chung River Greenway's built environment, and to make the greenway design more scientific. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Quantitative Analysis of Thermal Environment of Adjustable
   Window Shutters in Summer of Tianjin (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE adjustable external blinds; thermal environment; finite element analysis
AB According to the climatic characteristics in Tianjin where lies in the cold climate regions of China, the passage describes a technique called adjustable external blinds which is to enhance the architectural thermal comfort degree. This technique based on a series of experiments of architectures with different orientations in local climatic condition and numerical analysis of thermal environment with finite element method afterwards. This paper shows that alumina shutter has great advantages which can isolate indoor heat greatly in summer of Tianjin, and some optimization measures has also been adopted in order to improve indoor thermal comfort. TI RETRACTED: Study on Magnesia Flue Gas Desulfurization (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE magnesia; flue gas desulfurization; magnesia activity; sulfite oxidation
AB This paper studied the magnesia flue gas desulfurization technology. It also carried out single-factor desulfurization and sulfite oxidation experiments by exploring the activity of magnesia after calcination and slaking process of magnesia slurry. The results show that residence time and slaking time had a negligible effect on the activity of magnesia in 7 days after calcination. In the experimental range, SO2 removal efficiency decreased by increasing the gas flow and inlet SO2 concentration. The SO2 removal efficiency increased with the increase in liquid-gas ratio, absorption temperature, concentration of magnesia slurry, and residence time of magnesia slurry. Magnesium sulfate with a certain concentration added to the magnesia solution has no effect on the desulfurization and oxidation of sulfite. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Yu; Mai, Chao; Zhou, Jiti] Dalian Univ Technol, Key Lab Ind Ecol & Environm Engn MOE, Sch Environm Sci & Technol, Dalian 116024, Peoples R China.

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE Calibrating; Mental Ray; SM light environment measuring system; light
   exposure; grey level; luminance
AB Besides illumination calculating during architecture and luminous environment design, to provide more varieties of photometric data, the paper presents combining relation between luminous environment design and SM light environment measuring system, which contains a set of experiment devices including light information collecting and processing modules, and can offer us various types of photometric data. During the research process, we introduced a simulation method for calibration, which mainly includes rebuilding experiment scenes in 3ds Max Design, calibrating this computer aid design software in simulated environment under conditions of various typical light sources, and fitting the exposure curves of rendered images. As analytical research went on, the operation sequence and points for attention during the simulated calibration were concluded, connections between Mental Ray renderer and SM light environment measuring system were established as well. From the paper, valuable reference conception for coordination between luminous environment design and SM light environment measuring system was pointed out. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: An Overview on Modern Biogas Utilizing Technology of
   Livestock Manure (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Animal manure pollution; Resource utilization; ACP; UASB; USR
AB In China, the scale livestock plants are developing very fast at present. It has resulted serious environmental pollution problems. The aim of this study is to provide technical methods how to treat and manage livestock manure produced in the scale culture plant. Authors collected a large of literature about livestock manure. The status of the livestock culture scale and its pollution in China were summarized at first. Livestock manure is a sort of valuable resource according to its chemical composition. Biogas technology, used to treat livestock manure, can save energy and reduce carbon emission. Biogas is a renewable energy. Biogas residue is a kind of high quality organic fertilizer. So, the popular anaerobic processes about animal manure treating were summarized in the paper. They are anaerobic contact process (ACP), the Up flow anaerobic sludge blanket (UASB), and upflow solid reactor (USR). Some engineering cases of these technologies also were provided. In the end, technology and method of preventing livestock manure pollution were forecasted. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Odor and VOCs Removal in Wastewater Treatment Plant by a
   Two-stage Biofilter (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wastewater treatment plant; two-stage biofilter; odor; volatile organic
   compounds
ID BIOTECHNOLOGY
AB Biofiltration is one of the major treatment processes for odor and volatile organic compounds (VOCs) control. In this study, a two-stage biofilter was developed to treat odor and VOCs from sludge dewatering facility of a wastewater treatment plant(WWTP) in ShanDong province. The objectives were to evaluate the performance and effectiveness of the two-stage biofilter to treat odor and VOCs. The main compounds emitted from the WWTP were sulfide hydrogen, ammonia and total volatile organic compounds containing acetone, acetic acid and toluene. Results indicated that the two-stage biofilter can remove the inlet odor and VOCs efficiently. Compounds with different characteristics were removed in different stage, respectively. Most of sulfide hydrogen and toluene were biooxidized by acidophilic thiobacilli and fungi in the first stage which operated at low pH. And the removal efficiencies of other hydrophilic compounds were higher in the second stage which operated at high pH. The two-stage biofilter has been proved to be an efficient system to treat the complex mixture of odor and VOCs emitted from the WWTP. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Long-term Changes of Nitrogen, Carbon and Phosphor Fluxes of
   a Typical Agricultural Landscape in North China Plain (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE biogeochemistry; C; N; P; nutrient flux; agricultural landscape
AB Biogeochemical cycles of carbon, nitrogen, phosphor and sulfur are the most important processes in agricultural landscape, which more or less contributes to global changes. Based on the resource data got from household surveys combined with land use data derived from remote sensing imagery, this article studied on the long-term changes of main life elements (C, N and P) fluxes in a typical agricultural landscape of North China Plain. The results show that C and N balances of large-scale irrigated land changed from deficits (-865kg/hm2 C and -9kg/hm2 N) in 1945 into great surpluses (1761kg/hm2 C and 213kg/hm2 N) in 2002, respectively, and P surpluses also doubled in 2002. However, C and N fluxes showed deficit during both periods with more significantly in 2002. C, N and P fluxes in whole arable landscape showed significant surpluses despite of 18.75% total arable area decrease in 2002 than that in 1945. Contrarily, C and N fluxes of arable landscape in 1945 showed overall deficits. Nutrient flux changes of arable landscape are impacted mainly by the changes of fertilizer input, land productivity, crop residue utility and arable land types. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Comprehensive Study on Tidal Energy & Vertical Axis Tidal
   Turbine-corrosion Prevention Solution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Tidal energy; vertical axis tidal turbine; cross flow water turbine;
   corrosion; cathodic protection
ID MARINE CURRENT TURBINES; FLOW CONDITIONS; POWER; CAVITATION
AB Estuarine processes have long been important to oceanographic researcher. The closeness of estuaries to land & the diversity of physical activity found within them have stimulated interest in estuaries as individual systems. An overview of the current design practices in the field of renewable energy is presented; also paper delineates the background to the development of unique & novel techniques for power generation using the kinetic energy of tidal streams & other marine currents. Tidal stream devices have been developed as an alternative method of extracting the energy from the tides. This form of tidal power technology poses less threat to the environment & does not face the same limiting factors associated with tidal barrage schemes, therefore making it a more feasible method of electricity production. Universally the tides can be harness with tidal turbines-of which there are two main bifurcation-vertical axis & horizontal axis. In this paper only the vertical axis tidal turbine is focused. Some suggestion & corrosion prevention techniques are also discussed in this study. In addition, the progression of technological advancements tracing several decades of R&D efforts on vertical axis turbines are highlighted. The purpose of this review paper is to build up a confidence level for further study in this field in depth. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Tree Age on Climate Signal-Evidence from Young and
   Old Trees in a Temperature Forest (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE tree-rings; age; climate signals
ID RING GROWTH-RESPONSES; DENDROCLIMATIC RECONSTRUCTION
AB This analysis aims to evaluate the hypothesis that the effect of age on the climate signals should be considered, even if the inherent biological trend has been removed using dendroecological techniques. 72 young and old Pinus koraiensis trees from broad-leaved and coniferous mixed forests were disaggregated into two age classes, the young trees (average age 63 years) and the old trees (average age 184 years) and analyzed to evaluate this hypothesis. Our results that tree-ring width tendencies and climate signals are age-related support the hypothesis that sensitivity to particular climatic conditions varies with age. Firstly, young trees always grow faster than old ones at the same climate condition. Secondly, young trees are more sensitive to mean temperature. While the growth of old trees correlates with monthly precipitation. In addition, common dendrochronological techniques can remove the natural biological growth trend, but lose more climate information with low frequency, especially for young trees. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Comparative Study of Adsorption of Cr(VI) from Water by
   Commercial Absorbent and by Activated Carbons Prepared from Agriculture
   Wastes (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Vegetable precursors; CAC; adsorption; Cr(VI); isotherm; kinetic
ID FLY-ASH; REMOVAL; ADSORBENT; KINETICS; SORPTION; IONS; BLUE; DYE
AB Vegetable Precursors banana peels and maize cob were prepared as adsorbents for the adsorption of Cr(VI) from aqueous solutions and Commercial activated carbon in granular form was also used. Cr(VI) concentration and pH were varied. The adsorption capacities were decreased in the order for CAC > MC > BP. The isotherm data could be well described by the Freundlich and Langmuir equations in the concentration range of 50-300 mg/l. An acidic pH was favorable for the adsorption of Cr(VI). Based on the adsorption capacity, it was shown that CAC was more effective absorbent than maize cob followed by banana peels. Kinetic parameters of adsorption such as the pseudo-second-order kinetic rate constants were determined. Both agriculture wastes(MC and BP) and commercial activated charcoal (CAC) were shown to be used successfully materials for adsorption removal of Cr(VI) from aqueous solutions. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Mande, Seyf-Laye Alfa-Sika; Liu, Fei; Chen, Honghan] China Univ Geosci, Beijing Key Lab Water Resources Environm Engn, Beijing, Peoples R China.
RP Mande, SLAS (reprint author), China Univ Geosci, Beijing Key Lab Water Resources Environm Engn, Beijing, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: The Methods of Improving Indoor Air Quality (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Indoor air quality (IAQ); Nanometer TiO2; Photocatalytic degradation;
   Interior landscape plants
AB Indoor air quality (IAQ) of residential building is closely related to human health. By measurements of formaldehyde, benzene, ammonia, total volatile organic compounds (TVOCS) and radon in new decorated residential building in Hangzhou, we found 53.3% sampleds of TVOCS, 50% samples of formaldehyde,,16.7% samples of ammonia exceed of China's national standard for indoor air environmental pollution respectively. The methods of improving IAQ are discussed in this thesis. The main study is on degradation and absorption of formaldehyde using nanometer TiO2 photocatalyst and parts of interior landscape plants. Anatase phase TiO2 photocatalyst supported on fiberglass cloth was prepared by using sol-gel method. The experiments of formaldehyde photocatalytic degradation were conducted with nanometer TiO2 photocatalyst prepared at temperature of 400 degrees C, 450 degrees C, 500 degrees C respectively. The result indicates that TiO2 photocatalyst prepared at 450 degrees has the best photocatalytic activity. The experiments result of formaldehyde absorption with seven kinds of interior landscape plants shows that improving IAQ with interior landscape plants is effective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Geochemical Investigation of Groundwater's of Shallow Coastal
   Aquifer in and around Lome (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Geochemical; groundwater; multivariate statistical; nitrate; water type
AB The quantities of chemical components in groundwater samples were determined and submitted to statistical analysis. The majority of the samples contained high concentrations of Na+ (37-1430 mg/L) and Cl-(60.06 - 2682.94 mg/L) (Na-Cl water type), indicate the intrusion of salt water into the groundwater. The samples also contained high concentrations of NO3- (0.4-377 mg/L), which is a serious water quality issue. This nitrate originates from the soil surface and enters the groundwater by infiltration. The high content of these chemical components, which has disadvantage on drinking water, proves the giving up of the boreholes by the population. Multivariate statistical techniques used in this study were enable to identify the key parameters which describe groundwater quality and to characterize the spatial variability of groundwater quality data. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Multi-scale Analysis of The Annual Runoff Records of Lower
   Nandujiang River within 45 Years Based on Morlet Wavelet (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wavelet analysis; Lower Nandujiang River; annual runoff; variation
   tendency
ID CLIMATE-CHANGE; BASIN; CHINA; IMPACTS; XINJIANG; PROVINCE; REGION; FLOW
AB Multi-scale continuous wavelet analysis is carried out for annual runoff of Lower Nandujiang River. The analysis is based on the runoff data observed at Longtang Hydrological Station of Nandujiang River from the year 1956 to 2000. Based on wavelet analysis, variation tendency of annual discharge in Lower Nandujiang River is predicted. Analysis results show that the Morlet wavelet applies well to natural runoff prediction in this area. The variation intensity of annual runoff of Lower Nandujiang River shows intensive fluctuations at time scales of 3 similar to 7 years, 9 similar to 19 years and 25 similar to 39 years. Besides, the periodic components of runoff time-series are identified and extracted according to wavelet variance. Quantitative analysis shows that the major period of runoff variation of Lower Nandujiang River is 13 years. Prediction results provide valuable information for urban planning of Haikou City, where Lower Nandujiang River flows into the sea. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Experimental Study on Miniature Biogas Generating System
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE miniature biogas; generator; biogas generating system
AB Based on the biogas combustion characteristic, miniature gasoline generator was refitted by increasing the compression ratio, selecting or self-designing precipitator, desulfurization device, gas pressure stabilizer and mixer unit etc, to form a complete set of miniature biogas generator systems. This paper discussed the design of pressure stabilizer and mixer and the methods and results of testing. The experimental results indicate that: refitted miniature biogas generator can start normally and operate stably, all the performance indexes correspond with dynamo requirements, and generating power can satisfy a household daily electricity demand. The application of the system can not only solve the difficulty of people's electricity in remote mountainous area but also provide an efficient way for relieving the shortage of goods electricity supply. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on Litter Hydrological Properties of Inefficient
   Forest in Jinyun Mountain (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE litter; hydrological properties; maximum water holding rate; water
   conservation
AB The purpose of this paper is to transform inefficient water conservation forests in Jinyun Mountain, as well as provide a basis for inefficient forest transformation. In this paper, we get forest reserves, maximum water holding capacity, maximum water holding rate and some hydrological parameters of different forest litter types through the water-holding characteristics analysis of three kinds of litter in Jinyun Mountain. The litter reserve of standard plot one is 874.33g/m(2), 980g/m(2) in standard plot two, and 264.22g/m(2) in standard plot three. The maximum water holding rate of undecomposed layer of standard plot one is 183.56%, 177.98% in standard plot two, and 219.49% in standard plot three. The maximum water holding rate of semi-decomposed layer of standard plot one is 246.08%, 106.08% in standard plot two, and 250.88% in standard plot three. The maximum water holding capacity of undecomposed layer of standard plot one is 684.68g/m(2), 557.66g/m(2) in standard plot two, and 180.23g/m(2) in standard plot three. The maximum water holding capacity of semi-decomposed layer of standard plot one is 1167.23g/m(2), 707.20g/m(2) in standard plot two, and 456.88g/m(2) in standard plot three. The results indicated that the maximum water holding capacity from high to low is standard plot one > standard plot two > standard plot three. The maximum water holding rate from high to low is standard plot three > standard plot one > standard plot two. The water holding capacity of coniferous and broadleaf mixed forest litter is more than coniferous mixed forest litter. It is further illustrates that the more complex stand structure, the more water holding capacity of litter will be. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Yang; Rao, Liangyi; Wang, Baitian] Beijing Forestry Univ, Coll Soil & Water Conservat, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Multi-objective Allocation of Distributed Generation
   Considering Low-Carbon Effect (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE distributed generation; multi-objective planning; low-Carbon Effects;
   maximum satisfaction method; plant growth simulation algorithm
AB Analysis of low-Carbon for all aspects of power system is summarized. To optimize allocation of distributed generation in distribution network, three indexes are introduced to evaluate distributed generation (DG) profits, namely low-carbon expense index, voltage security index and active power loss index, furthermore, the multi-objective optimization model for distributed generation was established, the multi-objective program is turned into a single objective program with the maximum satisfaction method. An artificial intelligent algorithm namely the plant growth simulation algorithm (PGSA), is employed to solve the optimal planning of DG. Calculation example shows that the proposed optimal planning model of DG is effective and feasible; the simulating results illustrate the correctness and availability of the proposed algorithm. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Impact of Vanilin in Hydrolysate of Corn Stalk on L-lactic
   Acid Fermentation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Corn stalk; Vanillin; Hydrolysis; By-products; L(+)-lactic acid
ID ETHANOL; BIOMASS
AB During the liquid hot water pretreatment of lignocellulosic materials such as corn stalk, hemicellulose is hydrolyzed into monosaccharides, and meanwhile, toxic by-products are simultaneously generated, which may influence L-lactic acid fermentation. Studies on the inhibitory effects of the by-products on L-lactic acid fermentation are of practical use for further improvement of L-lactic acid yield from lignocellulosic materials. In this study, one by-product, vanillin, was identified in the hydrolysate of local corn stalk, which was added into the medium at different concentrations to study their impacts on the growth and L-lactic acid fermentation of a Rhizopus oryzae (AS3.819). The work indicated that L-lactic acid production was inhibited by vanillin to a lesser extent than that to the growth. Vanillin caused a much longer lag-phase in growth when the concentration was 0.8 g/l, which showed remarkably inhibition effect, and the lag-phase was not obvious at lower concentrations. At the concentration of 1 g/l, vanillin completely inhibited the fermentation as well as the cell growth. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhe Liu; Yang Ruifeng; Lu Jie] Dalian Polytech Univ, Dalian 116034, Peoples R China.
RP Lu, J (reprint author), Dalian Polytech Univ, Dalian 116034, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Identification of Fault Based on Wavelet Neural Network with
   Increased Momentum (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Underwater vehicle; fault diagnosis; wavelet neural network; increased
   momentum
AB Aiming at the complicated uncertain underwater environment, wavelet neural network with increased momentum is proposed to construct the motion model of underwater vehicle in this paper. The wavelet neural network has the capability of approximation and catching detail changes of the function by adjusting the scale and shift factors of wavelet. Then fault diagnose are put forward by comparing the residuals error between the estimated output of neural network and the real state value. The results show that the fault diagnosis method based on wavelet neural network with increased momentum is feasible and effective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Studies on Photoperiod Sensitivity and Suitable Sowing and
   Transplanting Dates for Super Rice Xieyou 9308 as a Double-cropping Late
   Rice (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Xieyou 9308; Photoperiod sensitive; Sowing date; Transplanting date
AB This paper had studied on photoperiod sensitivity and suitable sowing and transplanting dates for super rice Xieyou 9308 as a double-cropping late rice with Shanyou 10 as control. For expirement of sowing date, 5 treatments were set up respectively sowing on June 10, June 15, June 20, June 25, June 30 for Xieyou9308 and for expirement of transplanting date, 5 other treatments were set up respectively transplanting on July 15, July 20, July 25, July 30, August 4 for Xieyou9308 with all treatments sown on June 20, with Shouyou 10 as the control. This experiment was conducted Under the natural field environment in Wenzhou, China. The result showed that photoperiod sensitivity of Xieyou 9308 was stronger than that of Shanyou 10. Sowing from June 10 to June 30, the full heading stage advanced by 1 day for super rice 9308 and Shanyou 10 by 2 days with advanced sowing every 5 days. The optimum sowing date for Xieyou 9308 was fixed on June 25 according to conditions of light and temperature in Wenzhou. Too early sowing can not significantly advanced the full heading stage, but the yield of rice cut down because of the extension of seedling age and lower quality of seedling, and too late sowing will effect on the full heading of rice because of low temperature after late September. Sowing simultaneously on June 20 and transplanting from July 15 to August 4, the full heading stages advaced about 1 day with advanced transplanting every 5 days for Xieyou 9308 and Shanyou 10, and the yields of earlier transplanting trearments were significantly higher than that of later transplanting treatments. Due to its strong photoperiod sensitivity and longer growth period, Xieyou 9308 should be transplanted as early as possible when it is planted as a double-cropping late rice. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Preparation and Identification of anti-Ractopamine Monoclonal
   antibodies (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ractopamine; Artificial antigen; Monoclonal antibody; Indirect
   competitive ELISA; Heterologous
ID SWINE; HYDROCHLORIDE; FEEDS
AB This study aimed to prepare high-sensitivity monoclonal antibodies against Ractopamine (Rac), which provided a solid foundation for icELISA kit. Mixed anhydride method was employed to synthesize the immunogen of Rac-BSA and 1,4-butanediol diglycidyl ether was used to prepare the coating antigen of Rac-OVA, thus pursue the heterologous sensitivity. Through cell fusion technology, four Hybridoma cell lines named R1-B5, R2-B3, R2-C6, and R4-C8 were screened out, their corresponding mAbs were of the IgG(1) isotype with k light chain, and the Kafs of all mAbs were between 2.7 and 4.8x10(9) L/mol. Based on the R1-B5, a heterologous icELISA method was developed. The working range was from 0.013 to 33.7 ng/mL, with LOD and IC50 value of 0.007 ng/mL and 0.67 ng/mL, respectively. Except for a higher cross-reactivity (42.7%) to Dobutamine, negligible cross-reactivity to the other compounds was observed. The recoveries of Rac were in the range of 98.2-109.5%, 85.7-110.5% and 97.4-101.8% for cattle muscle, liver and kidney, respectively, with coefficients of variation (CV) values all <10%. When applied in real samples, the correlation coefficient (R-2) of the ELISA and LC-MS was 0.9373 in cattle muscle. Therefore, this assay can be used for detecting Rac residue in animal products. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Preliminary research of carbon-sink effect of Tianjin's
   wetlands system in the context of global climate change (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wetland system; carbon sink; global Climate Change; Tianjin
AB Hydrosphere environment is the most susceptible fundamental systems subjects to current global climate change. The unique geographical feature and developing potential of Tianjin wetlands systems has impacted on the local water environment severely. In this article, preliminary estimation of restorable wetlands area and its atmosphere values has been made. Based on assessed potential carbon sink capacity, it is deduced that wetlands system would help restoring carbon sink in Tianjin area. The purpose of this research is to provide strategies aiming to improve the ecological security pattern, whilst maintaining economic development of Tianjin area. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Oxygen Concentrating and Application of Life Safety System
   for Workers in High Altitude Area (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE high altitud; hypoxia; Low Pressure Swing Adsorption; oxygen supply;
   life safety sysytem; acute mountain sickness
AB In order to solve hypoxic problems in high altitude area and ensure workers life safety, a new cycle named as Low Pressure Swing Adsorption for oxygen concentration was proposed. In this cycle, the high efficiency liking Vacuum Pressure Swing Adsorption was obtained but the vacuum was not used. The relationship between oxygen concentration and oxygen flux was revealed. And the matching air content curve in different altitudes was acquired. Basing on the experiment data, the life safety system with oxygen supplied for workers was suggested. After using this system, the oxygen partial pressure of the tunnel face could be enhanced by 2 - 3 kPa and the incidence of AMS in the workers decreased significantly, blood oxygen saturation increased, pulse rate and breaths per minute decreased. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Screening and Application of Nitrifying Bacteria at Low
   Temperature (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Biological enhancement at low temperature; Nitrobacteria; Isolation;
   Acclimation
ID NITROGEN REMOVAL; OXIDATION
AB A method of screening nitrifiers at low temperature was presented in this paper: enrichment of nitrifiers at 12 degrees C, bacterium isolation and purification, preliminary screening and determination of nitrification effect. According to the above method, two kinds of ammonia-oxidation bacteria and two kinds of nitrite-oxidation bacteria were screened and separated from soil in cold area of north China, with the ammonia removal efficiency of 53%similar to 62% and nitrite removal efficiency of 31%similar to 36%, respectively. Some ecological factors impacting nitrification effect were discussed and the results showed that the most suitable temperature for the bacteria was 25 degrees C and the most appropriated pH value was in slightly alkaline range (pH 7.0-8.0). In the stable operating conditions, over 90% removal rate for ammonia and 70% removal rate for total nitrogen could be observed. At the same time, relatively high COD removal rate could be reached stably at 90%, which means both organic matter and ammonia could be removed together in the same reactor. The ecological factors analysis indicated that neither nitrite bacteria nor nitrate bacteria would be significantly influenced in growth and activity at 12 degrees C similar to 15 degrees C and the system could be operated stably at pH value of 7.0-8.0. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Additives on Seawater Flue Gas Desulfurization
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE seawater; flue gas desulfurization; additive; desulfurization seawater
   recovery
ID LIMESTONE
AB This work investigated the technology of seawater flue gas desulfurization. The results show that the liquid-gas ratio and gas-flow rate significantly influence SO2 removal efficiency. The inlet concentration of SO2 and temperature of the absorption solution have little effect on the SO2 removal efficiency. The effects of additives on desulfurization and desulfurization seawater recovery were observed by introducing different concentrations and types of additives. Inorganic and organic additives could increase SO2 removal efficiency to a certain degree. Organic additives have negative effects on seawater recovery, and inorganic additives have little influence on seawater recovery with increasing SO2 removal efficiency. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Simple Method for Synthesis of alpha-Fe Nanoparticles in
   Ordered Mesoporous Silica (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE synthesis; alpha-Fe nanoparticles; mesoporous; silica; composite
   materials
ID ZERO-VALENT IRON; NANOSCALE; TRICHLOROETHYLENE; DECHLORINATION;
   NANOCRYSTALS; REMEDIATION; COMPOSITES; ADSORPTION; CARBON; SHELL
AB A simple method for in situ synthesis of alpha-Fe nanoparticles in ordered mesoporous silica (OMS) matrix is presented. Well dispersed alpha-Fe nanoparticles in OMS were directly obtained by evaporation induced self-assembly (EISA) process and subsequent carbothermal treatment under a nitrogen atmosphere. The main strategy of this approach is to use EO20PO70EO20 (P123) as not only a template for assembly of mesostructure in the EISA process but also a reactive agent for reducing ferric species to alpha-Fe nanoparticles in subsequent carbothermal treatment process. The amphiphilic triblock copolymer P123 plays essential roles in this method. The synthesized composites with Fe/Si molar ratio ranging from 0.05 to 0.2 were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and N-2 adsorption. Characterization revealed carbothermal treatment of the composite at 800 degrees C gave highly dispersed alpha-Fe nanoparticles in hexagonal OMS matrix. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Sun, Xiuyun; Zhu, Ye; Li, Huijun; Li, Jiansheng; Wang, Lianjun] Nanjing Univ Sci & Technol, Dept Environm Sci & Engn, Nanjing 210094, Jiangsu, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Microbial Conversion of Major Ginsenosides to Minor
   Pharmacological Ginsenoside Compound-K by Sphingomonas sp ZY-3
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ginsenoside; microbial biotransformation; 16S rRNA gene
ID PANAX-NOTOGINSENG; BIOACTIVE SAPONINS; INDUCED ACTIVATION; CELLS;
   METABOLITE; APOPTOSIS; GLYCOSIDES
AB Ginsenoside is the most important secondary metabolite of ginseng, and the metabolite of Ginsenoside Rb1 has various pharmacological activities, such as anti-tumor properties. Although various chemical and biological methods have been reported of preparation for it, enzymatic production by microbial bioconversion is able to produce engineering range metabolite with specific selectivity and high efficiency. In this study, to achieve minor pharmacological ginsenoside Compound-K from major ginsenoside using microbial biotransformation, many soil bacteria which have strong beta-glucosidase activity were isolated. The screening was performed on esculin containing 1/10 TSA agar plate and then observed color development. The selected positive isolates were cultured 1000ppm G-Rb1 and the products were analyzed by TLC (thin-layer-chromatography) and HPLC (high-performance liquid chromatography) method. One novel bacterial strain ZY-3 could hydrolyze ginsenoside Rb1 to the active metabolites Compound-K through F2 and Rd. Based on phylogenetical tree, it was found to belong to genus Sphingomonas and was very close to Sphingomonas jaspsi TDMA-16(T) and Sphingomonas astaxanthinifaciens TDMA-17(T) (96.8%, 96.5%, similarity based on 16S rRNA sequence). The bioconversion production of Compound-K occurred by consecutive hydrolyses of the terminal sugar moieties at the C-20 carbon and hydrolyses of the terminal and inner C-3 carbon of ginsenoside Rb1 showing the biotransformation pathway: Rb1 -> Rd -> F2 -> Compound-K. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Orientation Visualizing Transfer Function for Volume
   Rendering (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Orientation visualizing; transfer function; volume rendering; gradient
AB Volume rendering has become an important technique for visualizing and exploring features in 3D scalar fields. However, it is difficult to visualize important structures and boundaries in volume datasets since different types of tissues are represented in overlap ranges of scalar values. In this paper, we propose a novel orientation visualizing transfer function to reveal inner structures and orientations of materials. In our approach, gradients are projected from 3D space onto RGB color space. Since both the directions and magnitudes of gradients are exploited, structures of similar scalar values and gradient magnitudes can still be distinguished by their orientations. Experiment results show our approach provides clear perspectives of the structures and unique features in visualizing orientation related details. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Comparison between Direct Competitive ELISA and LC-MS/MS
   Method for Detecting Sarafloxacin Residue in Poultry (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Direct competitive ELISA; Monoclonal antibody; Liquid
   chromatography-mass spectrometry; Sarafloxacin; Poultry
ID LINKED-IMMUNOSORBENT-ASSAY; MASS-SPECTROMETRY; FLUOROQUINOLONES;
   CIPROFLOXACIN; ENROFLOXACIN; QUINOLONES; MUSCLE; LIVER; MILK
AB Two different analytical methods for the detection of Sarafloxacin (SAR) residue in poultry have been developed, and the comparison was also performed. For this purpose, anti-SAR monoclonal antibody (mAb) was produced through cell fusion technology and SAR-HRP tracer was synthesized using EDC method. Based on the characteristics of mAbs and square matrix titration, a direct competitive ELISA (dcELISA) method was established. The working range in assay buffer was from 0.004 to 18 ng/mL, with LOD and IC50 value of 0.002 ng/mL and 0.32 ng/mL, respectively. This assay showed negligible cross-reactivity (<0.05%) to other compounds tested, showing highly specific. When applied in authentic poultry samples, no significant differences between the dcELISA and the confirmatory LC-MS/MS were observed. The correlation coefficient (R-2) values were 0.9876 and 0.995 in chicken, 0.9959 and 0.9841 in duck, 0.9822 and 0.9952 in geese, for dcELISA and LC-MS/MS, respectively. The results suggest it was an advantage through coupling of dcELISA as screening method and LC-MS/MS as confirmatory method for detecting SAR residue in poultry. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Cloning, structural analysis and expression of fast twitch
   skeletal muscle troponinC2 (TNNC2) gene in goat (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE L-FABP; gene cloning; sequence analysis; tissue expression
ID CALCIUM-MODULATED PROTEINS; BIOLOGICAL-ACTIVITY; CARDIAC TROPONIN; CA-2+
   DEPENDENCE; CROSS-LINKING; EF-HAND; C GENE; RABBIT; COMPLEX;
   4-MALEIMIDOBENZOPHENONE
AB TroponinC2 (TNNC2), a constituent of the troponin complex located on the thin filament, plays a critical role in skeletal muscle contraction and improving meat quality traits of livestock and poultry. The TNNC2 gene has been identified in many mammals, but very little known about goat. In the study, we cloned TNNC2 gene in goat for the first time and analyzed its tissue expression. Results indicated that TNNC2 contains 483bp CDS and encodes 160 amino acids, and it was selectively expressed in the muscular tissues of goat. Its nucleotide sequence was high similar with sheep (93.38%) and alpaca (90.48%), and the identity of encoded amino acids which was varied from 100% (sheep) to 70.81% (Atlantic salmon) in animal. We found that the Ala(113) and leu(132) was distributed very law in mammals. The amino acid residue of Ca2+ binding sites. was identical in mammals, Aves and amphibian. This study may provide more insight into the molecular structure and expression patterns of the vertebrate TNNC2 gene. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The DNA geometric flexibility of promoter in model organism
   genomes (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Promoter sequences; DNA geometric flexibility; Molecular dynamics (MD)
   simulations; Transcription initiation regulation
ID CORE PROMOTER
AB The general mechanism of transcription initiation is dependent on protein-DNA interaction. The promoter DNA has to possess the required 3D structure to allow DNA-binding events and accommodate alterations in activator protein positioning in order to allow the start of transcription. In this study, we introduced physical structural variables by defining three displacements (rise, shift and slide) and three rotation angles (twist, roll and tilt) for each dinucleotide to describe transcription initiation of four model organism genomes. The analysis results reveal that there are specific structural patterns in the core promoter region, and confirm that the existence of a hidden physical code which can modulates the gene transcription initiation. The results demonstrate that there is significant diversity in the geometric flexibility for different organizations. We believe the structure features originate from DNA 3D structures can describe the actual process of gene transcription initiation better than the curvature propensity or other general flexibility. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Advance On Detect Methods of Plant Microrna Expression
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE plant microRNA; expression detection; hybridization; PCR
ID REAL-TIME PCR; REGULATED MICRORNAS; ORYZA-SATIVA; SMALL RNAS;
   ARABIDOPSIS; MICROARRAY; GENES; LNA; DIFFERENTIATION; IDENTIFICATION
AB MicroRNAs (miRNAs) are an extensive class of endogenous, non-conding, short (21 similar to 25 nt) RNA molecules directly involved in signal transduction and play an important role in gene expression regulation. The detection of miRNA expression is a very important first step in miRNA exploration. With the discovery of new plant microRNAs and the functional research of miRNA thoroughly, new demand has been put forward to the plant miRNA detecting methods. Recently, plant miRNA expression detecting methods is mostly based on the hybridization and PCR techniques. In order to provide some suggestions for the plant miRNA detection research, this review summarizes the progress of several kinds of plant miRNA expression detecting methods, discusses the advantages and the disadvantages of several kinds of methods and prospects the plant miRNA detecting methods. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Synthesis and Characterization of Nano-encapsulated Drug
   Delivery System for Bone Loss (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE nano-encapsulation; bone; NMR
ID NUCLEAR-MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; HUMAN CORTICAL BONE; BISPHOSPHONATE
   CONJUGATION; MINERAL AFFINITY; PORE STRUCTURE; NMR; RELAXATION;
   OSTEOPOROSIS; DISULFIDE; POROSITY
AB A formulation of nano-encapsulated enantiomer of (+)promethazine with desired release rate has been synthesized for establish a localized drug delivery system. It was tested on a hind limb suspension (HLS) disuse rat model, and by using a non-destructive Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), and x-ray techniques to qualitatively evaluate the effectiveness of the new bone formations. Our studies suggest that nanoencapsulated (+)promethazine in controlled release formulations are effective in promoting bone growth in a rat model. Conjugating bone-targeting functional groups to the nanoparticles further enhances the efficacy of the drug. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Development of an Immunoassay for Determination of
   Fluoroquinolones Pollutant in Environmental Water Samples (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fluoroquinolones; Sarafloxacin; Artificial antigen; Polyclonal antibody;
   Indirect competitive ELISA; Water
ID PERFORMANCE LIQUID-CHROMATOGRAPHY; TANDEM MASS-SPECTROMETRY;
   MULTIRESIDUE DETERMINATION; FLUORESCENCE DETECTION; ANTIBIOTICS;
   QUINOLONES; PRODUCTS; SEWAGE; RIVER; FISH
AB An immunoassay method for determination of Fluoroquinolones (FQs) residues in water samples has been developed. For this purpose, NHS ester technology was employed to synthesize the immunogen and coating antigen of Sarafloxacin (SAR). SDS-PAGE, UV-visible spectra and Infrared spectra identification showed that the artificial antigen was conjugated successfully. Based on the square matrix titration, an icELISA method was established. The dynamic range in assay buffer was from 0.048 to 62.4 ng/mL, with LOD and IC50 value of 0.018 ng/mL and 2.5 ng/mL, respectively. This assay showed a high cross-reactivity to Difloxacin (86.7%), Norfloxacin (63.2%), and Pefloxacin (33.8%). When applied in authentic tap water, river water and fishing water samples, the recoveries for Sarafloxacin, Difloxacin, Norfloxacin and Pefloxacin were 89.5-119.5, 90.5-121.2, 92.1-118.6, and 88.2-116.8%, respectively, with coefficient of variation (CV) values all <10%. The results suggest this immunoassay can be used for simultaneous detecting Sarafloxacin, Difloxacin, Norfloxacin, and Pefloxacin residues in water samples. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Interactions of ethanethiol with defective graphene:
   First-Principle calculations (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ethanethiol molecule; Graphene; Stone-Wales defect; Vacancy; Density
   functional theory
ID WALLED CARBON NANOTUBES; THIN-FILMS; AB-INITIO; ADSORPTION; SURFACE;
   LAYERS
AB A first-principle study based on density functional theory was conducted to investigate the interaction of ethanethiol molecule with both defected and defect-free graphene. The calculated results reveal that the ethanethiol molecules can be bound to the surface of defected graphene more tightly in comparison with the defect-free graphene. The configurations and density of states of the combined systems show that the interaction between the ethanethiol molecule and defected graphene is quite different from the defect-free graphene, which is consistent with the Mulliken analyses. It is expected that the simulation results presented in this work would be valuable to the applications of various graphene-based nanometer devices. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Cathodic Potentiostatic Electrodeposition and Capacitance
   Characterization of Manganese Dioxide Film (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE KMnO4; MnO2; cyclic voltammetry; capacitance
ID ELECTROCHEMICAL CAPACITORS; MNO2; OXIDE; SUPERCAPACITORS; PERFORMANCE
AB MnO2 film was obtained on stainless steel surface by cathodic potentiostatic electrodeposition method in KMnO4 aqueous solution in a three-electrode electrochemical cell. The specific capacitance of MnO2 film was studied by cyclic voltammetry method in 0.1M Na2SO4. The results indicated that the film electrolyzed 1.5h under 0.55V voltage in 0.4M KMnO4 solution with pH value of 12 had the largest specific capacitance of 232.94 F.g(-1). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Study of Water Resources Sustainable Utilization
   Evaluation in Manas River Basin, Xinjiang Province, China (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE EV-PP model; evaluation index; sustainable utilization; Manas River
   basin
AB Water shortage restricts the water resources sustainable development in the Manas River basin, so the evaluation of sustainable development is crucial to the social development. This article from the water, social, economic, ecological environment subsystems, set up the evaluation model through combination of entropy theory and projection pursuit, evaluate the sustainable development of water resources. The Evaluation results show that water resources sustainable development tends to benign trend. The evaluation method is reliable and reasonable. The evaluation results can afford scientific basis for water resources sustainable development and it is proved that EV-PP model is effective new method. Finally, the article brings forwards suggestions to improve the water resources sustainable development. It can provide decision-making for water resources sustainable utilization. TI RETRACTED: Study on Water and Salt Transport Features and Regulation for
   Salt-Effected Soil through Drip Irrigation under Film (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE saline-alkalized land; drip irrigation under plastic film; water and
   soil transport; characteristic; regulation
AB The technology of drip irrigation under plastic film has advantages in the saline-alkalized land utilization. According to the soil water and salt transport feature with drip irrigation under plastic film, this paper analyzes salt distribution characteristic under drip irrigation in saline-alkalized land, reveals the salt transport rules in the cotton growth with different irrigation quota. The result shows that the irrigation quota is 5250m3/hm2, soil moisture content is in the range of 12.77 similar to 15.92% and salt content is in the range of 0.97 similar to 1.55%, which are good salt-water environment required by normal growth of cotton and have a higher water utilization efficiency. It has theoretical significance and application value on salt regulation and the establishment of irrigation system in saline-alkalized land. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. DE electromagnetic signal simulation; communication signal; multi-waveform
   synthesis; orthogonal modulation
AB Realistic electromagnetic signal environment simulation plays a activate role in the tactical performance test of electronic countermeasure equipments. Aiming at simulating communication and navigation signal in complex electromagnetic environment, the paper proposed communication and navigation signal simulation program based on the introduction of frequency synthesis technology and orthogonal multi-waveform synthesis principle. The program was also be verified with simulation. TI RETRACTED: Characterization of Pollutants for Polymer Wastewater by
   Membrane (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE polymer; membrane; gradient separation; wastewater; size distribution
ID SIZE DISTRIBUTION; BIODEGRADABILITY; WASTEWATERS; FRACTIONS
AB Polymer is the essential material of computer equipment, however so far polymer wastewater is hard to treat in the world. In this paper the state of wastewater treatment was investigated in polymer factory and a new analysis method was used to study the characterization of the pollutants for polymer wastewater by membrane. The COD of polymer wastewater is complicated, involving colloid (1-5nm) (58.59% COD),. <0.1 mu m portions (21.41% COD), and no more than 200 molecular weight substance (20% COD). The ammonia-nitrogen mainly is the small molecular (88.30%), which can be removed by UF and RO membrane. SO32- is the same as the ammonia-nitrogen, and the SO32- of the polymer tower effluent is 122.57 mg/L, which respectively could be cut off almost half by UF and RO membrane. Then treatment technology is recommended by these analysis data. So membrane gradient separation, as a useful tool for better interpretation of wastewater, is apparently vital for water quality analysis and engineering project design. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on the Characteristic of Dyeing-Printing Wastewater
   Treatment with Micro-Aerobic Granular Sludge (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Dyeing-printing wastewater; micro-aerobic; chromaticity; dissolved
   oxygen
AB In order to provide a new method for the treatment of printing and dyeing wastewater, the experiment studies how to treat dyeing-printing wastewater by IC reactor, refluent tank (10L), self-regulating control valve making of medical infusion, air flow meter which the basic units of (mL/min), dissolved oxygen instrument, aerator pumps (3.5W) and aeration equipment under the micro-aerobic condition; The prophase experiment is that wastewater was flocculated. The step is: first, PH of the printing and dyeing wastewater would be changed to 7.5 or so, then, wastewater and flocculants (10% PAC flocculants and 0.05% PAM coagulant aids) were mixed and the mixing ratio of was 400 to 1. at last, the decolorizing ratio was stable at 46% approximately; after the biodegradability of dyeing wastewater improving, under the dissolved oxygen -0.3 similar to 0.5mg/L (ms) condition, the printing and dyeing wastewater (my) was diluted by domestic sewage which mixing ratio is 7 to 3. Then added the printing and dyeing wastewater gradually, and held the increase ratio of influent COD load as 7% and mixed water COD load steadily as 25%. When the influent load reached 4655.1mg / L or so, dissolved oxygen was 0.3 similar to 0.5mg / L, HRT was 6h, the reactor worked best, this moment, the removal rate of COD could reach 85.8%; when the micro-oxygen granular sludge can deal with printing and dyeing wastewater effectively, under the appropriate influent load, compared the influence of two micro-oxygen conditions of the dissolved oxygen concentration 0.5 similar to 0.8 (mg/L) and 0.8 similar to 1.0 (mg/L) on system performance to that of the higher concentration of dissolved oxygen 1.0 similar to 1.2(mg/L) in the runback water; In order to create a good living environment for granular sludge, during the experiment, inoculation sludge, pH of influent and effluent, influent load operation, HRT are controlled strictly, as a result, it is discovered that the temperature change affects the decolorization. At about 15 degrees C, the decolorization rate is very low, only about 12.7 percent, however, when the temperature at around 25 degrees C, the decolorizing rate increases rapidly, about 75.8%; at around 35 degrees C, the decolorizing rate tends to maintained slowly at around 80.7 percent. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on Micro-Aerobic Granular Sludge in the Process of
   Cultivation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE micro-aerobic; granular sludge; removal rate
AB The degradation characteristic of micro-organisms in the aerobic granular sludge system is different from that in the aerobic granular sludge system or anaerobic granular sludge system. At the beginning, the concentration of inflow water keeps the COD influent concentration in the end of cultivation of anaerobic granular sludge: 3418mg / L stably, the volume load of reactor : 33.4kgCOD/(m3.d), HRT : 7h, the main flow velocity of water : 2L/h, back-flow influent velocity : 0.6L /h, the concentration of dissolved oxygen in refluent tank : 0.3 similar to 0.5mg/L. The influent pH after 37 days, pH of influent is controlled 6.5 above. The COD removal rate, the reducing of HRT takes 0.5h space; when the COD removal ratio is stable, the improving velocity of back-flow water takes 0.2L/h space and HRT keeps 7h. When the influent organic load upgraded 385.7 g COD / d eventually after 8 times improvement, the experimentation is accomplished, at the same time, the HRT reached 5h, the refluent flux was 1.4L/h and removal rate of COD was 84.7%. It is also found that the anaerobic granular sludge disintegrated seriously in the test, particle size showed a narrowing trend and a large number of fragments fell and suspended in reactor. As a result, the SS concentration of out-flow water fluctuated largely throughout the experimentation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study on the water head loss of adjusting flow board for
   Mass-sand Water Supply, Xinjiang Province, China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE sand basin; adjusting flow board; water head loss
AB The water flowing into the sand basin is generally disordered, which is unfavorable to the settlement of sediment. In order to adjust flow field to be favorable, we set an adjusting flow board in the head of settling basin to change flow state. Adjusting flow board regulates and controls the current through holes of different apertures on itself. Then, the water flowing through the adjusting flow board produces flow head loss. Therefore, the turbulence and power of the water flow are weakened. This article studies the head loss when the water flows through the adjusting flow board and proposes design principles of the adjusting flow board. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Green Infrastructure: New Approach to Urban Forest Planning
   and Management (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ecosystem services value; green infrastructure network; human habitats;
   ranking; water quality
AB Urban forests have important role on the human habitats including the environmental, social and economic aspects. But the accelerated land consumption and land abuse are very universal today, the urban forests are faced to serious threaten. It is the time to find a new and effective theory and method which is used to guide the urban forests planning, construction and management. Green Infrastructure (GI) theory and practice have roots in planning and conservation efforts that started a hundred and fifty years ago in America. Now, it was mature and became an important item and method to solving the contradiction between urban and rural construction and environment protection in America. GI is a network which is composed of "hubs" and "links", it can play an important role at a broad 'landscape scale', from urban to rural, from site/parcel, regional/local to landscape. In the case study presented in this paper, the Cecil County GI planning has contained four contents: Cecil County Water Quality Maintenance and Enhancement Analysis, Cecil County GI Ecosystem Services Assessment, Cecil County GI Network Design and Cecil County GI Implementation Quilt. By the case study, it can be seen that GI could be a new method for urban forest planning, constructing and managing. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang Shanfeng; Song Shaohang] Zhejiang Univ Technol, Dept Urban Planning, Hangzhou 310014, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Experimental Study of 13X Molecular Sieve Loaded Silver on
   Water Treatment (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE silver-supporting molecular sieve; experimental study; antibacterial
   performance; disinfection
ID ALUMINA
AB The silver-supporting molecular sieve was prepared by the vacuum heating decomposition method with molecular sieve as the carrier and AgNO3 solution as the reaction solution. Its structure was characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), the antibacterial and disinfection was tested and the concentration of Ag+ was tested for safety. The results show that the Ag loaded on the surface and micropore of the silver-supporting molecular sieve is nanosilver. Using 5.0mg/100mL silver-supporting molecular sieve with a silver-supporting rate of 2.12% can kill E. cloli in experiment water. Disinfection rate of the silver-supporting molecular sieve exceed 98% for the natural water with consideration of impurity. The concentration of Ag+ is less than 50 ug/L in disinfected and treated water. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
