TI RETRACTED: Energy-related Air Pollution and Control Measures in China
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE energy structure; air pollution; policy and regulation; control measures
ID ELECTRICITY; GENERATION; COAL
AB The rapid growth of Chinese economy has tremend-ously stimulated the expansion of energy consumption. The structure of energy consumption in China is featured with the coal domination. Air pollution is becoming increasingly severe and causes enormous economic losses. As a result, we are confronted with the extremely arduous task to balance energy consumption and environmental protection. In order to avoid the situation that its rampant environmental pollution problem will worsen before it gets better, Chinese government has put high emphasis on the problem. The efforts made by Chinese government, including energy consumption structure improve-ment and control measures to air pollution, have been introduced and discussed in this paper. China possesses very abundant renewable energies such as wind, solar, geothermal and tidal. Applications of renewable energies, especially solar energy, can coordinate and improve the relationship between energy consumption and environmental protection. Therefore, Chinese government should make more efforts to set up priority of development for renewable energies. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of Organizers of 2011. International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Dynamical Behavior of a Modified Leslie-Gower-type
   Predator-prey Model with Discrete Time Delay (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Leslie-Gower type; Holling functional; predator-prey; time delay;
   Hopf-bifurcation; environment fluctuation; white noise; variance
AB In this paper, a two-dimensional modified Leslie-Gower-type predator-prey system with discrete time-delay is considered. Firstly, basic dynamical properties of non-delayed and delayed model system within deterministic environment, including local stability of the positive equilibrium point and the existence of Hopf bifurca-tion in the system is briefly recalled. Next, the stability and direction of Hopf bifurcation is determined by applying the normal form theory and the center manifold argument. Finally, this paper proposes the stochastic delay differential equation model to study the effect of environmental driving forces on the dynamical behavior. The stochastic model is extension of the delayed model by incorporating Gaussian white noise terms into the growth equations of both prey and predator species. And the calculation of population fluctuation intensity (variance) for prey and predator species is carried out by Fourier trans -forms method for stochastic delay differential equation model. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Guangdong Ocean Univ Zhanjiang, Fac Sci, Zhanjiang 524088, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of Gradient Characteristics of Ecological Potential
   Power in Farm-forest Ecotone - A Case on Mudanjiang in Heilongjiang
   Province (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Farm-forest ecotone; Gradient characteristic; Ecological potential
   power; Trend surface analysis
AB Farm-forest ecotone proves to be ecologically sensitive areas, where there is obvious change from environmental gradient. The landscape characteristic is mainly influenced by elevation, slope and human activities. Taking Mudanjiang in Heilongjiang Province as an example, this paper analyzes spatial-temporal distribution of ecological potential power in elevation and slope by the technology of GIS and RS, and the method of trend surface analysis. The results showed that dynamic process of land for agriculture and forestry had a direct impact on the change rate and direction of landscape characteristics in Mudanjiang. Trend surface analysis on ecological potential power can conclude that gradient change of landscape was concentrated in low-altitude and high-slope region from 1976 to 1986, on the contrary, mainly concentrated in the high-altitude and low-slope region from 1986 to 1996 and concentrated in the medium-altitude and medium-slope region in 1996-2006. Thus, the prominence of landscape gradient change distributed in the regions where there are frequent human activities. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 NE Agr Univ, Resources & Environm Sci Coll, Haerbin 150030, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Research of Nano-TiO2 Composites on Malachite Green
   Decolorizing Effect (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Nano-TiO2; composites photo-catalysis; decolorizing rate; malachite
   green
AB Nano-TiO2 membrane was loaded on diatomite-based porous ceramics by the hydrolysis precipitation method and using TiCl4 as the forerunner body. The influences of various parameters such as the initial concentration of malachite green, the amount of composites, and the initial pH had been investigated. With the same irradiation time and other experimental conditions, the decolorizing rate of malachite green was higher when the initial concentration was 6 mg/L, the composites dosage was 5 g/L, and the initial pH was 8 respectively. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A New K-NN Query Algorithm Based on the Dynamic Movement of
   the Correlative Rectangles (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE K-nearest neighbor algorithm; correlative rectangles; dynamic movement;
   cluster
AB The K-nearest neighbor algorithm is an important class of search algorithm in spatial database, in the previous K-NN algorithms, there are many algorithms which will improve the query efficiency by using measurement distance and pruning strategy, these algorithms require a lot of distance calculations, the efficiency is very low, in order to effectively select the search range, a new K-NN query algorithm based on the dynamic movement of the correlative rectangles is proposed in this paper, after clustering the data objects, it will lock the query region in each cluster when carry on the next query through the dynamic movement of the correlative rectangles, so it can effectively realize to fast and precisely find the K-NN objects meeting the conditions in the large data set. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Empirical Analysis of the Relationship between Energy
   Intensity, Energy Structure and Energy Conversion Efficiency in China
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE energy intensity; efficiency; intensity
AB Energy intensity is an important indicator to evaluate the coordination of energy-economy-environment system, so reducing energy intensity has become one of the greatest challenges of economy development. In order to study the relation between energy intensity and influential factors of energy intensity in China, a regression equation is used in this paper, using the method of stepwise regression analysis. By introducing the data of real GDP, total energy consumption and energy consumption mix, all data over the period 1990-2008, the regression equation can rationally simulate the energy intensity. Empirical results show that energy structure and energy conversion efficiency have a great impact on energy intensity. In the future, we should raise R&D expenditure on energy technology accounted for the proportion of GDP, optimize energy Structure, upgrade the industry structure and develop the new energy. As the regression equation has a very good simulation results, it can be used to forecast energy intensity of China. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Liaoning Shihua Univ, Sch Econ Management, Fushun, Liaoning, Peoples R China.
RP Han, C (reprint author), Liaoning Shihua Univ, Sch Econ Management, Fushun, Liaoning, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: The Necessity and Approach of Developing Low-carbon Economy
   in Liaoning Province of China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
ID RESPONSES; FACE; CO2
AB In order to illustrate the urgency of developing low-carbon economy in Liaoning Province, we built a regression equation, using the data of real GDP, natural disasters losses and industrial pollutant emissions, all data over the period 2000-2008. Empirical result directly shows that the intensity of carbon dioxide emissions and the industrial emissions have a great impact on the ecological environment in China. By an effective contrast, we can indirectly prove that the tremendous potential destruction on environment caused by the energy consumption of Liaoning Province, China. Obviously, developing low-carbon economy should become the important project of twelfth five years plan in Liaoning Province. We should educe carbon dioxide emissions, and call upon people to try to reduce "carbon" emission in life and production. We need to transform the mode of economic development, promote structural adjustment of economy and save resources and energy. In addition, we must establish an energy-saving consumption mode, build up energy-saving industrial structure and growth pattern, eliminate highly energy-consuming industry, develop recycling economy and comprehensive utilization, as well as reduce the industrial energy-consuming level. Keywords: energy intensity; efficiency; intensity (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: An Overall Comparation and Technical Decomposition Analysis
   of CO2 Emissions in Tokyo and Beijing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE CO2 emissions; Beijing; Tokyo; cooperation
AB In this paper we give an overview of the situation of CO2 emissions in both Beijing and Tokyo and discuss and compare the causes for their emission changes according to decomposition based on both social activities and fuel varieties. We find that in order to enjoy a sustainable development, Beijing needs to learn from Tokyo especially in energy consumption area. At the end of the paper, the cooperation between these two metropolises is summarized. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Calculating Model of Tourist Carrying Capacity for Scenic
   Area (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Carrying capacity; level of service; ecological environment; scenic area
AB Many studies on tourist carrying capacity (TCC) at present are concentrating on ecological protection. The determination of TCC should consider the supply capacity of basic facilities in resort as well as ecosystems, such as transport vehicles, hotels and restaurants. In this paper we will introduce an evaluating index which is called "level of service" (LOS) to represent the utilization of basic facilities, and develop a function of LOS and the number of tourists. Calculation model of TTC is derived corresponding to critical value of LOS. Then from the view of ecological protection, the other TTC model is developed according to the size of tourism area and maximum tourist density parameters. Optimal TTC equals the minor of the values calculated from the two TTC models. Lastly, YunTai resort, a World Geology Park in HeNan province is used as example to explain the model. Results show that carrying capacity of LOS is 8511 and smaller than ecological carrying capacity of 11730. Measures should be taken to promote the LOS for tourists. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Jin, Shenglang; Sai, Jing] Huangshan Univ, Tourism Coll, Huangshan 245021, Peoples R China.
RP Jin, SL (reprint author), Huangshan Univ, Tourism Coll, Huangshan 245021, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Multi-scale Characteristic and Mutation Analysis of
   Precipitation and Evaporation Series in Yuyang (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wavelet analysis; precipitation; evaporation; oscillation point; Yuyang
   region
AB According to precipitation and evaporation time series in Yuyang region, this paper adopts Morlet wavelet analysis method, analyzes time series configuration in detail, and discusses multi-scale variations and mutation of precipitation and evaporation. The result shows that, precipitation and evaporation series exist multi-scale characteristic, the main period is 16y and 15y, secondary period is 3y, 7y, and 9y. Period changes complicatedly, large scale comprises small scale; oscillation point of a=16y and a=15y delays 3 similar to 4y compared with a=9y; precipitation oscillation point delays 1y compared with evaporation; in deferent time scale oscillation point is deferent comparison with evaporation, precipitation oscillation point appearance in the Late 1980s and 1990s, evaporation time series oscillation point appearance in Mid 1980s and Mid and Late 1990s. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effect of the Material Parameters of Rock Mass on Slope
   Stability (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Non-linear strength criterion; Strength reduction technique; Slope
   stability; Limit equilibrium method
ID HOEK-BROWN CRITERION; STRENGTH
AB Slope stability is mainly affected by external factors and internal factors in which parameters of rock material as the main internal factors impact significantly on the slope stability. Although NLSSR(Non-linear strength reduction technology) is used more and more wide in the slope stability, but there are still many disputes at present. According to the existing defects of NLSSR, firstly, this paper analyzes the slope stability considering the deformation parameters strength reduction of rock mass. The results indicated that the safety factor and slip plane of slope are all close to the results of limit equilibrium theory. Then the sensitivity analysis of rock mass parameters is further made. The results showed that: 1. The deformation parameters have little effect on the slope stability, taking the slip surface and displacement at failure of slope into consideration, so it is necessary to synchronously reduce the deformation parameters when doing the NLSSR. 2. The slope safety factor increases with the increasing of material parameters m, s, UCS(Uniaxial compressive strength), and the three increases are almost the same extent. 3. The material parameter a has a significant effect on slope stability, the slope safety factor decreases exponentially with the increasing of parameter a. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Speciation of Cr(III) and Cr(VI) in Environmental Water
   Determined by Selective Separation and Preconcentration on the Silica
   Gel G Loaded Nano-barium Strontium Titanate (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Silica gel G loaded nano-barium strontium titanate; Speciation analysis;
   Chromium; environmental water
ID EXTRACTION; SAMPLES
AB A simple and sensitive method for the speciation, separation and preconcentration of Cr(VI) and Cr(III) in environmental water was developed. The procedure presented based on two forms of chromium show different adsorption capacities on the silica gel G loaded nano-barium strontium titanate(GBST) at different pH values, that is, Cr (III) selectively retained at pH 7-14, but Cr(VI) can't be adsorbed. Whereas Cr (VI) retained at pH 1, but Cr(III) can't be adsorbed. Hence complete separation of the two forms of chromium is possible. Retained Cr(III) and Cr(VI) were eluted with 1 mol.L-1 HCl and 1 mol.L-1 NaOH, respectively. The Cr(III) and Cr(VI) concentration was measured by atomic absorption spectroscopy. The method was successfully applied for the speciation of chromium in environmental water samples with successfully results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Shenyang Ligong Univ, Sch Environm & Chem Engn, Shenyang 110159, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Climate Change on Water Resources and Urban Water System
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Climate change; water resources; water system; planning
ID AVAILABILITY
AB Climate change is a big environmental challenge which has great impacts on global water resources and urban water supply system. Observational records and climate projections provide abundant evidence that freshwater resources are vulnerable and have the potential to be strongly impacted by climate change, with wide-ranging consequences for human societies and ecosystems. How to manage the water system in a changing world climate and making long-term water system planning and management decisions has became a global challenge. This study aims to summarize and discuss the potential adaptation strategies on water to climate change from the sustainable development perspective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.    (Retracted Article)

   2011

DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE spatial information system; WCS; spatail data management
AB Scientists in earth observation field often spend a lot of time on data preprocessing according to specific application targets. Using Web Coverage Service (WCS) and research on-demand data service model in spatial information system could help to improve efficiency and interoperability. It aims to integrate a large number of fundamental data pre-processing tasks into data access procedure, and minimize the time cost. This paper studies spatial data system to provide high level spatial data products to meet application request based on WCS standards. TI RETRACTED: Assessment the Source Apportionment of Point and Non-point
   Loads Combinedly Using the QUAL2E Model and Factor Analysis (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE PCA & FA; QUAL2E; Degradation coefficient; Source-sink term; Non-point
   source pollution
ID SURFACE-WATER QUALITY; SOURCE POLLUTION; RIVER
AB The study on non-point source pollution is a key and difficult issue in the research on water environment pollution. The river water quality model QUAL2E and the principal component analysis & factor analysis (PCA & FA) are used combinedly to study the apportionment of point and non-point source loads. The river water quality model QUAL2E is a stream dispersion mass transfer equation, which also includes source and leakage resulting from biochemical degradation and river branch. PCA & FA is used to evaluate pollutant sources at different river sections in dry and wet seasons. In this paper, Shaanxi Reach of the Jinghe River is taken as an example, and the river water quality model QUAL2E is adopted, combining with the evaluating results of water quality obtained by PCA & FA, to calculate point and non-point source loads of ammonia nitrogen and nitrate nitrogen as the nitrogen nutrient indexes respectively in dry and wet seasons from 2002 to 2007. It is demonstrated that the calculation result of nitrate nitrogen (NO3--N) is satisfactory, while that of ammonia nitrogen (NH4+-N) isn't. This is consistent with the results of PCA & FA, that is, NO3--N can be associated with point source discharge of domestic sewage, etc. in dry seasons and non-point source pollution generated by precipitation in wet seasons, whereas NH4+-N is discharged from point sources all over the year, and its unsatisfactory calculation result is due to the instability of point source discharge. This kind of method provides reliable results on non-point source pollution caused by storm runoff. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study the Effect of Growing Environment on Carbon
   Sequestration of Populus Ussuriensis Based on Wood Microscopic Image
   Processing (Retracted Article)

   2011

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Populus ussuriensis; carbon sequestration; growing environment; image
   processing
AB Wood carbon sequestration could be characterized effectively by wood microstructure based on wood microscopic image processing. Growing environment is one of the important factors affecting wood microstructure. The study of growing environment could provide a scientific theory basis for drawing up cultural operations. The results show that the more percentage of cell tissue of late wood, the less proportion of tracheal tissue, the more proportion of xylon, then the better effect of carbon sequestration of Populus ussuriensis. Intermediate cutting and meadow albic bleached soil are more beneficial to carbon sequestration of Populus ussuriensis. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Effect of 1-methylcyclopropene on bioavailability of in vitro
   digests from Lingwu jujube (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Lingwu jujube; 1-methylcyclopropene; Bioavailability; In vitro
   digestion; Antioxidant activity
ID ANTIOXIDANT ACTIVITY; IMPROVEMENT; TOLERANCE; EXTRACT; MEALS; ASSAY
AB The main objective of the present work was to examine the effect of 1-methylcyclopropene (1-MCP) on bioavailability of Lingwu jujube (Zizyphus jujuba Mill.) during the period of shelf life. Fruits were exposed to 0.5 mu LL-1 of 1-MCP for 24 h at room temperature, and fruits were held up to 8 days and assessed for quality during storage, membrane permeability, malondialdehyde (MDA), and using an in vitro digestion system that simulated the physiochemical changes that occurred in the upper gastrointestinal tract. The differences in fruit firmness, soluble solid content (SSC), and membrane permeability with 1-MCP treatment were manifested during shelf life period. MDA, an indicator of lipid peroxidation caused by reactive oxygen species, increased during shelf life and the contents were significantly lower in fruit treated with 1-MCP than control samples. The results indicated 1-MCP was an effective tool for quality improvement and extension of shelf life in jujubes, and showed that the bioavailability of tissues was tightly related to the quality of fruits and the simulated digestion appeared to be an efficient tool for studying the bioavailability from fruits and vegetables. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Determination of Trace Heavy Metal ions in Environmental
   Water by Atomic Absorption Spectrometry after Preconcentration with
   Barium-strontium Titanate Based on Glass Fiber Filter (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Barium-strontium titanate based on glass fiber filter; Preconcentration;
   Heavy metal; Flame atomic absorption spectrometry
ID ADSORPTION BEHAVIOR; SAMPLES; SEPARATION; EXTRACTION; SPECIATION;
   CADMIUM; LEAD
AB A new method of preconcentration with barium-strontium titanate based on glass fiber filter(BBST) combined with flame atomic absorption spectrometry (FAAS) was proposed for the determination of trace heavy metal ions, included Mn(II), Cu2+, Ni2+ and Ag+, in environmental water. The optimum experimental parameters for preconcentration of the heavy metals studied, such as pH, flow rate and volume, eluent and coexisting ions, have been investigated. The results showed that Mn(II), Cu2+, Ni2+ and Ag+ could be quantitatively retained by the BBST in the pH range of 5-10, and then eluted completely with 2 mol.L-1 HNO3. The detection limits of this method for Mn(II), Cu2+, Ni2+ and Ag+ were 0.021 mu g.L-1, 0.029 mu g.L-1, 0.16 mu g.L-1 and 0.038 mu g.L-1 with an enrichment factor of 50, respectively. The method has been applied to the simultaneous determination of trace amounts of Mn(II), Cu2+, Ni2+ and Ag+ in environmental water with satisfactory results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE SMBR; ASM3; dynamic model; construction; calibration
ID SYSTEM

TI RETRACTED: Application of Groundwater Dynamic Stochastic Simulation in
   Longkeng Water Source of Songyuan City, Jilin Province (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE time-series; groundwater dynamic; stochastic simulation; Longkeng water
   source
AB Time-series analysis theory is applied to analyze and perdict the dynamic variation of groundwater in the area of Longkeng water source in Songyuan of Jilin Province, China. The trend component of groundwater level dynamic variation in picked up by polynomial calibration, the periodic component is extracted by spectrum analysis and the stochastic component is simulated by using auto regression (AR) model. Finally, a forecasting model is established through linear superposition of the three components. The simulating precision of the model is verified in this paper. According to the simulation analysis, groundwater level seasonal and secular variation and the regularity characteristics are revealed. The prediction indicates that a continuing decline of groundwater level exists in Longkeng water source area which must be controlled in time. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Fang Zhang; Xiao Chang-lai; Ma Zhe] Jilin Univ, Coll Environm & Resources, JLU, Changchun 130023, Peoples R China.
RP Fang, Z (reprint author), Jilin Univ, Coll Environm & Resources, JLU, Changchun 130023, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Direct and Indirect Energy Demands and CO2 Emissions from
   Production Activities in Jiangsu Province in 2007 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE carbon dioxide; energy; input-output table; Jiangsu; production
   activities
ID GREENHOUSE-GAS EMISSIONS; CHINA; TRADE; DECOMPOSITION; CONSUMPTION;
   INTENSITY
AB In order to investigate energy demands and CO2 emissions from production activities in Jiangsu Province in detail, we analyzed the direct and indirect amounts of energy demands and CO2 emissions by 26 sectors in Jiangsu Province in 2007. An environmental input-output table (EIOT) was constructed based on the 2007 monetary input-output table of Jiangsu Province. And each sector's energy demands and CO2 emissions were treated as external multipliers. Subsequently, each sector's direct and indirect effects on energy demands and CO2 emissions in 2007 are studied. It is indicated that Jiangsu Province should focus on three points in future development: industrial structure changes, technology development and renewable energy utilization. At last, future work for the EIOT was discussed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on System of Remote Sensing Monitoring the Land
   Reclamation of Mine (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE mine; land reclamation; remote sensing monitoring; system
AB Land reclamation is an important mean to restore the destroyed land in mine area. Furthermore, monitoring the process of land reclamation is one of indexes of environment quality. To accomplish monitoring successfully, it is necessary to setup an entire system from local to country. The monitoring contents consist of original land surface pre-mining, changes of land mining process arose, land reclamation project, et. al.. The monitoring system includes 1) collecting and processing of remote sensed data; 2) data saving and management; 3) analysis and application; 4) virtual reality; 5) Land Suitability Evaluation; 6) ecological Tourism Planning etc. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study on Latent Failure of ESD on Microelectronic Device
   2SC3356 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ESD; microelectric device; latent failure
AB This paper deals with a latent failure study on the low-level electrostatic discharge (ESD) stresses on microelectric device. A series of low-level ESD stresses were imposed on microwave low noise transistor 2SC3356 using the human body model (HBM). It is shown that ESD stresses, even at a level below the failure threshold, can impact the device lifetime by creating latent defects, and the device impressed by lower ESD stressing was easier to occur latent failure. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Coagulation Features and Characteristics of Dissolved Organic
   Matter in Treatment of Combined Sewer Overflow Wastewater (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE coagulation; dissolved organic matter; GFC; ultrafiltration; CSO
   wastewater
ID CHEMICAL COAGULATION; ENHANCED COAGULATION; MOLECULAR-WEIGHT; REMOVAL;
   ULTRAFILTRATION; ACID
AB In this study, coagulation features and molecular weight (MW) distribution dissolved organic matter (DOM) of combined sewer overflow (CSO) wastewater were investigated. Ferric chloride (FeCl3) and Polyaluminium Chloride (PAC) were employed in the coagulation process. The results showed that both FeCl3 and PAC were effective for remove Turbidity and TP, the removal efficiency were all above 90% when the dosages was reasonable; optimal removal efficiency of COD were appropriate of 60-70%; but the removal efficiency of NH4+-N and TN were 10-20% only. The comparison results of removal efficiency of COD, Turbidity, NH4+-N, TN and TP in different concentration of raw wastewater with the same dosages of FeCl3 and PAC were also investigated. The results showed that water quality of raw wastewater was one of the influential parameters for the optimized treatment of the wastewater. The MW distribution of DOM of the raw wastewater and coagulated samples was analysis by gel filtration chromatography (GFC) and ultrafiltration technology. Compared with the initial wastewater, coagulated samples had much narrower distributions of MW. DOM fraction MW>30kDa can be removed by both FeCl3 and PAC. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on the Enzyme-producing Conditions of a PCBs-degrading
   Halophilic Bacterium (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Type your keywords here; separated by semicolons
AB Polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) are Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs). This experiment screened a halophilic bacterium from the deep sea sediments, which could grow at the salinity of 15%, and designated as B2.6. The cells of this strain were rod shaped, Gram negative, motile, could grow in pH range of 5.0-9.0, and temperature range 10-37 degrees C. Growth of this bacterium in the presence of PCBs, as the sole source of carbon and energy. The ions of. A, such as Na+ and K+ could enhance the activity of PCBs-degrading enzyme, while the transitional metal ions, such as Co2+, Mn2+, Cu2+, Fe2+ and Fe3+ may inhibit it in a certain degree. The optimal temperature, pH value and concentration of NaCl for the PCBs-degrading enzyme were 25-35., pH 6-8 and 50 g.L-1, respectively. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Life Cycle Assessment Applied for Rationality of Packaging
   from Plastic and Composite Material (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE life cycle assessment; analytical hierarchy process; fuzzy comprehensive
   evaluation; environmental impacts
AB The packaging rationality of two kinds of milk packaging, one of which is plastic made from polyethylene and the other is composite material made from laminating Al/PE/Paper, was evaluated and compared adopting the approach of LCA, respectively. Firstly, the hierarchy structure of evaluation index system was established, taking its practical function, acceptable environment and feasible economic roles into consideration. Then weight of each item in the evaluation system was obtained using analytic hierarchy process (AHP). The fuzzy comprehensive evaluation (FCE) was used for final rationality evaluation. Combined with LCA, AHP and FCE, a rationality evaluation method was developed for milk packages comprehensively considering environmental, economic and functional factors, and the rationality of two kinds of milk packages were evaluated as case study. The results indicated that the composite package was more feasible than plastic packaging and would be a sustainable choice for milk package if improvements were made on its environmental and economic aspects. The method was proved simple and feasible for rationality evaluation of package products. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Xie, Minghui; Qiao, Qi; Sun, Qihong] Chinese Res Inst Environm Sci, 8 Dayangfang, Beijing 100012, Peoples R China.

DE Calcium silicate hydrate(C-S-H); Molecular dynamics; Model; Computer
   simulation
ID MOLECULAR-DYNAMICS SIMULATION; C-S-H
AB Calcium Silicate Hydrate (C-S-H) is the main hydration product of Portland cement, it has an important impact on the properties of cement and causes a wide range of study. In recent years, superplasticizer, of which the main component is organic macromolecules, has become an important component in preparation for high performance concrete. Simulations of molecular dynamics of hydration products of cement were summarized, the simulation of hydration process of cement paste and the formation of microstructure were introduced and model of calcium silicate hydrate mixed with superplasticizer were studied in this paper. TI RETRACTED: Research Trends of Ecological Restoration: New Opportunities
   to Match New Changes (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE restoration; engineering practice; research; bibliometric analysis;
   terminology; RefViz
ID CONSERVATION-BIOLOGY; DIVERSITY; DESIGN
AB Ecological restoration is an effective way of solving natural resource problems and also energy development problems. Ecological restoration has grown astoundingly in the past three decades. Our aims are to detect the evolution of research and engineering practice of ecological restoration, to find the focus changes in this field over time, to identify the relationships between the topics discussed in the field, and to sense the opportunities to match new changes. We conducted a statistical and bibliometrical analysis on published articles in ISI Web of Science database by using EndNoteX, SPSS, and RefViz. Materials published (n=4,862) between Jan., 1981 and Jun., 2009 were used in the analysis. Our results show that (1) Three distinct stages (1981-1996, 1997-2002, 2003-2009) were identified in temporal evolution of ecological restoration with total article numbers 59, 1403, and 3400, respectively. (2) The distributions of articles in three stages show that research topics extensively expanded in the second stage and research contents diversified in the third stage. (3) After analyzing associations, we established a framework that show ecological restoration research and practice has mainly focused on terrestrial ecosystem (main element is soil) and aquatic ecosystem (main element is water). Our opinion is that the trend of ecological restoration went from practices to science which covers a spectrum of quite different fields, including managemental, political, and technical aspects. Publication of diverse ecological restoration studies should be encouraged to speed up the transformation of this discipline. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Application of GIS and IS in Conservation and Management for
   Wetland in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wetlands; management strategy; Geographical Information Systems (GIS);
   Information Systems (IS); China
ID GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION-SYSTEMS; ENVIRONMENTAL-HEALTH; COAST
AB The aim of this paper is to put forward a strategic framework of wetland preservation and management based on Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and Information Systems (IS) in China. After analyzing the past and current wetland management in China, there were four problems identified existing in wetland management in China: a lack of wetland inventory, a lack of professional management, a delay in information online, and a lack of public participation in decision making. Thus, there is great need for establishing a conservation and management framework for both natural wetland and constructed wetland. A brief literature review is supplemented by a number of more detailed applications illustrating various GIS techniques which may be of use to the applied environmental issues or natural resources. GIS and IS could provide a platform to incorporate the complexities of the spatial data of all kinds of wetlands into the wetland inventory. The information collected through wetland inventories is essential for sustainable wetland management. Finally, the authors addressed the structure of the management system and put forward a strategy by online access that both benefit for decision making and public participation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Knowledge Discovery and Representation for Fishery
   Forecasting (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE knowledge discovery; extension data mining; ontology; fishery
   forecasting
AB In the marine industry there has always been immense research interest in maximizing accuracy of fishery forecasting. The fishery knowledge have a great impact on the accuracy, so this paper proposes a new knowledge discovery and representation model for obtaining and representing fishery knowledge, which takes a 3 step process. Firstly, it extracts static knowledge from database by SVM classifier and fuzzy classifier. Secondly, it uses extension data mining method to transfer static knowledge into dynamic knowledge. Thirdly, it establishes an ontology knowledge base by utilizing a mapping mechanism between the dynamic knowledge and ontology. Using the proposed model building procedure, the authors implemented a prototype system for fishery forecasting. Experimental results show that the proposed method is effective and efficient. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: CH4-CO2 Reforming to Syngas and Consumption Kinetics of
   Carbonaceous Catalyst (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE CH4 pyrolysis; CH4-CO2 reforming; carbonaceous catalyst; kinetics
ID CH4
AB CH4 pyrolysis and CH4-CO2 reforming to produce syngas was carried out in a quartz tubular reactor over blank and carbonaceous catalyst. Material balance analysis of C atom was conducted according to the calculated H. The gas composition was detected by an on line gas chromatograph with FPD and PID detector. It was found that CH4 pyrolysis decomposed into carbon and H-2. For CH4-CO2 reforming, firstly CH4 decomposed into carbon and H-2, the carbon then reacts with carbon monoxide to form carbon dioxide. As a comparison, blank tests were also performed. The results showed that the carbonaceous catalyst greatly decreased the initial reaction temperature (about decreased 50 degrees C), and promoted CH4 conversion. From the material balance analysis of C atom, it can be found that the mass of carbonaceous catalyst reduce during the carbon dioxide reforming reaction of methane. It indicated that the gasification of carbonaceous materials by CO2 takes place during the synthesis process. The consumption kinetics parameters of carbonaceous materials were determined by an overall unreacted shrinking core model. The apparent activation energy of consumption carbonaceous materials was more than 230kJ/mol during CH4-CO2 reforming. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Guojie; Zhang, Yongfa; Guo, Fengbo; Sun, Yaling; Xie, Kechang] Taiyuan Univ Technol, Minist Educ & Shanxi Prov, Key Lab Coal Sci & Technol, Taiyuan 030024, Peoples R China.
RP Zhang, GJ (reprint author), Taiyuan Univ Technol, Minist Educ & Shanxi Prov, Key Lab Coal Sci & Technol, Taiyuan 030024, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Assessing Powder Emission Risk on Large Open-air Yard of Coal
   Energy (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE modeling; powder emission; large open-air yard; wind tunnel; numerical
   simulation; coal energy
ID WIND-TUNNEL
AB Large stacker operation is a major source for powder on port. The previous studies on the patterns of generating coal powder on port need to be updated with applying modern large-scale machine. In this study, we aim to (1) design a model of large bulk stacker for wind tunnel test simulation; (2) unify the coal powder emission model based on formulas analysis and wind tunnel experiment; (3) establish a mathematical model of the large stacker operation powder emission pattern on port. The results show that (1) models of large bulk stacker were tested with tunnel test simulation; (2) the coal powder emission models were unified based on formulas analysis and wind tunnel experiment; (3) a mathematical model of the large stacker operation powder emission pattern on port was established. This model is fit for large stacker operation on port based on formulas review analysis, wind tunnel experiments and statistical analysis. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Grounding Effect on Common Mode Interference of Coal Mine
   Inverter (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE converter; common mode current; grounding impedance; PWM inverter; coal
   mine
ID PASSIVE EMI FILTER; LEAKAGE CURRENT; DRIVEN MOTOR
AB This paper put forward a new model to analyze the grounding effect on common mode interference of underground PWM inverter. Taking into account the grounding method, the author establishs a common mode equivalent circuit of underground inverter. After Comparison of calculation results by Matlab software simulation, it can be conclude that ungrounded neutral of transformer could redue common mode current in PWM system, but not very effective, the most efficient way is to increase grounding impedance of inverter and motor. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effect of Solution pH on Electrochemical Oxidation of
   Tetracycline (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE electrochemical oxidation; tetracycline; pH; DSA; PPCPs
ID WASTE-WATER TREATMENT; DEGRADATION; PHOTODEGRADATION
AB In order to figure out the effect of the initial pH of solutions on electrochemical oxidation, a commercial dimensionally stable anode (DSA) was employed for degradation of organic pollutants tetracycline and Orange II. It was observed that the process of electrochemical oxidation was highly pH dependent in a wide pH range from pH 2.0 to 12.0. Acidic and alkaline conditions were found to be especially favorable for the organics oxidation, but the lowest decolorization efficiency and COD removal was proved to be at pH 7.0. The use of NaCl was more effective for organics degradation than Na2SO4 because chlorine and hypochlorite ions were generated and involved in oxidation process. The effect of solution pH was basically resulted from the generation of oxidizing species other than the electrostatic attraction, which can influence the adsorption of organic pollutants onto the anode to a large extent. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Computer Application to Environmental Protection-an Review
   (Retracted Article)

DE computer technology; the environmental protection; IT pollution
ID WASTE
AB Application degree of computer can show the developmental level of one industry. Now the application to computer is universal and it penetrates into all fields of the environmental protection in the world, such as environment analysis, environment management, environment engineering, environment education and so on. At the same time, with rapid development of the computer applying to environmental industry, some negative effects are noticed, such as, the problem of IT pollution, the dispose of discarded computer hardware. In this paper, some studying on relation between computer and environment protection is reviewed and some advices are proposed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research Situation of Activated Sludge Process Software
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE mathematical models; activated sludge process; wastewater treatment
ID WASTE-WATER TREATMENT; SIMULATION
AB Activated sludge plays a very important position in biological wastewater treatment process, mathematical models and computer technology have been applied in activated sludge process widely. After fitting the experimental data and developing microbial growth kinetics model, the identification model based on biological wastewater treatment process characteristics became hot topic. This changed activated sludge process design into research of the dynamics activated sludge process for the target of high efficiency of low-power. Then, corresponding activated sludge process commercial software was developed. The first activated sludge process software based on ASM1 model, SSSP (simulation of single sludge process), was developed in 1988. With the modeling advanced development, various activated sludge process commercial software were developed, such as EFOR, STOAT, SASS PRo, DSP and GPS-X. In this paper the activated sludge software are introduced and some advises are proposed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Detecting Pipe Wall Biofilms in Water Distribution System
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Water distribution network; biofilm; sample collector; SEM
ID ASSIMILABLE ORGANIC-CARBON; BACTERIAL REGROWTH; DRINKING-WATER;
   PHOSPHORUS; NUTRIENTS; GROWTH; AOC
AB Biofilm growth within a water distribution system could lead to operational problems such as pipe corrosion and water quality deterioration. Three sites were selected for biofilm sample collection. A new method was developed using an ultrasound probe (sonicator) to remove the biofilms from the coupon for analysis while never hurt the bacterial on it. From the results of biofilm samples, it was found that the biofilm consisted of water, organic and non-organic materials. The results of the scanning electron microscope (SEM) observations shown that cocci bacteria, grouped as a cluster, were seen together with other material. High HPC values in some biofilm samples illustrated that the relevant sample sites had a high potential for biofilm growth. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Present Development and Countermeasures of Environmental
   Emergency in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE China; environmental emergency; legislative framewor; regulations;
   technical support system
AB This paper reviews the present development of environmental emergency in China that involves legislative framework, regulations and technical support system. Through the analysis of actual case, these deficiencies and problems existing in action of environmental emergency are pointed out. In the countermeasures, the punishment and fine ceiling for environmental violations should be raised by revising clauses, and fees about handling, inspection, restoring and compensation for pollution incidents should be put into the law system, and environmental protection departments should be the leadership to improve emergency response efficiency, and the technical support system should be established to build a series of technical guidelines, norms and work manuals around three procedures that include prevention and monitoring before incident, response and handling in incident and assessment and restore after incident. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Numerical Assessment of Mobile Emission Pollution at Highway
   Toll Stations (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Numerical simulation; Pollutant dispersion; Highway toll station;
   Computational Fluid Dynamics
ID STREET CANYON; DISPERSION; WORKERS; TOLLBOOTH
AB In order to assess the vehicle-induced pollution at highway toll stations in actual atmospheric conditions, a numerical simulation method based on CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) was proposed. A traffic micro simulation model and a three-dimensional CFD model were established according to the actual characteristics of toll stations. In the first model, the average travel time of all vehicles was calculated considering the variation of traffic volume and toll collection procedure. As a result, the pollutant emission source strength was obtained. In the second model, the change of air flow and pollutant dispersion condition could be simulated in consideration of the ambient conditions including wind speed, wind direction, air temperature, topography, etc. A case study of the Wutong Toll Station was given and the results between simulation and filed measurement were similar. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Cleaning Strategies for Flux Recovery of Ultrafiltraion
   Membrane Fouled by Reservoir Water (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ultrafiltration; physical cleaning; frequency; on-line chemical
   cleaning; drinking water treatment
ID ALGAE
AB Cleaning strategies for algae-fouled ultrafiltration membrane were investigated in pilot-scale experiments. Comparison of five different physical cleaning modes indicated that backwashing followed by forward flushing was more effective for flux recovery, and combining hydraulic cleaning with air sparge could improve the permeate flux recovery percent up to 87.49%. Cleaning frequency should be taken for the concentration of foulants and cleaning methods. To maximize flux recovery for the algae-fouled membrane, on-line chemical cleaning was studied, the permeate flux reduced only 5.37% after over 240h filtration duration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Dynamics Analysis Model for Energy Efficient Distributed
   Storage Systems (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Distributed Storage System; Energy Efficient; Cellular Automata;
   Dynamics
AB This paper presents a theoretical and experimental framework based on dynamics to model and analyze energy efficient distributed storage systems. A dynamics analysis model based on Cellular Automata (CA), called DSSCA, is proposed to evaluate distributed Object-based Storage (OBS) systems. DSSCA can have either finite or infinite size with high scalability. Each node represents an Object-based Device (OSD) and can communicate with the neighbor nodes autonomously and perform tasks independently without a centralized control. Moreover, simple energy efficient rules can be adopted by each node and then global behaviors emerge from the evolution and interaction of multiple individuals. To evaluate the intelligence of the system to changes of external behaviors, we proposed a heuristic power-aware mechanism. Each node has a write request queue, the length of which changes dynamically with access intensity and node throughput. In the simulation, we observe an appropriate threshold could both guarantee performance and save power. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Damage Assessment of Marine Oil Spill Pollution Using
   Back-Propagation Neural Network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Damage Assessment; Oil Spill Pollution; Back-Propagation (BP) Neural
   Network; MATLAB Simulation
AB With the increasing demand of global petroleum, viewing from oil tanker "Prestige" stranding to the latest "Deepwater Horizon Drilling rig" explosion, a variety of catastrophic oil spill accidents at sea, particularly ship's oil spill, has brought severe hazard to marine ecological environment and human society. Through the sample selected from the case database of historical ships' oil spill accidents in China, this paper establishes an artificial neural network model for damage assessment of marine oil spill pollution, and writes special program to train and simulate the Back-Propagation Neural Networks with MATLAB toolbox. The experimental results indicate that the damage assessment of oil spill by Back-Propagation Neural Networks is objectively precise and reliable, so as to provide an effective assessment method to claim for compensation caused by ship's oil spill accidents. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Inherent Biodegradability Characteritics of Light
   Greywater for the Different Bathe Products (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE greywater; Zehn-Wellens test; bathe products; inherent biodegradability;
   greywater; GPC
ID BIOLOGICAL TREATMENT; WATER
AB To evaluate the inherent biodegradability of light greywater for the bathe products, 8 kinds of shampoos and 3 kinds of soaps were chosen. The Zehn-Wellens test was conducted to examine the biodegradability of the greywater for these bathe products. Results showed that there was little biodegradable difference between the different bathe products we selected. Although the biochemical oxygen demand to chemical oxygen demand (BOD5/COD) of all of the greywater was less than 0.2, the biodegradation of these bathe products was rounded to the full percent after 28 days operation. Therefore, it was suggested that the method of using BOD5/COD to evaluate biodegradability might not be as accurate as we considered. Moreover, the molecular weight distributions of two typical kinds of greywater were analyzed by gel permeation chromatography (GPC). With the operation of the test from day 1 to day 28, the molecular weight distributions were getting narrower, and finally the fractions of the molecular weight below 10(5)Da accounted for 69.8% and 77.8% in Run 4 and Run 11, respectively. So, the greywater can be biodegraded to small molecules which were not harm to environment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Environmental Impact Estimation of Construction Industry in
   China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE environmental impact; estimation; construction industry
AB Construction industry has contributed a lot to the economic development during 30 years of reform and opening up in China. Because construction industry is typically an energy-intensive and resource-intensive industry, environmental impact situations are necessary to be found, especially for the purpose of improving performance of construction industry in China. In this paper, based on the data of National Bureau of Statistics of China and National Development and Reform Commission, characteristics of construction industry production have been analyzed. Then, the problem of estimation of environmental impact of construction industry is mainly converted into the total CO2 emissions during construction programme. Because of the dynamic nature of construction industry development and the specificity of sample data, leading to estimation of environmental impact difficulty, so a intelligent estimation model based on least squares support vector machines is presented to improve the prediction process. The proposed model takes advantage of LS-SVMs ability to solve the problem with small samples and nonlinear regression. Furthermore, the proposed approach is shown more accurate for prediction in the case of real-word application. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer- review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Test System on Waterpower about Geomembrane Based on PCI-1711
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE geomembrane; infiltration coefficient; Stillwater-fast pressure;
   PCI-1711; dynamic link library
AB The geomembrane play vital role in environmental protection by its characteristics of anti-infiltration, draining water and reinforcement. In order to promote automation test level about geomembrane, test system on waterpower about geomembrane is designed. Computer sends commands to driver card PCI-1020, using PCI-1020 card control stepper motor driver and stepper motor to apply pressure to sample, simultaneity, the sensor's signals were sent to PCI-1711 acquisition card for A / D conversion, then, PCI-1711 send data into computer. This article discuss the system's overall design, the hardware structure, software design, and process of data acquisition in detail. Software is designed by VB. Experiment results show that the test system possesses the advantages of high-speed data acquisition and high-accuracy. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Automatic Sorting of Solid Black Polymer Wastes based on
   Visual and Acoustic Sensors (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Sensor aided sorting; 3 Demensional imaging; impact acoustics; recycling
ID IMPACT ACOUSTICS
AB In solid waste treatment plants the waste gets crushed, classified and sorted. Among these processes the sorting is the determining step for recycling and reuse. Sensor based sorting technology has been developed and utilized for sorting of polymer ingredients in waste mixtures. One of the still remaining problem lies within the sorting of black polymer materials like plastics and rubbers which are very difficult to be sorted by conventional visual sensors. In this paper a new multi-sensor technology for black plastics sorting by using impact acoustic was introduced, since different plastics have different structures and acoustic emissions when an impact is given. A pilot multi-sensor sorting system which consists of a 3-dimensional visual sensor and an acoustic sensor was also built for this research and 3 kinds of plastics were tested. During the experiments the sizes of tested plastic pieces were measured by visual sensor and the acoustic emissions were captured by acoustic sensor. The signal processing and feature extraction of the visual and acoustic signals were realized by virtual instruments. The extracted features were used for classification of different plastic materials. Feature extraction by using power spectrum of each impact yield good result. This research provides a new approach for automatic sorting of black plastic polymers. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Tight Energy Supply Constraints and Technological Progress
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE energy cost; energy supply constraint; endogenous technological
   progress; Granger causality test
AB Energy prices have large impacts upon production costs and therefore economic growth. For an industrialized country with very tight energy supply constraints, increasing energy costs may drive the firms to seek for technological progress and innovation to compete internationally. Using the Japanese monthly data of 1975-2009, this study tests the assumption of endogenous cost-driven technological progress. We identify a long-run equilibrium cointegrating relationship among the Japanese industrial production, energy prices, export volumes and export prices. Although energy prices are negatively associated with Japanese industrial production in static equilibrium, the empirical results of Granger causality tests show that an increase in domestic energy costs has significantly positive effects on Japan's industrial production as well as on export volumes and prices, in both short-run and long-run. We document that there exists an endogenous technological progress driven by energy costs in Japan. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Hong, Yu] Jilin Univ Finance & Econ, 3699 Jingyue St, Changchun 130117, Peoples R China.
RP Hong, Y (reprint author), Jilin Univ Finance & Econ, 3699 Jingyue St, Changchun 130117, Peoples R China.
EM acjlhong@yahoo.com.cn

TI RETRACTED: Effect of Flue Gas Humidity on Toxic Gaseous Pollutants
   Conversion by Pulse Corona Plasma (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Corona plasma; water content in flue gas; nitrogen oxide; sulfur dioxide
ID DISCHARGE PLASMA; RADICAL SHOWER; SIMULTANEOUS REMOVAL; NOX REMOVAL;
   SO2; REDUCTION; OXIDATION; SYSTEMS; REACTOR
AB Water vapor content in flue gas has great effect on the corona discharge characteristic, as well as the removal rate of gaseous pollutants. This paper studied the destruction efficiency of nitric oxide, nitrogen dioxide and sulfur dioxide under different humidity of flue gas in a wire-to-plate type corona plasma reactor. The results indicate that humidity of flue gas increased the removal rate of water soluble pollutants such as NO2 and SO2, but had little influence on the removal of NO; in addition, ammonia sulfide advance the conversion of nitric oxide to nitrogen dioxide. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Factors Affecting Remediation of Diesel Oil Polluted Soil
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE diesel oil; remediation; soil; surfactant material; interfacial tension
ID INTERFACIAL-TENSION; CONTAMINATED SOIL; SURFACTANT
AB In order to evaluate the interfacial tension effect of solution on the remediation of diesel oil contaminated soil, column experiments were performed. The factors on oil removal effectives were studied through changing the pH, ethanol and SDS concentration. The results of experiments indicate that the elimination rate of diesel oil in soil increases with the decreasing of IFT of oil-solution. Water washing of a diesel-polluted soil could eliminate up to 11.6% of diesel oil. When the pH of solution is 8.0, the elimination effect is the most obvious and the elimination rate is 38.2%. The elimination rate reaches 80.7% when the volume concentration of ethanol is 70%. The elimination rate reaches 35.6% with 4CMC solution leaching. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
