TI RETRACTED: Establishment and Practice of China's Corporate Environmental
   Supervisor System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE corporate environmental supervisor; necessity; organizational framework;
   practice
AB Corporate Environmental Supervisor System is established referring to Japan's public pollution prevention manager system and combining the actual situation in our country. Looking at the existing environmental regulatory system, China has built a relatively perfect monitoring system for corporate environmental pollution control, but the internal corporate environmental management is weak, corporate social and environmental responsibility not strong, internal corporate environmental management organizational system unperfected and the rights, obligations and responsibilities of corporate environmental managers indeterminate. The establishment of the corporate environmental supervisor system helps and guides enterprises to designate an environmental management director filled by the owners of enterprises and an internal corporate environmental management system consisting of at-work environmental supervisors, and the supervision and inspection of all the aspects of production are conducted by the environment supervisors who grasp environmental laws and regulations and are familiar with the production technology and pollution discharge situation of their enterprises to extend the corporate pollution prevention from the end-treatment to the whole production process. This will effectively promote the enterprises to enhance the subject responsibility and comprehensively reduce the polluting emission. In this paper, the Necessity of China's environmental supervisor system, the theoretical framework and practice are discussed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Tian, Jingyi] NE Univ Qinhuangdao, Dept Environm Sci & Engn, Qinhuangdao 066000, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Impact of C/N Ratio on Nitrogen Changing during Composting
   with Poultry Manure (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE poultry manure; C/N ratio; Nitrogen
ID EMISSIONS; WASTE
AB Poultry manure, municipal solid waste were composted in a static vessel to testify the practicability of aerobic co-composting with C/N ratio 15, 20 and 25. Total nitrogen, ammonium nitrogen and nitrate nitrogen transformation were measured during composting. C/N ratios of three treatments all tended to decrease and it was remarkable at the treatment of PMC25 during composting. The total nitrogen reduced gradually with the composting time. The lower the C/N ratio was, the higher the final total nitrogen concentration has. Main way of nitrogen loss was volatilization in the form of ammonia originated from ammonium. The main period of nitrogen loss was during the thermophilic composting time, at the same time, the NH4+-N decreased. The NO3--N increased after thermophilic composting time. The concentration of usable nitrogen was increased after composting. The experimental results showed that composting with low C/N ratios is feasible. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE mobile Agent; slice; EAMS
AB In order to solve the problems of diversity of platforms, server load balancing, scalability and decoupling between modules, an architecture based on distributed middleware Internet Communication Engine(ICE) was proposed. In the architecture, mobile Agent was adopted to improve the publish/subscribe(P/S) model of traditional ICE architecture. The architecture was applied to construct EAMS software. It shows that, the architecture greatly improves the portability, scalability and performance of EAMS, and also reduces the system development time and costs. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Field study of Riverbank Filtration for Pollutants Removal in
   Huai River Water (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia

DE Huai River; riverbank filtration; RBF; bank filtration;
   surface-groundwater interaction; pollutant removal; ammonia nitrogen;
   organic pollutants; field study
ID BANK FILTRATION; MICROORGANISMS
AB Base on the previous study of organic substances and ammonia nitrogen removal efficiency through laboratory continuous flow-through riverbank filtration (RBF) models, field study were carried out to evaluate the results drawn from small model experiments. Five wells were selected to in this riverbank filtration process field study. The results indicated that the priority pollutants, organic substances and ammonia nitrogen, could be removed to a great extent. The results also indicate that the quality of the Huai River water is acceptable to operate the abstraction system with the riverbank filtration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research on Development Model of Low-carbon Economy in
   Resource-based Cities (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Resource-based cities; Low carbon economy; Low-carbon transition;
   Development Model
ID CO2 EMISSION
AB Global energy shortages and climate change promote low carbon economy become an important research focus. A study on model of urban low-carbon Transformation has important theoretical and practical value for the promotion of sustainable development in resource-based cities. In this paper, resource-based cities as a study object, by analyzing five constraints impact on the low-carbon transition of resource-based cities, we proposed five low-carbon transition models and paths for resource-based cities: the ecological evolution model, technological innovation model, alternative models for industry, demand-driven model and policy guidance model. Our study strongly suggests that relevant governments in the resource-based cities should draw up policies and take measures to effectively guide low-carbon transition. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication

DE ultraviolet ray; nanometer particles; thin film; protection
AB To mankind, ultraviolet ray from the sun is harmful and beneficial. But, in daily life, a lot of occasions, we hope to block the ultraviolet ray. Some people studied the nanometer particles which can block Ultraviolet ray. In this paper, the protection performance of nanometer particles, prepared by sol-gel method, added into polypropylene sour to ultraviolet has been studied. In order to improve the ultraviolet blocking of the thin film, more than one kind of nanometer particles are added into the polypropylene sour, the protection performance of the thin film is strengthened. By experiment, the best ratios of single and double component nanometer materials are obtained with which the thin film can shield UVC; UVB and UVA significantly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: A Kind of Novel Water Treatment Device with Atomization
   Nozzle-Cylinder Electrode (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Type your keywords here; separated by semicolons; non-thermal plasma;
   negative corona discharge; water treatment; atomization; radicals
ID PULSED CORONA DISCHARGE; HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE; DESULFURIZATION; PHENOL;
   PLASMA; AIR
AB A kind of novel water treatment device by non-thermal plasma was proposed. Water was atomized by nozzle discharge electrode supplied with high voltage. Chance of the reaction between the non-thermal plasma and the contamination in the water was improved. Non-thermal plasma, especially hydroxyl radicals was measured near the nozzle-discharge electrode with water injected into the treatment chamber through the nozzle by optical emission spectroscopy. Hydroxyl radicals produced in this device was proved. The effect of negative direct current corona discharge, positive direct current corona discharge and negative pulsed discharge on the hydroxyl radicals' production was investigated. In addition, the electric characteristics of the device were given. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: White-rot Fungi Immobilized by Bacterial Cellulose to Deal
   with Malachite Green Dye Wastewater (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE White-rot fungi; immobilizing; bacterial cellulose; malachite green; dye
   wastewater
AB After the white-rot fungi were immobilized in different ways, not only was its biological activity increased significantly, but also its ability to pure wastewater was enhanced a great deal. In this experiment, white-rot fungi immobilized by polyvinyl alcohol-sodium alginate, bacterial cellulose dynamic adsorption and bacterial cellulose static adsorption, was used to deal with malachite green dye wastewater. The results showed that the most effective way to pure the malachite green wastewater was white-rot fungi immobilization by the bacterial cellulose static adsorption. The color removal rate remained more than 93% on the former six groups of wastewater, which was increased 3% more than free bacteria. It exceeded the other two methods in efficiency and stability of color removal. As an immobilized carrier, bacterial cellulose is biodegradable, immobilized operation simply, etc and applicable to industrial production and this method has a great potential. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   Denitrifying Bacteria Loaded by Modified Bacterial Cellulose to
   Nitrogenous Wastewater (Retracted Article)

CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE heterotrophic heterotrophic nitrification - aerobic denitrifier;
   immobilizing; bacterial cellulose; modification; nitrogenous wastewater
AB H1 was immobilized by modified and natural BC to treat nitrogenous wastewater. The result showed that H1 which was immobilized by natural BC treated nitrate-rich and ammonium-rich wastewater, the efficiencies of TN removal were 50.98% and 60.2%, respectively. While H1 was immobilized by modified BC had higher removal effects than natural BC, were up to 74.3% and 75.75%. Because the organic matter which was added to BC in the process of modification, the removal of CODcr was slightly lower than the natural membrane. It was found that modification can improve toughness of BC, overcame the shortcoming of easy degradation, and which was convenient to recycle H1. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Numerical Simulation of Hydraulic Characteristic of Oxidation
   Ditch with New Corrugated Board Guide Wall (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE oxidation ditch; corrugated board; guide wall; flow analysis
AB Based on the Navier-Stokes equations and the k-epsilon turbulent flow model, the numerical simulation was carried out for the water flows by using CFD program FLUENT. A new corrugated board structure in the oxidation ditch is proposed and the flow pattern and flow velocity distribution is calculated by using numerical simulation. The extended guide wall and the non-extended guide wall are also compared by using numerical simulation. The results show that vortex behind the non-extended guide wall in oxidation ditch was the largest, and vortex behind the flat guide wall was the smallest. Seen from the perspective of reducing vortex, the velocity distribution of water flow in corrugated board oxidation ditch was the best. The new corrugated board structure will reduce the low water flow areas behind wall in oxidation ditch and improve the role of eliminating sludge deposition. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Asorption Reaction Space in Activated Carbon Desulfurization
   on the Condition of Desorbing by Water (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE activated carbon; adsorption site; reaction space; desulfurization from
   flue gas
ID FLUE-GAS; SO2; REMOVAL; FIBERS; FILMS
AB Mechanism of activated carbon desulfurization under the condition of desorption by water is researched according to the result of adsorbing performance experiment using different adsorbents. A new theory is proposed to explain the oxidation process of SO2 and the formation of the effective adsorption sites when water exists. Argument is presented that effective adsorption sites are produced only at a certain reaction space that can provide appropriate distances and configurations between reactant molecules. Analysis and estimation of reaction space in the whole reaction process are done on the basis of Zawadzki's desulfurization theory. Studies show that the aperture distribution of adsorbent is a crucial factor in the adsorption process and effective adsorbing reaction space will generate when aperture width is over 1.0nm. Results of this study will lead a correct choice of the suitable activated carbon for flue gas desulfurization and effectively increase activated carbon's adsorption capacity for SO2. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Effect of Environmental Temperature Variations on the
   Force and Deformation of Arch Centering and Concrete Arch Ring
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Environmental temperature; box arch ring; arch centering; stress;
   deformation
AB During construction of reinforced concrete box arch ring cast-in-place with aid of arch centering, the environmental temperature variations usually have a huge impact on the arch centering and arch ring, including the displacement variations of arch centering and the stress variations of bars. In this paper, the finite element method was employed to study the effect of environmental temperature variations on the force and deformation of arch centering and the stress in the concrete arch ring. The results show that environmental temperature variations have little or nothing influence on the deformation of arch centering and great influence on the stress in arch centering and concrete. The stress in lower chords around arch crown increases and the stress in upper chords decreases with environmental temperature rising, which causing the stress in arch centering more uniform and compressive stress in the whole cross-section of arch ring. Meanwhile, the stress in bars around arch foot (that is high stress area) increases significantly and the tensile stress may come forth in the arch ring boot with environmental temperature dropping. The tensile stress may even cause cracks. Therefore, temperature enhancement is beneficial for the arch centering and arch ring, and on the contrary, temperature reduction is baleful. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Sichuan Coll Architecture Technol, Deyang, Peoples R China.
RP He, W (reprint author), Sichuan Coll Architecture Technol, Deyang, Peoples R China.
EM hew1981@gmail.com

TI RETRACTED: Numerical Method for Earthquake-induced pounding between
   Girder and Shear key-II: Verification (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Pounding; seismic response; impact force; numerical simulation
ID CONTACT FORCE MODEL; DYNAMIC-RESPONSE; CRACKS
AB In bridges, seismic pounding may result in considerable damage during severe ground motions, such as localized girder damage, damage to shear key and abutments, and even contribute to the collapse of bridge spans. A numerical method had been developed. The paper mainly verified the numerical method through the comparison the numerical results and the experimental results. Two testes-steel-steel pounding and concrete-concrete pounding-are employed. The influence of the time step length on the numerical results is studied. From the parameter analysis, we find that time step length has much influence on impact force calculation and little influence on the displacement and velocity calculation and the time step Delta t = 0.0002s can meet the computing needs in these cases, but the value is not fixed. The time step length may be different when the parameters of impact bodies change. The time step length can be determined by comparing. In this paper, the overall prediction of the relative impact velocities is consistent with the experimental data. It shows that the numerical method is accurate and can be used in the engineering applications. In addition, it is noted that pounding may lead to considerable change of the structural response during the earthquake. So we should pay much attention to the influence of earthquake-induced pounding on the bridge seismic response. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Traffic States Identification based on Fixed Detectors and
   Floating Cars (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Traffic state; Travel time; Global position system; Information fusion
AB In this study, considering the variation characteristics of traffic information detected from fixed detectors and GPS in different road traffic states, we proposed a new identification method of traffic states, and did an analysis of traffic parameters' sensitivity to the traffic states changes, and selected the appropriate traffic parameters to discriminate the traffic states. Travel speed is an important parameter to discriminate traffic states, and proposed a new estimation method of link travel speed based on downstream loop detectors of road section. Traffic states have the characteristics of fuzziness, so fuzzy comprehensive evaluation was used in the proposed method, and developed a multi-parameter and multi-level fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method. Results of an empirical study are presented. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Fabrication and Digital Reconstruction of an Improved Fourier
   Computer-generated Hologram (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE computer-generated hologram(CGH); Fourier transform; Burch coding; twin
   images; digital reconstruction
AB This paper proposed a novel method that improves the effects of traditional fabrication and digital reconstruction on the Burch-type Fourier computer-generated hologram (CGH). By using the proposed approach, the problem of inseparable twin images in Burch-type CGH was solved. After the hologram was generated, a more clear reconstructed image was obtained by using a series of measures that improve the quality of hologram. The experimental result showed the feasibility of the proposed method for improving the quality of the reconstructed images in Fourier transform holograms. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: An Integrated Strategy for Functional Analysis in 16S rRNA
   Gene-based Research of Microbial Communities by GENE ONTOLOGY (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE microbial community; 16s rRNA; Gene Ontology enrichment component;
   GO-terms Semantic Similarity
ID COLON-CANCER; GUT; METABOLISM; SIMILARITY; DIVERSITY; DISEASE; HEALTH;
   FLORA
AB The environment and human serve as elaborate hosts to microbes, including a diversity of commensal and pathogenic bacteria that contribute to both health and disease. 16S rRNA genes are used for community profiling, or determining the abundance of each kind of microbe. The aim of our study is to analyze the similarity among microbial communities on the functional state, after assigned 16S rRNA sequences from all microbial communities to species. It's an important addition to the species-level relationship between two compared communities, and can quantify their differences in function. To accomplish this aim, we downloaded all functional annotation data of microbiota from related datasets. It's developed to identify the functional distribution and the significantly enriched functional categories of microbial communities. Exploration of the function relationship between two sets of species assemblages will be a key result of microbiome studies and may provide new insights into assembly of a wide range of ecosystems. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Correlation Analysis of Real Estate Industry and Its
   Related Industries in JiLin Province (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE real estate industry; correlation; input-output model
AB As an important pillar industry of national economy, the real estate industry is usually the first one of important industries that governments implement macroeconomic control. Because it has its own characteristics, such as long chain, wide ramifications and strong promotion, the rapid development of real estate industry produces different degree of chain reaction about its related industry. Based on the input-output model, the paper makes quantitative analysis about the correlation of the real estate industry and its related industries in JiLin Province, reveals the variation of them, has important significance of promoting the coordinated development between real estate industry and other related industries, and provide the beneficial reference for formulating real estate development planning and economic policy of JiLin Province. TI RETRACTED: Effects of Elevated Temperature on Performance and Microbial
   Community Structure in ASBR Treating Thermal-Hydrolyzed Sewage Sludge
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE sewage sludge; thermal-hydrolyzed; ASBR; Temperature; PCR-DGGE
ID WASTE ACTIVATED-SLUDGE; SEQUENCING BATCH REACTOR; ANAEROBIC-DIGESTION;
   START-UP; PRETREATMENT; WATER; MANURE; PLANT
AB The impact of elevated temperature on microbial community structure and performance during anaerobic sequencing batch reactor (ASBR) treating thermal-hydrolyzed sewage sludge at temperatures ranging from 35-53 degrees C was investigated. The performance of the ASBR reactor took a different change in the three different processes of the step-wise temperature increment. There was a slight effect on the digestion process between the first step-increase (from 35 degrees C to 40 degrees C)and final step-increase (from 47 degrees C to 53 degrees C). The second step-increase (from 40 degrees C to 47 degrees C) resulted in a severe disturbance. At the temperature of 53 degrees C, the average daily gas production, specific methane production (CH4/CODinfluent) of the ASBR treating thermal-hydrolyzed sewage sludge were 2.038L/d, 188.8mL/g, respectively. Microbial community analysis by denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis (DGGE) revealed that distinct bacteria and archaea consortia were supported at each temperature. Temperature served as a selective pressure for microbial community development during the treatment. There was a gradual shift in bacteria and archaea consortia as temperature varied. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ouyang Er-ming] Nanchang Univ, Sch Civil Engn & Architecture, Nanchang 330031, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Modeling the Effect of Ionic Strength on Colloid Deposition
   and Release in Saturated Porous Media (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE colloid; ionic strength; deposition-release; model; porous media
ID TRANSPORT; MOBILIZATION; SIMULATIONS; SAND
AB Colloid mobilization has been shown to facilitate the movement of contaminants through the subsurface. Knowledge of deposition and release of colloids is requisite to predicting the contaminant transport. This paper focuses on colloid deposition and release under different ionic strength in saturated porous media and a model is developed to simulate experimental results. Our work demonstrates that release of colloids was sensitive to the ionic strength, which caused varies spatial and temporal variation of release rate. Traditional One-site model could not describe steep ascending of detached colloids. Dynamic one-site model and two-site model reflect the heterogeneity induced by perturbation of solute concentration. Two-site model was appropriate experimentally and theoretically by dividing the solid phase into two fractions. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Xu Shao-Hui] Qingdao Univ, Coll Chem Engn & Environm, Qingdao 266071, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of Arch Centering Subjected to the Action of Water
   Flow during Construction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Water flow; arch centering; arch ring; lateral stiffness
ID LOAD-CARRYING CAPACITY; STEEL ARCHES
AB During construction of reinforced concrete box arch ring cast-in-place with aid of arch centering, the water flow usually has a huge impact on the arch centering and arch ring, if the construction period coincides with the flood. Excessive impact may cause out-plane buckling of the arch centering, resulting in extremely serious consequences. In the paper, the finite element method was employed to study the impact of water flow on the centering during construction with two different construction schemes for a long span arch bridge. The results show that transverse displacement will occur in arch crown when arch ring subjected to the action of water flow. Different displacement will occur with different construction schemes. The construction scheme with a small transverse displacement should be chosen to ensure the construction safety program. This construction scheme has a feature that the lateral stiffness of the arch centering and arch ring is strong. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Sichuan Coll Architecture Technol, Deyang, Peoples R China.
RP He, W (reprint author), Sichuan Coll Architecture Technol, Deyang, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Fuzzy Logic Applications in Sacrificial Shear Keys Scheme
   Comparison (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fuzzy logic; fuzzy integrated evaluation; sacrificial; shear key;
   Euclidean distance
AB Selecting process of scheme design of sacrificial shear key has been very important issue for engineer for years, because the improper selection of sacrificial shear key might cause of many problems affecting negatively on effectiveness of reliability during severe ground motions and economic rationality, construction feasibility and technical feasibility post-earthquake rehabilitation. In the paper, the fuzzy integrated evaluation is used for sacrificial shear key scheme selection problem due to the fact that it has been widely used in evaluating various kinds of multiple-criteria decision making problems in both academic researches and practices. The fuzzy statistical method was employed to statistics experts' remarks to generate the fuzzy set membership. The average weight method was proposed to determine the weights. The procedures of the proposed method were that determining the initial weights by experts mark ratings and then calculating the average of initial weights. In addition, Euclidean distance was employed to represent the deviation of scheme design from the perfect one and ultimately determine the optimum scheme. A case study was also presented to make this approach more understandable for a decision-maker(s). The sacrificial shear key scheme selection proposed by this paper can effectively solve the sacrificial shear key scheme selection problem. It is can be used in the bridge seismic design. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

RP He, W (reprint author), Sichuan Coll Architecture Technol, Deyang, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: CLASSIFICATION TECHNOLOGY BY LEAST SQUARES SUPPORT VECTOR
   MACHINE TRAINED BY CHAOS PARTICLE SWARM OPTIMIZATION (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE least squares; classification technology; particle swarm optimization;
   chaos
ID ARTIFICIAL NEURAL-NETWORKS
AB In the paper, least squares support vector machine trained by chaos particle swarm optimization (CPSO-LSSVM) is applied in the classification. Chaos particle swarm optimization algorithm is introduced to select the suitable training parameters of least squares support vector machine. That is because chaos particle swarm optimization algorithm can avoid being trapped in local optimum and gaining the global optimum quickly in the process of search by combining particle swarm optimization with chaos queues. The experimental results demonstrate that least squares support vector machine trained by chaos particle swarm optimization is best classification results in the three classification algorithms. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Practical Internet of Things System for Mine Application
   (Retracted Article)

DE RFID; IOT; RealTime Location; RR Algorithm
AB This paper introduces a practical monitoring system, which integrates RFID transceivers with kinds of pressure sensors to enable to locate the real time position of miners under the mine as well as to detect kinds of pressure parameters, which are critical for the mining process. The background UDP software platform uses a modified round robin algorithm to communicate with sub-stations under the mine to obtain the real-time information. TI RETRACTED: Clamp-on Grounding Resistance Measurement Device Based on
   MSP430 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE grounding resistance; digital filtering; variable-frequency measurement
   technique
AB This paper presents a grounding resistance measurement device based on MSP430. The device makes use of variable-frequency measurement technology, which can automatically select frequency to avoid strong interference band. Therefore it has strong anti-interference ability. Digital filtering and Discrete Fourier Transforms (DFT) techniques are introduced to the system to eliminate the grounding noise and harmonic interferences effectively, which guarantees high measuring accuracy. The results of simulation measurement in laboratory show that the performance of the measurement is stable and the device has a strong anti-interference ability, furthermore, the accuracy of the device is quite high. TI RETRACTED: Sensitivity Analysis on Environmental Capacity Model of
   Nitrogen and Phosphorus for Lake and Reservoir (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Elastic coefficient; Water environment capacity; Model parameter;
   Sensitivity
AB Taking a certain large water supply reservoir as example, this paper applies homa solution of lake perfect mixing attenuation model to analyze lake volume, lake staying time and degradation coefficient's effect on water environment capacity of total nitrogen and total phosphorus. The elastic coefficients are used as sensitivity indicators to discuss the above three model parameters' contribution rates to environmental capacity. The contribution rates of lake volume, staying time and degradation coefficient to total nitrogen capacity are respectively 36%, 29% and 35%, and the contribution rates to total phosphorus capacity are respectively 26%, 43% and 31%. The results show that the variation of model parameters can change dramatically dilution, degradation and displace capacity, and the change will affect the total environmental capacity. From the average value of elastic coefficient, each model parameter has great contribution to total nitrogen and total phosphorus environment capacity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ding Tao; Liu Liming] China Jiliang Univ, XueYuan St 258, Hangzhou 310018, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of the Influences of Soil and Water Conservation
   Measure on Anti-erodibility of Underlying Surface in Losee Plateau
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia

SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Losee Plateau; Soil and Water Conservation; Anti-erodibility; Soil and
   Water Loss
AB The text supported by GIS and RS technique, and adopting analytic hierarchic process and Delphi consultative method builds quantitative evaluation index system of the effect on the anti-erodibility of underlying surface under the protection of soil and water conservation measures. The text takes the Chabagou basin for example, analyses quantitatively the effect of soil and water conservation measures on the anti-erodibility in 1990 and in 2004, and obtains the score of each measure. The score from the high to low is: forestation and grass planting (55), check dam (45), terrace (29). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: A New Method of Extracting Concentric Rings from X-ray
   Coherent Scatter Images (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Coherent scatter; Adaptive Threshold; Orthogonal energy projection;
   Centroid; Energy curve
AB The extraction of concentric rings from x-ray coherent scatter images is the key step to calculate the energy distribution curve of x-ray coherent scatter images. In this paper, the image was transformed successively into a binary image by using adaptive threshold algorithm and Mathematical Morphology methods. The effective region was extracted from the binary image in the orthogonal energy projection space. And the centroid of rings was calculated. The centroid is the circular center of ring. And pixels have same Euclidean distance to the center construct a ring. The sum of square of gray-level of pixels in a ring is the energy of the ring. Then the curve of the energy distribution was built in whole image. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Liu, Taihui; Liu, Jun; Xie, Chengjun] Beihua Univ, Coll Comp, Jilin 132031, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Research on the Volatility of BDI Empirical analysis from the
   years of 2007-2009 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Shanghai Stock Exchange Composite Index; volatility; correlation
AB The volatility of Baltic Dry Index (BDI) from the year 2007 to 2009 reflects the historical features of the world's shipping economy during the period of financial crisis. BDI in 2007 reflects the boom period of international shipping market economy. The rise and fall of volatility of BDI in 2008 shows the recession sign due to financial crisis. The reiterative uptrend of BDI in 2009 indicates the hesitated recovery of the economic crisis. The basic trend of the BDI reveals the movement trend of M, U and W shape. The aim of this paper is to valid the degree of volatility and risk of BDI by choosing the week average of BDI from the year 2007 to 2009 as empirical data, with the detailed research approach by using curve trend to make qualitative analysis and statistical principle to make volatility analysis. The conclusion is that the volatility of BDI from the year 2007 to 2009 effectively reflects the fluctuations of shipping economy and proves that BDI is an indicator to reflect high risk. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: An Environmental Risk Assessment Framework for Identification
   of Environmental Risk Sources in Industrial Park (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE environmental risk assessment; environmental risk sources; industrial
   park
ID SITE; TOOL
AB Nowadays, identification of environmental risk sources which need to be focused on becomes an urgent requirement in environmental risk management in industrial park. This paper proposes a conceptual assessment framework for identification of environmental risk sources, according to the characteristics of environmental risks in an industrial park. The study divided the identification process into four steps, including source analysis, receptor analysis, risk characterization and risk assessment. This risk assessment method helps to identify environmental risk sources which need to be focused on and their priority, and provide scientific foundation for security management of industrial parks and enterprises. TI RETRACTED: Preparation of Fe3O4 Nanoparticles by Use of Catalytically
   Oxidized Liquids of Cyanide Tailings by NOx and Research of Its
   Adsorption Properties (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Oxidized liquids of cyanide tailings; Reduction of co-precipitation;
   Fe3O4 nanoparticles; Langmuir adsorption isotherms; Recycle
AB Ferric ion in catalytically oxidized liquids of cyanide tailings by NOx was separated by solvent extraction technology or precipitation method, then the separated ferric ion was reduced partially by iron. At last, two different kinds of Fe3O4 nanoparticles were prepared from the two kind of different ferric liquid. The particle size and magnetic properties of Fe3O4 were studied. It is concluded that Fe3O4 nanoparticles made from precipitation method is one kind of super-paramagnetic particle, with an approximately diameter of 20nm, saturate magnetization of 58.72 emu/g and surface area of 235m(2)/g, compared with those particles from the other separation method. The adsorption performance was studied by degeneration methyl orange (MO). Results show that the adsorption property of highly concentrated MO is better. The adsorption rate can achieve above 90% under 200 times of dosage, low temperature and the acidic condition. The adsorption process is the spontaneous exothermic reaction. Relationship between balanced adsorptive capacity q and the balance mass density C-e is well conformed with the Langmuir adsorption isotherms, which belongs to the monolayer adsorption. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A clustering-based multiple ant colony system for the waste
   collection vehicle routing problems (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE CVRP-IF; ACS; reverse logistics; waste collection management
ID NETWORKS
AB The waste collection vehicle routing problems with time windows and intermediate facilities (WCVRPTW-IF) is actually belong to a well-known generalization of VRP, the Multi-Depot Vehicle Routing Problem with Inter-Depot Routes (MDVRPI), which is a combinatorial optimization problem and holds a central place in reverse logistics management. In order to improve the route compactness, which is very important in practical application, we presents a clustering-based multiple ant colony system approach called CMACS algorithm to solve CVRPTW-IF. Our CMACS possesses a new strategy to construct solutions, called clustering-based strategy, and mutation operation. Tests are conducted on two standard instances. The results show that CMACS algorithm exhibits a robust behavior and the clustering-based strategy is effective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Organic Loading Rate on the Formation and the
   Phosphorus Removal of Granular Sludge (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE SBR; DO; granular sludge with phosphorus removal; OLR
ID AEROBIC GRANULATION; REACTOR
AB In this study the influence of Organic Loading Rate (OLR) on the formation and phosphorus removal efficiency of granular sludge was investigated in an Sequencing Batch Reactor (SBR). The SBR was operated as an alternating anaerobic-aerobic cycle, and the Dissolved Oxygen (DO) concentration in the period of aerobic feast time in an SBR-cycle was maintained 1 similar to 2mg/L, the low DO concentration was obtained by reducing the air flow rate. Experiment results showed that, the sludge in the SBR was the mixture of a majority of activated sludge floc and a small quantity of round-shaped granular at the OLR of 0.482 similar to 0.986kgCOD/(m(3).d); granulation was accelerated at the early time of the OLR of 2.218 similar to 2.263kgCOD/(m(3).d), while the morphology of granules changed to an irregular shape on the end of the OLR of 2.218 similar to 2.263kgCOD/(m(3).d); then the OLR decreased to 1.113 similar to 1.182kgCOD/(m(3).d), the mature granules was cultivated successfully at this OLR, due to the combination effects of the low DO and the OLR. The OLR had also influence on efficiency of phosphorus removal, when the OLR was elevated to 2.218 similar to 2.263kgCOD/(m(3).d), competition between GAOs and PAOs was triggered. Which led to efficiency of phosphorus removal declined, and could not recovered even if the OLR was decreased to 1.113 similar to 1.182 kgCOD/(m(3).d). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Xiaoling-Zhang; Shan-Liu] Changan Univ, Sch Environm Sci & Engn, Xian, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Ecological and Agricultural Construction Models in a
   Watershed on the Chinese Loess Plateau (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Eco-environmental restoration; ecological engineering; eco-agricultural
   models
ID EROSION
AB On the Loess Plateau of China, the local people have been struggling on low incomes to guarantee their food security, and contend with some of the most serious soil erosion problems in the world. This paper discusses the application, over ten years, of an ecosystem recovery plan based on the sustainable eco-agricultural theories, introduced in the Yan'gou watershed in 1998, including three eco-agricultural construction models intended to control soil and water losses, increase agricultural production and rise income levels. The economic and eco-environmental benefits achieved during this period of reconstruction are analyzed. The evidence indicates that the combination of comprehensive measures to prevent eco-environmental degradation and the application of eco-agricultural models was appropriate. The eco-environment has been improved and the local people are now having higher incomes and much better living conditions. The application of three eco-agricultural construction models provide scientific evidence, and are exemplary illustration of what may be accomplished by investing in eco-environmental restoration and eco-agricultural construction on the Loess Plateau. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on PVA-Immobilized Denitrifiers in Seawater (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE PVA; immobilized; denitrifying bacteria; seawater
ID CELLS
AB The immobilization of denitrifying bacteria by PVA in seawater was studied, and the effects of pH and temperature on the nitrogen removal efficiency of immobilized ball were investigated. Results showed in the appropriate environment, the nitrogen removal efficiency of immobilized balls was lower than those not immobilized denitrifying bacteria. However, when the environment was not suitable for the growth of denitrifying bacteria (eg. pH5.0, temperature 10 degrees C), the immobilized ball could increase the nitrogen removal efficiency compared with those not immobilized due to their protect effect. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Adsorption Behaviors of As (III) from Aqueous Solutions on
   Ferric hydroxide (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE arsenic; adsorption; ferric hydroxide; isotherms
ID ARSENIC REMOVAL; KINETICS
AB Arsenic is classified as one of the most toxic and carcinogenic chemical element and removal of As (III) from water is of great importance. The adsorption of As (III) in water on ferric hydroxide and the influencing factor (pH) were studied. Results showed the adsorption process fitted the second-order reaction model, and the saturated adsorption capability can be reached in 4h. As (III) removal efficiency is the highest when pH is 6.8. The adsorption isotherms could be described as Langmuir's equation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Adsorption of Bovine Serum Albumin on Nano-Hydroxyapatite
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Hydroxyapatite; Bovine serum albumin; Adsorption
AB Based on the synthetic nano-hydroxyapatite, we investigated its adsorption character of bovine serum albumin (BSA) dissolved in water by batch adsorption experiments. Results showed that many parameters would influence the protein adsorption process, including contact time, temperature, ionic strength, initial protein concentration and so on. The adsorption capacity increased with increasing contact time and established the equilibrium after 60 minutes. The amount of protein adsorption increased as the initial protein concentration and ionic strength, but decrease of the temperature resulted in the increase of protein adsorption quantity. The isotherm studies showed that the Langmuir model was the best choice to describe the protein adsorption behaviors of n-HAp at 37 degrees C. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effect of Filter Bed Temperature on Municipal Wastewater
   Treatment Efficiency by Vermifiltration (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Vermifiltration; filter bed temperature; quartz sand; ceramisite grain;
   sewage treatment efficiency
AB Effect of filter bed temperature on sewage treatment efficiency by vermifiltration was studied by analyzing influent and effluent quality of vermifiltration at hydraulic loading of 4.8m(3)/m(2).d in a pilot scale. The results showed that the influence of the filter bed temperature on the removal of organics was in accordance with the binomial distribution and that on removal of NH4+-N was in accordance with the Sigmoidal equation. No obvious influence was detected on the removal of TN and TP. The experimental results also indicated that the optimal filter bed temperature of the quartz sand vermifiltration and the ceramisite grain vermifiltration were in the range of 15 similar to 24 degrees C and 18 similar to 25 degrees C, respectively. The ceramisite grain has a buffer capacity with the variations of the filter bed temperature, which has better resistance to the adverse impact of vermifiltration under lower and higher temperature conditions than that of the quartz sand. Additionally, the analysis of the insignificant influence of the different filter bed temperature on the removal of TN and TP was carried out. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yin, Zhi-gao; Xing, Mei-yan; Yang, Jian; Huang, Zhi-dong] State Key Lab Pollut Control & Resource Reuse, Shanghai 200092, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Adsorption of Bovine Serum Albumin on Mesoporous Silica
   MCM-41 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE MCM-41; Bovine Serum Albumin; Adsorption
ID STABILITY; SBA-15; PH
AB The adsorption properties of mesoporous silica MCM-41 was investigated using adsorption of Bovine Serum Albumin (BSA) dissolved in water media. The results showed that all parameters might influence the adsorption quantity which included the effect of adsorption time, adsorbent dose, initial BSA concentration and the effect of temperature. The adsorption quantity increased with the increase of the adsorption time and initial BSA concentration. The optimum adsorbent dose was considered to be 30mg. Increase of the temperature resulted in the increase of adsorption quantity. The isotherm studies showed that Langmuir and Freundlich models were both to describe the adsorption behavior of MCM-41. These results showed that MCM-41 was a kind of suitable material in the field of biomedical. c 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of ICEES 2011. TI RETRACTED: Spatial Functional Planning for Giant Panda Habitat of
   Baoxing County in Sichuan, China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Integrated Ecosystem Management; spatial planning; the Giant Panda
   habitat; World Natural Heritage; Baoxing County
AB Based on the conception and theory of Integrated Ecosystem Management, this paper worked out a set of spatial function planning methods for Giant Panda Habitat in Qionglai Mountains in Sichuan. In this paper, According to the regional ecological sensitivity, the relationship between ecosystem functions and services, Giant Panda Habitat in Baoxing County, one of key areas of Giant Panda Habitat in Qionglai Mountains, was divided into 4 types of main function regions: the optimized development, the major development, the restricted development and the prohibition development, and each of these four types of planning regions could be as some criteria for evaluating effectiveness of management performance of local government. The research show that the spatial function planning of IEM works out a new for harmonious development between human and nature in the Giant Panda habitat. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Municipal solid waste management institutions in China:
   challenges and opportunities (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Municipal solid waste; MSWM institutions; legal framework
AB China has been the largest MSW generator. The central and local government have issued many policies and regulations, achieved noticeable progress but there still remained many incorrect MSW management practices owing to inadequate legislation and lack of control. The onus of managing the MSW lies with the local authorities. In that context, it is necessary to analyze the current situation regarding to MSW institutions in China. The aim of this paper is to summarize the most recent information on legislation, policies, regulations, management system and technical standards related to MSW in China; review the current status and identify the barrier and challenges as well as opportunities related to MSW management, presents several possible and appropriate solutions that might facilitate MSW management institutions in China. The solutions that cooperation with EU on MSW management, especially on its institution, facilitating MSWM in China under the umbrella of circular economy and low-carbon economy and use environmental impact assessment for reference of MSW management may low the pressure caused by large amount of MSW and reduce high disposal cost to an extent. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Terrain Analysis for Landscape Planning and Design Using GIS
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE terrain analysis; landscape planning and design; GIS
AB The objective of the current study is to explore the quantitative characteristics of topography ( elevation, slope, aspect, and view shed) using GIS and hence to guide the best layout for a landscape planning and design project in Changshengqiao, Chongqing. The southern part, with elevation ranging from 400 to 610 m, steep terrain and good vision, is planned to retain their existing plants and build fitness area. The northeastern area, with the most flat terrain, is suitable for recreation service area. The northwestern area, with elevation ranging from 200 to 300 m, undulating terrain and larger areas facing south, can be planned to agricultural production experience area. The southwestern part, with elevation ranging from 200 to 300 m and many orchards, is planned to build seasonal flowers and fruits viewing area. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Preconcentration of Aniline and Catechol with
   Carrier-mediated Hollow Fiber Liquid-phase Microextraction (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Hollow fiber liquid-phase microextiaction; Assistant extraction;
   Aniline; Catechol; Carrier-mediated
ID SINGLE DROP; CAPILLARY-ELECTROPHORESIS; SAMPLE PREPARATION;
   BIOLOGICAL-FLUIDS; SOLVENT; CHROMATOGRAPHY; SPECTROMETRY; EXTRACTION;
   DRUGS
AB In this study, a method named carrier-mediated hollow-fiber liquid-phase microextraction (CM-HF-LPME) was proposed. The simultaneous trace analysis of aniline and catechol in real water were completed using the proposed method prior to gas chromatography. Experimental parameters such as extraction solvent, kinds of carrier, carrier concentration, extraction time and ionic strength of the sample were assessed and optimized. Finally, the enrichment factor (EF), limit of detection (LOD) and precision of the method for aniline and catechol were evaluated. The relative standard deviations (RSDs, n= 5) of 3.5% and 5.8% with good relative recovery of 99.3% and 102.8%, high EF of 32 and 25, LOD of 1.3 and 3.7 mu g/L were achieved respectively. The results demonstrated that the proposed method would be a competitive alternative sample preparation procedure for trace analysis. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Spatio-temporal Variation of Water Deficit (WD) over Songnen
   Plain in the Growing Season from 2000 to 2009 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE remote sensing; MODIS; evapotranspiration; water deficit; Songnen Plain
ID SURFACE-ENERGY BALANCE; HEAT FLUXES; SOIL
AB Water deficit (WD) defined as the difference between evapotranspiration (ET) and precipitation (PE) is usually used as sensitive index to measure the wetness and drought degree of climate and the water supplying condition of agriculture. In this paper, spatial pattern of actual ET in Songnen Plain of 2000-2009 growing season (denoted as gs) (from May to Sep.) was mapped using the MODerate resolution Imaging Spectra radiometer (MODIS) time-series products and meteorological data. Estimated ET was validated using eddy covariance system. It was found that the trend of the calculated and observed ET was highly consistent with the determination coefficient (R2) of up to 0.82. Then, WD was calculated based on estimated ET and observed PE, spatio-temporal patterns of WD were analyzed by using the GIS spatial methods. The results showed that multi-year average WD over the Songnen Plain differentiated from place to place with the value ranging from 26.91 to 692.51mm/gs and an average value of 228.74mm/gs. Regional average WD over the Songnen Plain varied significantly with the maximum value of 358.31mm/gs appearing in 2001 and the minimum value of 89.23mm/gs appearing in 2003. The sequence data of regional average WD displayed obvious decreasing trend with the negative slope of about -16.62mm/gs. At the monthly step, regional average WD varied a lot with the highest value appearing in May or Jun. and lowest monthly WD value appearing in Jul. or Aug. in most cases. Average WD values for different land covers in the total growing season were positive and exhibited decreasing trend in the order of water-body, wetland, woodland, cropland, built-up and grassland. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011. International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zeng, Lihong; Song, Kaishan] Chinese Acad Sci, NE Inst Geog & Agr Ecol, Changchun 130012, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A Novel Channel Estimate Algorithm Based on DFT for OFDM
   System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE OFDM; channel estimation; LS; DFT
AB In this paper, considering the problem of low computing and low precision for the least square (LS) algorithm pilot-based in OFDM system, a novel channel estimation algorithm based on discrete Fourier transform (DFT) by transform domain, the proposed method will force time domain response value to zero beyond the length of cycle, the precision of estimation is improved, and setting threshold for time domain response within the length of the cycle to further reduce the noise on the impact of channel estimation. The proposed algorithm retains the advantages of LS algorithm, improve the accuracy of channel estimation, and simulation results show the effectiveness of algorithm. TI RETRACTED: Research on a Three-System Framework of Carrying Capacity
   Evolution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE carrying capacity; evolution; framework
AB Carrying capacity research is one of the most appealing topics as well as a theoretical frontier in modern ecology. Based on an overall review of the studies of carrying capacity, the paper surveyed the evolution and development process of the carrying capacity concepts and a framework including three systems (natural ecosystem; human ecosystem; socio-economic activity system) are presented. This framework shows clearly the evolution process of the concept of carrying capacity and this work reveals the relations, similarities and differences of all of the carrying capacity concepts. TI RETRACTED: Analysis of Sustainability and Advice on Eco-city of Binhai
   New Area of Tianjin (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE sustainability; three bottom line of sustainability; eco-city; Binhai
   New
AB Tianjin Binhai New Area plays an important role to boost the economy of Tianjin and North China according to the long-term development planning of China. To ensure the sustainability of Binhai New Area in the process of industrialization eco-city construction will be a good choice. The study explores the current state of the sustainability of Binhai New Area by its comparison with Pudong New Area and Suzhou industrial park of China and some other foreign countries according to the three bottom line concept. We conclude that Binhai New Area has a better sustainable performance compared to the national standard. But compared to Pudong New Area and Suzhou industrial park and other countries by most of the indicators Tianjin New Area has a poor sustainable performance. Economic growth, resource consumption, water quality, air quality, waste treatment and disposal, public green space, cleaner production level of the companies and public traffic proportion are some challenges faced by Binhai New Area and we contend eco-city construction will be an effective way to improve the sustainability of Binhai New Area. Thus, we suggest that a good partnership among stakeholders such as government, companies, citizens and universities will help establish, manage and promote the development of eco-cities. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Synthesis and Photocatalytic Property of V2O5/FeVO4 Composite
   Novel Photocatalyst (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Semiconductors; FeVO4; Composite Photocatalyst; Methyl Orange
ID DEGRADATION; BIVO4
AB V2O5/FeVO4 photocatalysts were successfully epared prepared by one-step liquid phase precipitation. The photocatalytic activitied of the V2O5/FeVO4 series catalysts with different V2O5 contents were discussed. The as-prepared samples were character-ized by XRD, SEM and BET. Also the photocatalytic activity was measured by means of photodegradation of methyl orange(MO) in the solution irradiated by visible light. It was found that the 3mol% V2O5/FeVO4 and calcinated at 800 degrees C for 4h had the best ability of photo-degradation of MO, the degradation rate can increase18% or so than that of pure FeVO4 after 12h. Doping V2O5 can act as electron traps promoting the electron-hole separation and then in-crease the photo-activity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Nonlinear Spatial Data Dimensionality Reduction strategy
   based on Local Linear hypothesis for WSN (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wireless sensor network; dimensionality reduction; local linear
   hypothesis; spatial data processing
AB Spatial data mining techniques used to retrieve high-dimensional spatial information from WSN is effectively. It is the extraction of implicit knowledge, spatial relations or other patterns not explicitly stored in spatial database. In this paper, we discuss the efficiency of nonlinear spatial data dimensionality reduction strategy based on local linear hypothesis for saving communication cost in wireless sensor network monitoring data gathering. Moreover, a nonlinear spatial data dimensionality reduction algorithm based on Local Mapping was proposed for rendering effective spatial data retrieval services in the resource constrained WSN. The algorithm can be associated with the present features in spatial data and project high-dimensional data to feature space by using local mapping linear embedding for reducing the computation of spatial data retrieval. As the experiment results shown, the algorithm can preserve important spatial feature information and provide effective preprocessing analysis results. Furthermore, the algorithm is the more effectual on feature preserving than local linear embedding (LLE) when the sample space is sparse source data. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review

DE water ecological carrying capacity; index system;

TI RETRACTED: The Management Framework of Component Test Information
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE component testing; test information; management framework; description;
   classification; evaluation
ID SOFTWARE REUSE
AB Component reuse is a key technology to improve software quality and software productivity. Test reuse is an important part of component reuse. In order to facilitate component testing and reuse, it is necessary to manage component test information systemically. This paper presents a management framework of component test information. At first, the component model is extended for test information management. Then the description and classification of component test information is presented. Based on the fuzzy theory and Analytical Hierarchy Process method, the verification and evaluation method for test information are proposed. Finally, our management framework of component test information is presented. As the effective support of component testing platform, our management framework will be helpful for component developers, reusers and the third party. c 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science

TI RETRACTED: Theoretical Compressive Strength of Pervious Recycled
   Aggregate Concrete (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Recycled aggregate; no fines pervious concrete; finite element analysis;
   theoretical compressive strength
AB Finite element analysis was employed to simulate the compressive strength of no fines pervious recycled concrete. The simulation results indicate that the theoretical compressive strength can achieve 29.111MPa and 12.250MPa when the compressive strength of the attached old mortar was 35MPa and 120MPa, respectively. A type of epoxy with relatively high strength was used as bonding agent of recycled aggregate to verify the simulation results. The error between simulation result and experimental result is less than 0.3% which indicates that the simulation result reliable. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/ or peer- review under responsibility of ICEES 2011. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Practice on improvement of urban thermal environment in
   hot-humid regions-planning and analysis of thermal environment of Keyuan
   area (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Outdoor thermal environment; outdoor natural ventilation; improvement of
   thermo-physical characteristics of underlying surface; ecological
   compensation
AB Scientific and reasonable urban planning and designing plays an important role in the improvement of outdoor thermal environment. Three approaches of outdoor natural ventilation promotion, improvement of thermo-physical characteristics of underlying surface and ecological compensation on the outdoor thermal environment were analyzed, and designing factors involved in the approaches were elucidated in detail. Finally, based on the analysis of thermal environment of Keyuan area of the city of Dongguan, the conclusion was arrived that these three approaches were effective in the improvement of outdoor thermal environment in hot and humid regions.
