TI RETRACTED: Development and Embedding of Vector Meta-graph in Underground
   Pipelines Information System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Digital Topographic Map; Vector Meta-graph; Embedding; OLE
AB Accessing and updating of digital topographic map is an extreme bottleneck in underground pipelines information system(UPIS). According to vast analysis and research, the method of vector meta-graph development and embedding is put forward to solve above problem in this paper. The development of vector meta-graph is implemented by Visual Basic and MapInfo, and embedding of vector meta-graph is implemented by Delphi and MapX. The method is proved accurate and reliable by vast experimental results, and can meet the requirements of UPIS. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design and Implementation of Database Middleware in Network
   Automatic Test System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE NATS; Network Automatic Test System; Database Middleware; Data Access
   Object; Business Operation
AB According to the features of data format in network automatic test system, a database model integrated DBMS and file system is proposed in this paper. Based on the model and java technology, combined with general and common features of bussiness operation, a database middleware of network automatic test system is designed and implemented. The middleware provides users with a single, powerful application interface. And it is able to provide client a common CRUD and data access service, which enhances the scalability and reusability of system, and reduces the burden of system maintenance and upgrade. TI RETRACTED: Improved Purification System for ISO Class 6 Clean Room
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ISO class 6 clean room; electrostatic filter in air supply duct;
   particle concentration; cleanliness recovery characteristic; air change
   rate
AB The traditional purification system for ISO class 6 clean room consists of primary filter, medium efficiency filter and HEPA. By the installation of electrostatic filter in air supply duct, comparing particle concentration, cleanliness recovery characteristic of the clean room and the resistance of the purification systems under the improved system with that of traditional system, the conclusion that when the ventilating rate is between 50 and 80, the improved purification system can not only meet the cleanliness of ISO class 6 clean room, but also improve the cleanliness recovery characteristic is reached. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Chemical Composition of the Volatile Oil from Waterweed and
   their Allelopathic Activity on Microcystis aeruginosa (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE allelopathic activity; GC-MS; volatile oil; Waterweed; Microcystis
   aeruginosa
ID SUBMERGED MACROPHYTES; GROWTH; CYANOBACTERIUM; EPIPHYTES
AB The volatile oil of Waterweed was extracted by petroleum ether and then fractionated with some chemical reagent. The volatile compounds were analyzed by GC-MS. The results of GC-MS analysis indicated that this oil was a complex mixture of 32 identified constituents, which represented about 63.9% of the total oil. The growth inhibition rate of Microcystis aeruginosa by the volatile oil was 27.9%, when the concentration of the volatile oil was 30.0 mg/L. The results provided valuable information for eutrophic waters recovering. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Improved Methane Yield from Sodium Acetate by Adding Co2+
   Chelator into the Anaerobic Mixed Culture (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE anaerobic digestion; methane yield; cobalt; chelators; coenzyme
ID METALS; DIGESTION; BIOAVAILABILITY; PRECIPITATION; AVAILABILITY;
   NUTRIENTS; COBALT
AB The improvement of methane yield from sodium acetate in the presence of Co2+ chelators, serine, lysine, and cysteine respectively, was investigated in this study. The results showed that the addition of chelating agents promoted methane fermentation of acetate. At a sodium acetate concentration of 7 g/L, temperature of 35 degrees C, and Co2+ concentration of 10 mu M, methane production was enhanced 50.1%, 45.6% and 14.7%, by the addition of 1 mu M serine, lysine, and cysteine, respectively. It showed that the best complexant was serine, and its addition of 2 mu M led to the maximum methane production of 295 ml. Accompanying with that, the coenzyme content was increased from 0.347 to 0.526 mu mol/gVSS for F420, from 78.2 to 93.5 mu mol/gVSS for CoM, respectively. The results found that the addition of serine could increase the solubility and availability of essential metal nutrients, and promote the growth of the methanogenic population. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/ or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Enhanced Methane Production in an Anaerobic Continuous
   Stirred Tank Reactor by Adding Nitrilotriacetic Acid to Increase the
   Activity of Methanogenic Bacteria (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE anaerobic digestion; methane yield; cobalt; chelators; coenzyme
ID WASTE-WATER; FERMENTATION; NICKEL; BIOAVAILABILITY; PERFORMANCE;
   BIOREACTOR; COBALT
AB The enhancement of methane production in an anaerobic continuous stirred tank reactor (CSTR) by adding nitrilotriacetic acid (NTA) was investigated in this study. The reactor was operated for 41 days at the condition of a COD concentration of 4000 mg/L, a hydraulic retention time (HRT) of 18 h under (35 +/- 1) degrees C. The results showed that the COD removal efficiency could be maintained at about 60% after 16 days of operation when the feed wastewater had no NTA. While, when 10 mu mol/L NTA was added to the feed wastewater, the methane production of the reactor was increased from 14.3 to 27.4L/d and the COD removal efficiency achieved 80%. Simultaneously, the acetate, propionate and butyrate concentration were decreased to 305, 217, 17mg/L, respectively. The experiment of specific methanogenic activity tests found that the addition of NTA could increase the bioavailability of trace metal elements and the methane yield was enhanced. It can be concluded that the operational strategy of addition NTA was a feasible way to enhance the methane production and it could be applied in industrial wastewater treatment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Jin, Huixia] Zhejiang Univ, Ningbo Inst Technol, Ningbo 315100, Peoples R China.
RP Li, B (reprint author), Zhejiang Univ, Ningbo Inst Technol, Ningbo 315100, Peoples R China.
EM lbjhzzz@163.com
CR APHA, 1995, STAND METH EX WAT WA

TI RETRACTED: Engineering Characterization of Solid Waste Soil (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Municipal solid waste; strength; deformation
AB Based on the development of Environmental Geotechnics, it discussed the properties, composition and classifications of municipal solid waste. Much attention is directed to the strength and deformation characteristics of solid waste. The municipal solid waste at a suburban Landfill in Beijing was investigated in laboratory tests including sieve analyses, triaxial compression tests to investigate the strength properties of municipal solid waste. The tests show that a larger distribution of strength parameters and the shear strength of solid waste is relatively high. The deformation characterization of solid waste is studied. The solid waste is with a small deformation compared with the general soil. The deformation of solid waste generated by loading is affected not only with the state, but also filling time. The deformation curve can be divided into two types: one is "concave" curve for the filling time short, the other one is "on the convex" curve for the filling time longer. The settlement of landfills needs to beconsidered in the design. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Designation of Rapid Detection System for Chlorophyll
   Fluorescence Parameters Based on LED Irradiation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE LED; MINIPAM; fluorescence parameters; light response curve
AB Adopting high-power light- emitting diode (LED) as excitation light source, the study designed a rapid detection system for fluorescence parameters based on MINIPAM. The system uses a microcomputer as the core of the programmable power supply to provide constant current drive of the LED array, and the LED array as a fluorescence excitation light source produces light photochemical system needed. It also uses MINIPAM to detect the fluorescence, analyzing the fluorescence parameters of the mathematical model, studying the plant photosystem. light response curve. The System is of great significance in the evaluation of chlorophyll photosynthesis ability and the plant physiological stress response and the appropriate mechanism. TI RETRACTED: Numerical Simulation of Transonic Flow of Gas Water
   Separation Process (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Natural gas; Transonic; Flow; Process; simulation
AB This paper, through changes in flow channel area, uses convergence-expansion nozzle, improves gas flow rate to sound speed, and then increases diameter to accelerate flow velocity, reaching transonic flow condition. At this point, the decline of temperature makes saturated water in natural gas form droplets, and then generates swirl around deltawing to achieve the purpose of gas-water separation. In the research process, this article uses Fluent 6.1 software to simulate entire flow process, gets all the space flow field variation of pressure, temperature, flow rate and other parameters, accesses to full and accurate details of flow field. The results show that gas through the delta-wing to achieve gas-water separation technology is successful, not only is of great significance for throttle buck, separation dehydration, but also has broad prospects for industrial applications, and lays the foundation for the production and application of this technology. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Study of Overflow Reduction Strategies in Urban Drainage
   System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE overflow; reduce; urban drainage system; rainwater; SWMM
ID QUALITY
AB The overflow reducing strategies of the drainage system in a chosen area is simulated by applying the Storm Water Management Model (SWMM). Considering the high cost of constructing new pipeline network and reservoirs, four easy and cheap measures for reducing the overflow of drainage system, such as the reconstruction of pipe network, the dredging of pipe network, the changing of land surface properties and the re-division of catchments, have been proposed in this paper. The following results are obtained for the case of one year return period. (1) By enlarging the diameter of " bottleneck" pipes and re-dividing the catchments, the performance of the pipe network is improved and the overflow volume of the whole drainage system is reduced by 13.74% and 11.45%, respectively. (2) By increasing permeable area 10% and 20%, the overflow volume of the whole drainage system is reduced by 30.30% and 55.26%, respectively. (3) When dredging 0.1m and 0.2m thickness of sedimentation in pipelines, the total overflow volume of the drainage system is reduced by 27% and 69%, respectively. Numerical results also indicate that the manning roughness coefficient of pipelines has great effects on the performance of the drainage system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Jing; You, Xue-Yi; Ji, Min] Tianjin Univ, Sch Environm Sci & Engn, Tianjin 300072, Peoples R China.

DE Agricultural wastes; activated carbon; pore structure
ID ZINC-CHLORIDE ACTIVATION; SLUDGE
AB Technology of preparing activated carbon from cotton stalk with ZnCl2 assisted by muffle furnace was studied. The optimum technology was obtained through orthogonal test. The sample was observed by SEM and compared with commercial activated carbon. It was found that cotton stalk activated charcoal has enriched and developed cellular pore structure that was the reason why the value of methylene blue adsorption of cotton stalk activated carbon is 3.62 times to commercial activated carbon. TI RETRACTED: Multi-Objective Decision Making in GIS-based Multi-Criteria
   Evaluation for Land Use (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE MCE; OWA; decision-making; conflicting objectives; land use; site safety
ID OPERATORS
AB Multi-objective decision making is common in environmental management, but it is not yet further developed within GIS. A compromise solution to the multi-objective problems under conditions of conflicting objectives with GIS-based Ordered Weighted Averaging (OWA) method is investigated. GIS-based OWA is a relatively new Multi-Criteria Evaluation (MCE) method, in which both criteria weights and order weights are considered. Calculation method of order weights based on Orness, and construction method of comparison matrix for criteria weights based on analytical hierarchy program (AHP), are introduced. Single objective multi-criteria evaluations with GIS-based OWA method for conflicting objectives are worked out. According to the data of influence factors in Tangshan City, criteria are established, images of influence factors are standardized, criteria weights and order weights are calculated. Single-objective suitability maps are obtained, and the multi-objective problem is solved. Finally, the calculating results are analyzed, and some advice is proposed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhu, Qingjie] Changzhou Univ, Sch Petr Engn, Changzhou 213016, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Removal of methylene blue dye from aqueous solutions by using
   modified grain sorghum stalk as a new adsorbent (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE grain sorghum stalk; citic acid; modification; methylene blue;
   adsorption
ID MODIFIED RICE STRAW; ADSORPTION; KINETICS; SORPTION; IONS; PEAT
AB In this study, the agriculture by-product grain sorghum stalk which modified by citic acid(CA) was used as a new adsorbent to remove cationic dye methylene blue(MB) from aqueous solution. The morphology characteristics and superficial charateristics of the adsorbent were observed by scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy XPS, respectively. The effects of the pH of the solution, contact time and initial dye concentration were concerned. The kinetics study showed that the adsorption processes followed the pseudo-second-order kinetic model, confirming that the sorption rate is controlled by chemical adsorption. The equilibrium process had been described by Langmuir and Freundlich isotherm. Langmuir isotherm exhibited the most appropriate to predict the experimental results and the maximum adsorption capacities was 534.76 mg/ g for MB. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Detecting thermal environment change based on remote sensing
   image (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE LULC; LST; deviational ellipse; thermal environment
ID TM IMAGERY; INDEX; CLASSIFICATION
AB Global warming has been paid more and more attention because the global mean surface temperature has been increasing since the late 19th century. From the beginning of 20th century, urbanization has become an important contributor for global warming. Pearl River Delta (PRD) in southern China is one of the regions which are experiencing a rapid urbanization process that has resulted in remarkable Heat Island (HI) effect, which will be sure to affect the regional climate, environment, and society development. In this study, Landsat TM images for 1990 and 2008 in the PRD were selected to retrieve the surface temperatures and land use and land cover types. Object-based classification was proposed to extract 6 land use types from the satellite images. Additionally, surface temperatures were retrieved using the mono-window algorithm. It was found that correlations between land use and temperature are strong, the expansion of built-up area determined the distribution of Heat Island. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of built-up area expansion and rural land loss for a
   fast developing region (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE build-up area expansion; rural land loss; TM/ETM; rapid urbanization;
   Pearl River Delta Estuary
ID CLASSIFICATION; LANDSCAPE; PATTERNS; IMAGERY; CITIES; CHINA
AB Land use and land cove are influenced mainly by human beings in the short history period. Built-up area expansion especially the urban sprawl has been inducing the land surface changed in the whole of the world since last century. Pearl River Delta Estuary in south of china has experienced the rapid economic boom since the implement of Open Door Policy in 1979. Four sets of Landsat image (TM/ETM+) acquired respectively in 1990, 1995, 2000 and 2008 were used to obtain the land use types through the object-based classification method. The build area expanded dramatically with the flow of migration from all parts of China while the rural land degraded obviously. During 1990-2008, the built-up area increased from 605.50 km(2) in 1990 to 2394.25 km(2) in 2008, meanwhile the rural land, including farm land, fishery, forest and shrub, decreased. The built-up area in East Pearl River Estuary (Dongguan and Shenzhen) expanded 1337.12 km(2) from 1990 to 2008 while the expansion in West Pearl River Delta Estuary (Zhongshan and Panyu) was only 548.96 km(2). Influenced by the land use policy, the built-up area expansion in 1995-2000 was only 145.17 km(2) while the expansion in 2000-2008 was 891.07 km(2). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: An analysis of thermal characteristics associated land cover
   using landsat satellite data (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE remote senseing image; LST; heart transfer; land use change; thermal
   zones
ID URBAN HEAT-ISLAND; MITIGATION
AB Direct applications of remote sensing thermal infrared (TIR) data in landscape ecological research are rare due to limitations in the sensors, calibration, and difficulty in interpretation. Currently there are lot of methodologies for examining the relationship between land surface temperatures (LST) derived from TIR data and land use/land cover extracted from remote sensing images. In this study, Landsat TM images of Pearl River Dleta, Guangdong province, acquired in 1990 and 2008, were used to get the 6 land use types of built-up land, arable land, water, fishery, and shrub. Next, pixel-based LST was retrieved for 1990 and 2008 using the thermal band of Landsat TM image. An examination of the relationship between the land use/land cover (LULC) and LST maps was finally conducted to comprehension their interactions. Results indicated that Landsat image was effective for quantifying the heat environment and providing reliable measurements of land use change. LST was found to be positively correlated with impervious surface but negatively correlated with vegetated land. Each temperature zone was associated with a dominant LULC category. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE information integration; design information; ship design integration
   model; credibility design model
AB In the design phase of product, design information integration model is the important model. A novel design information integration model is proposed in the paper. Ship is used as the research object. Then, the model includes normal design data of ship, credibility design data of ship and maintainability design data of ship. Firstly, design information integration model is introduced, among which normal design data of ship, credibility design data of ship and maintainability design data of ship produced by the design information integration model are introduced. Finally, data structure of ship design information integration system is introduced.

TI RETRACTED: Econometric Analysis of Relationships Between the Economic
   Growth and Agricultural Non-point Source Pollution in Shandong Province
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE agricultural non-point source pollution; economic growth; econometric
   analysis; Shandong province
AB The environment deterioration has become a focus of concern with developing of the socio-economic. In this paper, taking Shandong Province as an example, the authors analyze the relationships between the economic growth and agricultural non-point source pollution mainly from the quantitative aspects. The density of agricultural inputs, the density of pollutants in livestock and poultry are selected as a measure of pollutant discharge agricultural non-point source pollution emissions target. The per GDP are selected as an indicator of economic growth. The result shows that the density of inputs is a unilateral Granger cause of economic growth. However, there is no obvious Granger causality between the density of pollutants in livestock and poultry and economic growth. With the development of the economy, we must pay attention to controlling the amount of chemical fertilizer, understanding the input of pesticides the contribution to economic growth. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Exploration and Prospects: the Systemization Process of
   Environmental Impact Assessment in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA); Strategic Environmental
   Assessment (SEA); Systemization Process; Environmental Policy; China
ID CHALLENGES
AB This paper investigates the systemization process of environmental impact assessment (EIA) in China through the review of China's experience in EIA implementation and legislation. The purpose of this study is to analyze the key driving forces of this systemization process and provide advice for future improvement of China's EIA system. It is found that there are three key drivers promoting the systemization of China's EIA: the Government's powerful guidance on the environmental policy implementation; the critical environmental pressure caused by the scale expansion of construction projects and planning activities; and people's consciousness-raising on environmental protection and environmental rights. Based upon the analysis results and China's political, legislative and administrative characteristics, some recommendations are proposed to improve the effectiveness of EIA system in China, in terms of internal measures on refining EIA legislative framework and external mechanisms concerning supporting the efficient operation of EIA legislation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Allelopathic Activities of Exudates from Potamogeton
   pectinatus on the Growth of Scenedesmus obliquus and toxic Microcystis
   aeruginosa at Different Algal Cell Density (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE allelopathic activity; algae density; Potamageton pectinatus;
   Scenedesmus obliquus; Microcystis aeruginosa
ID BLUE-GREEN-ALGAE; MYRIOPHYLLUM SPICATUM; PHYTOPLANKTON; INHIBITION;
   POLYPHENOLS; MACROPHYTE
AB In order to investigating the effect of the green and blue algae and their different algal cell densities on the allelopathic activities of Potamogetion pectinatus, the allelopathic inhibitions of P. pectinatus on planktonic algae Scenedesmus obliquus and Microcystis aeruginosa were studied in this paper. By comparing the intensive changes of allelopathy at different initial concentrations of algae in laboratory exudation experiments, algal intensity threshold values under the allelopathy from this submerged plant were evaluated. It was found that allelopathic effects depended on the initial algal concentration and the algae species. The allelopathic effects of P. pectinatus on S. obliquus at different initial concentrations were not the same though all tests showed algal growth inhibition. The exudates of 2.5 g.L-1 P. pectinatus significantly inhibited the growth of S. obliquus at the all five initial algal cell concentrations after 3 or 6 days incubation. The growth inhibition rates of S. obliquus at the initial concentration of 10(6), 10(7) and 10(8) ind.L-1 were more higher than that of 10(4) and 10(5) ind.L-1 after 3 days incubation, and after 6 days incubation, the growth inhibition rates were all increased except the initial algal cell density of 10(8) ind.L-1. The allelopathic effects of P. pectinatus on M. aeruginosa were a little weaker than that on S. obliquus after 3 days incubation, and the inhibition rates increased after 6 days incubation. The exudates of 2.5 g.L-1 P. pectinatus exerted significant growth inhibition on M. aeruginosa at the initial concentrations of 10(7) and 10(8) ind.L-1, while weaker effects were observed when the algal initial concentrations were below this range. Comparing with the results of S. obliquus and M. aeruginosa, S. obliquus of a wide concentration range could be inhibited by P. pectinatus, while M. aeruginosa was not as sensitive as S. obliquus do. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effectiveness Comparison for the Degradation of Orange II
   between Hydrogen Peroxide Related Reactions (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Orange II; hydrogen peroxide; water treatment; ultraviolet irradiation
ID ADVANCED OXIDATION PROCESSES; WATER; MINERALIZATION; REAGENT
AB In order to further enhance the degradation of the hydrogen peroxide related reactions, a series of reactions were investigated to compare their degradation efficiency. It was proved that hydrogen peroxide alone was not capable of decolorizing the dye significantly. Under 254 nm ultraviolet irradiation, the decolorization efficiency was dramatically increased compared with the oxidation by hydrogen peroxide alone. The dye was also subjected to the degradation by potassium permanganate and subsequent hydrogen peroxide oxidation due to the limited oxidation capacity of potassium permanganate. Acidic and alkaline conditions were proved to be favourable for the dye decolorization, while the lowest decolorization efficiency was always observed at pH 7.0. The combined oxidation by hydrogen peroxide with potassium permanganate and ultraviolet irradiation was proved to be especially effective and has the potential for practical water and wastewater treatment.
C1 [Li, Guoting; Gao, Ruqin] N China Univ Water Conservancy & Elect Power, Dept Environm & Municipal Engn, Zhengzhou 450011, Peoples R China.
RP Li, GT (reprint author), N China Univ Water Conservancy & Elect Power, Dept Environm & Municipal Engn, Zhengzhou 450011, Peoples R China.
EM liguoting@ncwu.edu.cn

   Bandara J, 1999, LANGMUIR, V15, P7670, DOI 10.1021/la9900270

TI RETRACTED: Numerical Modeling in the Environmental Process Simulation
   for Pile Soil Interaction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE modelling; Environmental Process Simulation; pile; soil; interaction
AB Due to the rapid advances in computer technology, numerical modeling and simulation shows powerful tools in the analysis for civil engineering, especially in the field of pile foundation. In order to numerical simulate the pile soil interaction to study the mechanical deformation characteristic of soil and pile, the numerical software FLAC3D is used to simulate the procedure of pile being loaded in the soil. In the simulation, the soil consists of two types, the less consolidated soil and normal consolidated soil. Piles interact with the grid via shear and normal coupling springs. The behavior of the shear coupling springs is identical to the shear behavior of a grouted cable. After calculation, the mechanical characteristic of pile, response of soil are analyzed, the corresponding skin friction stress and axial stress distribution of pile are obtained, both the negative skin friction stress and positive skin friction stress are studied as well as the vertical displacement of soil, whose result can give some guidance for the further study. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design and Implementation of a New Nonlinear Combination
   Forecasting Model Based on RVM and Neural network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE RVM; neural network; combination forecasting model; nonlinear prediction
   model
AB Incompleteness is a distinctive feature of current information data and incomplete information processing has become the study hotspot in Information processing fields. The main task of incomplete information processing is to forecast unknown information based on the available information data. There are many forecasting models used commonly at present and each forecasting model has its advantages and disadvantages. To achieve better prediction results, we proposed a new nonlinear combination forecasting model based on RVM and neural network. In this combination model, RVM model is adopted to classify the initial predictions and the results can be used in the learning process of neural network. The similar predictions are kept and the anomalous predictions are removed. In this way the learning speed of neural network can be improved greatly, and the disadvantages of predictions falling into local minimum can be overcome to some extent. In its organizational structure, we adopt nonlinear parallel organization form, that is to say the two forecasting models work synchronously, the prediction results of each model are passed to another model as control signal. The organization structure enhances the robustness of forecasting model and reduces the probability of abnormal results. Test results show that the proposed method has superior nonlinear forecasting ability, higher precision of prediction and broad application prospects. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wang Feng] N China Univ Water Conservancy & Elect Power, Sch Informat Engn, Zhengzhou 450011, Peoples R China.

DE ant colony algorithm; immune mechanism; water supply network;
   optimization; numerical example analysis
ID DESIGN
AB For ant colony algorithm to search for a long time, easy to occur Stagnant phenomenon and sink into local most superior defects, and puts forward a kind of immune mechanism of the ant colony algorithm, and the algorithm is applied to typical water supply network in the combinatorial optimization problem. Combined with water supply network for example problem using respectively based on immune mechanisms of the ant colony algorithm and genetic algorithm and the basic ant colony algorithm for example to analysis. The results show that the improved algorithm is easier to realize the global optimal solution, and high efficiency, the optimization algorithm is better than other traditional optimization for solving water distribution network ability. So demonstrate the effectiveness of the algorithm. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Experimental Study on Composition and Thermogravimetric
   Analysis of Waste Computer Mainboard (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE waste computer mainboard; chemical component; pyrolysis;
   thermogravimetric analysis
AB Chemical components and phase analysis experiment of waste computer mainboard was carried out with XRF and XRD. It shows that waste computer mainboard contains 20 kinds of metal and nonmetal elements, the content of copper is respectively 24.05% in the form of simple substance mostly; thermogravimetric analysis was carried out at a heating rate of 20 degrees C/min in nitrogen atmosphere, the result shows that the weight lose occurred mainly between 320.73 degrees C to 550 degrees C which possess about 28.05 percent of the total weight, The mass was basically not changed below 320.73 degrees C and approximately accounted for 2.788% when the temperature was between 550 degrees C and 1300 degrees C. The experimental study provided valuable basis for the industrial recovery of waste computer mainboard. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Effect of Gas Flow Rate on Nitrogen Oxides Removal by Barrier
   Discharge (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE nitrogen oxides; plasmas; dielectric barrier discharge; experiments; gas
   flow rate; removal efficiency
ID OXYGEN; NOX
AB Two groups of different gas flow rate experiments were conducted with a benchtop concentric cylinder dielectric barrier discharge reactor to investigate how the change of the gas flow rate affects the effectiveness of dielectric barrier discharge (DBD) treatment flue gas pollutants. Results show that the gas flow rate has little influence on nitrogen oxides removal effectiveness when the input energy density is identical. Thus when dealing with relatively high gas flow rates, the residence time needn't be worried too much, if the equipment could deposit enough energy into the gas. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Empirical Research on Shanghai and Shenzhen 300 Stock Index
   Future's Margin Setting of China Based on Extreme Value Theory
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Margin; Extreme Value Theory; VaR Model; POT Model
AB China's Shanghai and Shenzhen 300 stock index futures returns series distribution shows the character of fat tail and the peak. So at the assumption of normality the risk would be underestimated greatly. Extreme value theory can describes the distribution tail quantile and forecast the emergency accurately. Using POT model of the extreme value theory and the generalized Pareto distribution to estimate the 300 stock index futures margin level, the empirical study shows that the optimal level of margin was 10%., the current Shanghai and Shenzhen 300 stock index futures margin level of China Financial Futures Exchange covers price risk faced by the market. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Method to Determine the Optimal Fixed Offset of
   Ground-Penetrating Radar for Estimating Soil Water Content in Field
   Measurement (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ground Penetrating Radar; ground wave; soil water content; Gurbantunggut
   Desert; mesoscale
AB In order to estimate soil water content by ground-penetrating radar, an experimental was conducted at Fukang Station of Desert Ecology of Chinese Academy of Science located in the southern part of Gurbantunggut desert. Ground Penetrating Radar is used as the main data collection tool. Considering the higher accuracy of wide angle reflection refraction measurement and the faster speed of the fixed offset measurement of ground penetrating radar, a method is presented for the determination of optimal fixed offset based on the obtained average dielectric permittivity of the former. The result showed that: A decreasing trend for the average dielectric permittivity was found with increasing fixed offset of antennas Between 0.36-1.36m along survey line by fixed offset measurement. According to the minimum deviating principle of the average dielectric permittivity, 1.71 m was determined as the optimal fixed offset in the study, the ground wave of this fixed offset was picked and soil water content was calculated, and the average water content of 0.36-1.36 m along survey line is only higher 0.0016 m(3)/m(3) than that of wide angle reflection refraction measurements, the accuracy can meet the actual demand, the average water content of the upper sandy showed spatial heterogeneity between 0-36.5 m along survey line, This method can accurately fast estimate mesoscale soil water content which can provide a scientific basis for agricultural production and crop irrigation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Atmospheric Environment Impact Assessment in Industrial Park
   - A Case study in Pingchang Industrial Park, Sichuan, SW China
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Regional Atmospheric Environment Impact Assessment; Environmental Impact
   Assessment; Environmental Capacity; total mass control of pollutant;
   Pingchang Industrial Park; SW China
AB Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) is critical for sustainable development of the industrial park. As an indispensable part of the system of regional environmental impact assessment (REIA), air quality assessment and regional atmospheric environmental capacity are prerequisite for the planning and development of the industrial park. Based on selecting the factors of atmospheric quality assessment, the evaluation and prediction of regional atmospheric environment quality were conducted in Pingchang Industrial Park, Sichuan, SW China, using Single Factor Evaluation Method and Box-type Air Quality models in this paper. The results showed that regional environmental atmospheric quality in this park met the requirement of Standard Grade II of National Ambient Air Quality Standard (NAAQS). The atmospheric environmental capacity is 301.1 t/a, 1000 t/a for SO2 and TSP respectively, and meet the requirements of total mass control of pollutants and environmental capacity. Accordingly, the comprehensive countermeasures for prevention and control of the air pollution with characteristic of "source control + end treatment + trace monitoring" was proposed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Numerical Model Study on the Ecological Impacts of Coastal
   Reclamation in Bohai Bay (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Bohai Bay; plankton; nutrients; eco-hydrodynamic model; reclamation;
   eutrophication
AB In recent years, Bohai Bay has suffered serious ecological degradations. In this paper, a numerical model was set up to simulate the dynamics of the plankton ecosystem of Bohai Bay and to estimate the potential effects of a sea reclamation project in this area. The model used herein is a coupled eco-hydrodynamic model which is composed of a hydrodynamic sub-model and an ecological sub-model and is capable of simulations of basic biogeochemical cyclings of dissolved nitrogen (DIN), dissolved phosphorus (DIP), phytoplankton (PPT) and zooplankton (ZPT) under advection, dispersion and ecological processes. The model has been calibrated and verified by using field data. The study predicted significant variations in the concentration distributions of phytoplankton and nutrients in areas surrounding the project after the reclamation. Increase in phytoplankton and nutrients levels in the northern and southern areas were observed which might indicate an increase in the risk of eutrophication and algae blooms. The results of the analysis provided important information for the project and eco-environmental management. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study of mesophilic anaerobic digestion of cow manure in
   middle-scale biogas plant (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Anaerobic digestion; biogas; middle scale units; cow manure; optimum
   operating condition
AB Biogas production in anaerobic digestion in middle-scale units will be typically performed under mesophilic conditions in China when used for producing bioenergy and treating agricultural waste such as animal manure. A study has been made on biogas fermentation from cow manure in a 100 m(3) anaerobic digester equipped with a mechanical agitator under controlled temperature (35 +/- 2 degrees C)for this purpose. TS concentration should be controled more than 5%. The biogas generated from the anaerobic digester had the methane concentration as high as 60% (v/v) at TS concentration varied from 5% to 6% after the 10th day. During the start-up period, concentrations of TN, TP and COD decreased gradually, but concentrations of NH4-N and VFA increased. However concentrations of these composition varied narrowly at normal operating time. The pH was stabilized between 7.19 and 7.81 after the 8th day, which suggests that the anaerobic system of cow manure would adjust itself and stabilize pH. The biogas production rate exceeded 110 m(3)/d at optimum operating temperature(35 +/- 2 degrees C). Biogas with 60% CH4 or higher was produced under optimum operating condition. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Numerical Analysis of Natural Convection in a Rectangle
   Cavity With Discrete Heat Source on the Bottom Wall (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Discrete heat source; enclosed rectangle cavity; natural convection;
   numerical study
ID ENCLOSURES
AB A numerical study of a natural convection, which is caused by multiple discrete heat sources in horizontal enclosure, is carried out by a finite volume method. Numerical results are reported for the effect of the separation distance and Rayleigh number on velocity fields, temperature fields and the average Nusselt number, the calculated values of enclosed rectangle cavity cooled from the top wall and lateral walls are also compared. The results show that the change on different distance, Rayleigh number and boundary conditions significantly affects on the natural convection heat transfer in rectangular cavity. TI RETRACTED: Eco-Sensitivity Evaluation in Sa Er'hu Scenic Area Based on
   RS and GIS (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Eco-sensitivity; evaluation; Sa Er'hu scenic area
AB Eco-sensitivity is the premise to protect and utilize the natural resources rationally. Eco-sensitivity analysis was carried out on Sa Er'hu scenic area in Liaoning province by GIS and RS technology. Six factors including slope, aspect, elevation, land use, distance to reservoir and landscape value were chosen. The area was divided into 5 parts: high sensitive, sensitive, relatively sensitive, low sensitive and non sensitive by superposition method. Evaluation results objectively reflect the regional ecological and environmental conditions. Countermeasures were put forward for the zoning of the protection of eco-environment, and to provide support for coot-donating the contradiction between tourism development and resources protection. The study is of significance for the eco-protection, utilization of resources and the sustainable development. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Comparison of Numerical Passive Scalar Diffusion Based on CIP
   Method with Analytical Solution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE CIP method; advection-diffusion equation; analytical solution
ID TRANSPORT; MODEL
AB With the development of the economy and the increase of the population, environmental problems draw more and more attention. The advection-diffusion equation describes the physical transportation of the passive pollutants in the environment, in which the treatment of the advection term is important and difficult. A three-dimensional numerical model based on cubic interpolated pseudo-particle (CIP) method is developed for the solution of the advection-diffusion equation. CIP method is used for the advection terms, which is assumed to be a good method to treat these terms to minimize the numerical diffusion. The comparison of numerical results for advection-diffusion equation based on CIP method with analytical solution for advection-diffusion problems from one-dimension to three-dimension has been performed, which shows the accuracy of the CIP method. A unique method to get the analytical solution for advection-diffusion process in unsteady non-uniform flow is also discussed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang RuiJina] Dalian Ocean Univ, Coll Marine Environm Eng, Dalian, Peoples R China.
RP Zhang, RJ (reprint author), Dalian Ocean Univ, Coll Marine Environm Eng, Dalian, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Design of an Integrated Modeling System for Net Primary
   Productivity Estimation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Terrestiral ecosystem model; NPP; Modeling system; Spatio-temporal
   analysis
ID CLIMATE-CHANGE; TERRESTRIAL
AB Net primary productivity (NPP) estimation is an important study field of global change and terrestrial ecosystem. Here, we present an integrated modeling system for NPP estimation. It's brings together remote sensing, GIS and an ecosystem estimation model without requiring users to have any knowledge of any other specific software. The benefit of the system is that it provides complete spatial coverage and high temporal resolution, versus plot samples from which it may be difficult to provide an overall assessment for large-scale study. Recent advances in service-oriented architectures are allowing us to share of model results by geospatial services and create distributed applications needed for the collaborative research. Multi-layer approaches allow the system more flexible and easy to extend. A preliminary system was carried out for monitoring the dynamic changes of terrestrial ecosystem NPP in China. State-of-the art processing algorithms was developed based on an improved CASA ecosystem model. And then, the NPP time-series of Chinese terrestrial vegetation is built. The System is capable of querying, retrieving, and visualizing datasets with heterogeneous formats. The results show that the average NPP and total NPP for the study area in 2006 were 298.9 gC m(-2) yr(-1) and 2.839 Pg C respectively. The modeled results illustrate a high degree of spatial and temporal heterogeneity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Adding Hydrogen Peroxide to Phytoremediation in
   Urban Sewage River Sediment of Heavy Metal Pollution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE heavy metal contamination; phytoremediation; hydrogen peroxide
   treatment; lead; cadmium
ID CONTAMINATED SOILS; RHIZOSPHERE
AB In order to alleviate pollution of urban sewage river sediment, planting experiment is conducted to study phytoremediation of Lolium Perenne to heavy metal pollution in the circumstance of adding hydrogen peroxide before planting. Results show that after adding hydrogen peroxide before planting Lolium Perenne in sediment the total concentration of lead and cadmium in sediment decline and the ion exchangeable phase of heavy metal increases a lot. The amount of ion exchangeable phase of lead in sediment after adding hydrogen peroxide before planting Lolium Perenne is 46.27 mg/kg which is larger than the one of only planting by 16.58 mg/kg. While the amount of lead of ion-exchangeable phase in original sediment is only 0.001mg/kg. The amounts of carbonate bound, Fe-Mn oxide bound and organic bound also show adding hydrogen peroxide before planting Lolium Perenne can promote accumulation and translocation of heavy metals to plants. Therefore adding hydrogen peroxide in phytoremediation experiment will become an efficient method to solve the problem of contamination of heavy metal in sewage river sediment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li Hong-xia; Zhao Xin-hua] Tianjin Univ, Sch Environm Sci & Engn, Tianjin 300072, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Laboratory research of riverbank filtration for pollutants
   removal in Huai River water (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Huai River; riverbank filtration; RBF; bank filtration;
   surface-groundwater interaction; pollutant removal; ammonia nitrogen;
   organic pollutants
ID FIELD
AB Laboratory continuous flow-through riverbank filtration (RBF) models were developed to study the organic substances and ammonia nitrogen removal efficiency in the riverbank filtration process. The results indicated that the priority pollutants, organic substances and ammonia nitrogen, could be removed to a great extent. The results also indicate that the quality of the Huai River water is acceptable to operate the abstraction system with the riverbank filtration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on AgentX-based Scalable Network Management System
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE AgentX; SNMP; network management; aviation data communication
AB The introduction of scalable SNMP agent AgentX into the field of network management expands the control capability of SNMP-based network management system on network devices, important components and applications. The paper designed a kind of applicable network management system based on SNMP protocol and its extended protocol AgentX. The system implemented real-time monitoring and distance configuration of functional running circumstance of aviation data communication gateway server, which provides a practical application mode for network devices management in complicated network environment. TI RETRACTED: Gansu Cities' Livability Evaluation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Gansu city; livability evaluatio; countermeasure; principal component
   analysis
AB In this paper, 16 economic, social and environmental indicators were used to evaluate the urban livability in Gansu. The principal component analysis revealed six principal components with eigenvalues more than 1, the most important of which represents economic development, and others represent environmental quality, geographical location, living standards, medical facilities, and urban traffic condition. The comprehensive scores of six principal components exhibited that the level of livability of the cities in Gansu is totally low, and the differences in livability between these cities are significant. The livability of cities in different regions are significant as well, with cities in Hexi corridor being more livable than those in eastern parts and northern cities being more livable than those in southern parts. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Changes of NDVI and Their Relations with Principal
   ClimaticFactors in the Yarlung Zangbo River Basin (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE NDVI; precipitation; average air temperature; vegetation cover; Yarlung
   Zangbo River basin
ID VEGETATION
AB As an index denoting vegetation cover, NDVI is influenced by many climatic factors such as precipitation and average temperature. In this paper, NDVI is calculated on the basis of waveband characteristic of NOAA/AVHRR data for the YarlungZangbo River Basin. Then, the spatial-temporal change of NDVI is analyzed. The basin's NDVI is in consistency with season from 2001 to 2003. Large value zone of NDVI is mainly distributed in the lower reaches and part of the middle reaches. Meanwhile, point-data of principal climatic factors are interpolated to spatial grid data with Kriging method consistent with NDVI based on DEM of the YarlungZangbo River Basin. Then, the relation of NDVI and precipitation or average air temperature is analyzed with F checking and two-sample variance test in the basin. The result is P=0, which shows that correlation analysis has larger confidence. The linear and logarithmic correlation of NDVI and precipitation or average air temperature is analyzed at confidence level of 0.05. The conclusion is that NDVI and precipitation and average air temperature in the basin vary with seasons and are closely correlated. The linear correlation coefficient of NDVI and precipitation is 0.8, and that of NDVI and average air temperature is about 0.77. And the logarithmic correlation coefficient of NDVI and precipitation is 0.71, and that of NDVI and average air temperature is 0.7. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Wei] Hebei Univ Technol, Sch Energy & Environm, Tianjin 300401, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: CBR Oil Spill Contingency Plan Inference System (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE case-based reseaning; plan; oil spill emergency; interfence system
AB The oil spill emergency plan is the base information for the emergency decision-making, and could act as an assistant for the decision maker in the oil spill emergency decision-making. However at present, the role of the oil spill emergency plan supporting the oil spill emergency decision is fulfilled by the decision maker through reading the prepared text plan, thus in an urgent situation, the effect of the oil spill emergency prepared plan for the emergency decision support is limited. In order to solve the problem, this paper studies oil spill contingency plans and oil spill emergency response decision-making in-depth, and Case-based Reasoning (CBR) theory is first used to design plans for oil spill emergency response decisions based on computer reasoning system, so as to provide quick solutions to improve the capabilities of emergency decision support for oil spill contingency plans. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Mechanism of Component Modification to the Application
   Environment (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE component modification; new application environment; modification modes;
   component interface; component implementation
ID SOFTWARE; REUSE
AB At present, there are few components that can be reused directly to construct a new software system. In order to meet the requirement of the application environment, component need be modified before its reuse. For the different kinds of users, component modification can be occurred in the interface and the implementation. This paper presents a mechanism of component modification to the application environment. At first, the component description specification for modification is defined. Then for the interface modification and the implementation modification, the corresponding modification modes based on specification are proposed. Finally, modification method and related support process are presented. With the help of the proposed modification mechanism of component, the users can modify component regularly and effectively. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE pollution of heavy metals; physiological and ecological function; red
   soil
ID PADDY SOILS; AMENDMENTS; CADMIUM; BIOAVAILABILITY; ACCUMULATION; MUD; L.
AB Pot experiment on red soil (garden soil) contaminated by heavy metal was conducted in Guixi, Jiangxi, China. The five treatments included the control (CK), application of lime at 1.20 (LimeLow) and 2.4 g.kg-1 (LimeHigh), organic fertilizer (hollow swine feces) at 6.0 g kg-1 (OMlow) and 12.0g.kg-1(OMHigh) were conducted. The results indicate that using lime to tune soil pH to light alkalescence could improve net photosynthesis significantly, increase soil microbe C (especially for cellulose-decomposing bacterium), reduce the available content of heavy metal for the growth of plants, and serves as a viable treatment of soil under the condition in existence. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE multimodal web user interface; MDA; PIM; UsiXML
AB To construct PIM(platform independent model) of multimodal web user interfaces, a method for PIM semi-auto generation based on the model-driven opinion is proposed by defining a clear architecture of structuring PIM. It includes automatic deriving abstract user interface model from domain model and task model and interactive editing abstract dialog model. The approach outlined in the paper is illustrated throughout a virtual option polling system. It promotes the development of multimodal Web user interfaces based on MDA. TI RETRACTED: Regional Eco-Environmental Information Service System Based
   on Open Source Projects (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE arid area; eco-environmental; WebGIS; open source; GeoServer
AB In arid area of western China, due to harsh natural conditions, ecosystems are less stable and easily affected by human activities. In recent decades, significant amount of research on the impact of human activity on environmental change in arid areas have been done. Though no particular conclusions were drawn, a number of eco-environmental data were accumulated. For lack of effective means of sharing, these data exit in form of "Information Island". To use the data more efficiently, a WebGIS prototype for regional eco-environment service system is constructed using open source software such as PostgreSQL, PostGIS, GeoServer, OpenLayers and etc. Implementation techniques, system function and key procedures were also described. This system, of high practical value, will be able to provide the public, scientists, and administration with convenient and rapid access to eco-environmental information. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Application of TOPSIS Model Based on AHP Weight to Beiyun
   River Ecosystem Health Assessment (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE river ecosystem health; TOPSIS model; evaluation indexes system; AHP
AB River ecosystem health assessment is one of the hotspots in the current river ecology research. A health river must be a river with equilibrium of natural function and social function. The evaluation indexes system and criteria for river ecosystem health are established based on the scientific, practical and concise principles. In order to evaluate river ecosystem health scientifically, TOPSIS model is applied to evaluate river ecosystem health. In this model, AHP theory is applied to determine the evaluated index weight. Then the evaluation model is applied to Beiyun River health assessment. The result shows that it is in the "unhealthy" level which is coherent to the actual condition. It also validates the evaluation model is simple and feasible in river ecosystem health assessment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Field Study Using Iodine Tracer to Characterize Chemical
   Contaminants Penetrated into Groundwater from Vadose Zone (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Preferential soil water flow; Vadose zone; Cluster analysis; Iodine
   tracer; contaminants
ID PREFERENTIAL FLOW; BRILLIANT BLUE; CLAY SOIL; TRANSPORT; IRRIGATION;
   ADSORPTION; DYE
AB The objective of this study was to investigate chemical contaminants penetrated into groundwater form the vadose zone. Infiltration experiment was performed in the field and an iodine-starch staining method was applied to visualize flow paths in the soils. The cluster analysis method was used to distinguish preferential flow regions. Base on the difference of water content before and after infiltration and the volume of the stained region, the recovered water content was calculated. Results showed that stained patterns played a much important role in redistribution of infiltration water than the soil saturation change in the stained region. The chemical contaminants concentration decreased dramatically in the upper depth and then the decreasing trend was slowed down. The chemical contaminants transport is more complex than water flow. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: GIS-based Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation on Underground Gas
   Pipeline Risk (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE GIS; underground gas pipeline; fuzzy comprehensive evaluation
AB The evaluation of the risk of underground gas pipeline can provide effective decision support aid. It is crucial to the establishment of a comprehensive safety evaluation and management system for the urban underground gas pipeline. This paper presents a method of GIS-based fuzzy comprehensive evaluation on underground gas pipeline risk and elaborates the flow of fuzzy risk evaluation in detail. Meanwhile, a fuzzy comprehensive evaluation model is built herein by analyzing the pipeline risk factor weight by means of analytic hierarchy process according to the fuzzy evaluation matrix for relative single-factor membership. Finally, a fuzzy comprehensive evaluation with test data is made on the failure to research the regional gas pipeline issue, the relative risk value of the pipelines in the area is calculated and visualization is made in 3DGIS scene. TI RETRACTED: The Evaluation and Process of the Lateral Marketing
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE lateral marketing; evaluation; process
AB With the marketing theory developing, the new marketing concept of Lateral marketing emerged. Lateral marketing involves bringing an unrelated idea to the exiting offering and seeing if the combination manages to create a new category, it is to create a new category or market with the possibility of the process. Based on the modern marketing theory, modern competitive theory and production innovation theory, this paper offered a basic mode of lateral marketing and a new idea and method for the study on marketing of Chinese enterprises. The paper carried on key research to assess the value and the process of lateral, and analyzed the significance of the Lateral marketing theory. It summed up the methods on the lateral marketing theory. The paper discusses the value and significance of the lateral marketing, and discussed the process of the implementation in the lateral marketing. Based on the case, it analyzed the case in term of studying in lateral marketing, and got the general methods on practice which fit on Chinese enterprises. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: A simplified model of activated sludge model (ASM) in
   industrial wastewater (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE development activated sludge model; industrial wastewater; ASM1 model
AB Activated sludge model (ASM) is applied into represent complex biochemical reaction between various contaminants in wastewater and microbial wastewater treatment system. Based on activated sludge ASM 1 model in this paper, the aerobic process COD is separated into dissolved easily biodegradable organics, soluble inert organics, particulate non-biodegradable organics, particulate slow-biodegradable organics and particulate inert matter produced by heterotrophic biological decay. With a volume constant and completely mixed batch reactor, the process of simplified ASM 1 model was described. The simplified model improves the speed because of the less parameter with a similar simulation result used by ASM 1 model. But it is very necessary to adjust the model parameter in different industrial wastewater treatment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Pan, Yi; Yang, Shuangchun] Liaoning Shihua Univ, 1 W Dandong Rd, Fushun 113001, Liaoning, Peoples R China.
