TI RETRACTED: STATUS OF WASTE TREATMENT METHODS IN HEAVY OIL COLD
   PRODUCTION (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE oil sand; waste treatment; development status
ID SLUDGE-CONTAMINATED SOIL; BIOREMEDIATION; PYROLYSIS; FIELD
AB Cold heavy oil production with sand (CHOPS) is a non-thermal method used in primary recovery. It improves heavy oil recovery rates by aggressively producing sand to form regions of increased permeability-wormholes and generating foamy oil flow. The oily solid waste is one of the main wastes in this oil field production process, which also stands as a critical negative factor that impedes the improvement of oilfield environment. The oil sand, which is rich in oil and black viscous compound in appearance, is the solid waste that comes along with the oilfield production. It mainly comprises of crude oil, slurry and a little water. The composition of the sludge mixture changes with the accumulation time in the field.
   The oil sand mixture has huge amounts in magnitude, and it contains a certain amount of BTEX, phenol compounds and other organisms that affect the human body and surrounding animals and plants. Hence it is necessary to operate appropriate disposal and achieve a lower negative effect to the environment. The disposal of the waste occupies a great portion of all CHOPS application costs. Therefore, the promotion for a more economic and effective treatment method has been another issue for improvement of the CHOPS technology.(a)
   The current prevailing method for waste treatments is non-toxicity handling and resource utilization, including the extraction separation technique, water-washing method, demulsification method, carbonization, incineration, and biological treatment. Based on the methods mentioned above, we present an overview and comparison in the strengths and shortcomings for each. An analysis for the factors that affect the industrialized treatment for oily solid mixtures is also provided. This paper ends with propound advices on application of these technologies. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on low carbon-to-nitrogen municipal wastewater using
   Pre-denitrification Biological Filter (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE enhancing denitrification; low carbon-to-nitrogen; municipal wastewater;
   pre-denitrification biological filter
AB By the reflux to different sites, that is all reflux to denitrification stage (DN) or shunting circuit into settling bucket and DN at a certain proportions, the performance of pre-denitrification biological aerated filter in a pilot-scale was assessed, especially enhancing denitrificaion methods for low carbon-to-nitrogen domestic sewage. The results showed that in the condition of all reflux to DN, at the reflux ratio ranges from 100,130 to 150%, the average removal efficiency of TCOD enhanced with the value 58.5, 62.3 and 65.8% and that of NH4-N was 84.5, 87.5 and 94.7%, whereas the average removal efficiency of TN presented 37.1, 40.9 and 39.7%. In the test, the removal increase of total nitrogen had no unanimous increase with the reflux ratio increase. The TN average removal achieved 56.4% and 60.5% when the quantities of reflux were shunted circuit to settling bucket and DN by 1: 1 and 2: 1 at 130% of the return flow. Therefore, most of reflux passing by settling bucket for oxygen consumption was the better proposal of improving TN removal efficiency for low C/N wastewater. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: CellLib: A Multilayer Runtime Support Library for the CBEA
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE multilayer runtime library; heterogeneous multi-core system; CBEA
AB In this paper, a co-processor centric multilayer runtime library (CellLib) was proposed by extending memory access library and enhancing the co-processor's independency. The library supports both MPI and release-consistency-based Pthread programming model. The structure of multilayer runtime library and the flexibly extended memory access library not only make the model more efficient and scalable but also enhance the performance of irregular applications. In the model, while MPI programming interface enables large exiting MPI applications to be ported to the CBEA easily and facilitates the traditional parallel programming, the release-consistency-based Pthread programming interface offers an efficient task runtime library to both MPI and the system-level users who need full control over the architecture. The experimental results show that the proposed multilayer runtime library is suitable for various applications and can achieve better performance by using a profile based on optimizing technology built in memory access library. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   support vector regression (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE support vector regression; prediction technology; stock market;
   efficient management; neural network
ID BP NEURAL-NETWORK
AB Accurate prediction of stock market is very important to obtain high profits from stock market. As the operational parameters of support vector regression are usually determined by user, which leads to bad prediction results. In the paper, genetic algorithm and support vector regression (GA-SVR) model is developed to predict stock market, and genetic algorithm selects the best parameters of support vector regression. The comparison of the prediction error between GA-SVR and BP neural network to show the excellence of GA-SVR compared with BP neural network in the experimental analysis. It can be seen from the comparison results of the prediction error between GA-SVR and BP neural network that GA-SVR can gain the lower prediction error than BP neural network in the stock market prediction. TI RETRACTED: Emotion Recognition from EEG Based on Bayesian Networks
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Bayesian Networks; emotion recognition; EEG; power spectrum; ROC
ID STATE
AB In this paper, we propose a recognition model of multi-emotion states from electroencephalogram (EEG) based on Bayesian Networks. The subjects' emotion states (anger, happiness, and neutral) are elicited by using emotional videos along with collecting EEG signals from fourteen channels around the scalp. We use Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) to select input features of this model from power spectrum values of fifty six frequency bands of fourteen-channel EEG signals with each being divided into four bands. Experimental results show that the proposed model performs well and using EEG to detect multi-emotion states is feasible. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Modeling Driver Lane Changing Based on the QN-MHP Cognitive
   Architecture (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE cognitive architecture; driver model; driver lane changing control;
   QN-MHP
AB Computational models of driving behavior developed based on a cognitive architecture can provide better scientific understanding of driving, simulate driving behavior, quantitatively predict possible interference of in-vehicle tasks, and thus help develop human factors guidelines and tools for in-vehicle systems design. Driver lane changing is a common activity in driving. Therefore, modeling driver lane changing with a cognitive architecture should be an important component of cognitive models of driving behavior. In this paper, we develop a computational model of driver lane changing control with the Queuing Network-Model Human Processor (QN-MHP) cognitive architecture based on neuroscience and psychological findings. The simulation and experimental results from lane changing on straight and curved roads suggest that this model can perform the control process of lane changing well and the model's control process is consistent with that of drivers. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: An adaptive reservation multiple access protocol for wireless
   multimedia networks (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wireless network; multiple access; quality-of-service (QoS); reservation
ID ATM
AB An efficient adaptive reservation multiple access protocol with traffic-predicting and retransmission scheduling (ARMA-TR) is presented for wireless multimedia networks. In the protocol, access slots are divided into voice and video mini-slots (VMs) only for active voice and video terminal (VTs) to transmit their reservation requests, and sharing mini-slots (SMs) shared by VTs and data terminals for resource reservation. Based on traffic-predicting approach, the amounts of VMs, SMs and information slots can be adaptively adjusted to efficiently match current voice and data traffic load. Retransmission-scheduling mechanism endows constant bit rate (CBR) traffic more priority than variable bit rate (VBR) traffic and gives VTs with CBR traffic from silent phase to talkspurt phase more chance to access channel resource than the terminals with VBR traffic and newly-generated CBR traffic. Simulation results show that the proposed protocol can efficiently and dynamically allocate the available bandwidth to communication sessions according to the requirements of quality-of-service (QoS) and current traffic load. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Bolivar, Jose; Liu, Kai] Beihang Univ, Sch Elect & Informat Engn, Beijing 100191, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Hybrid Feature Selection Mechanism based High Dimensional
   Datesets Reduction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Hybrid feature selection; Shepley value; Relief algorithm
ID GENE-EXPRESSION; CLASSIFICATION; PREDICTION; CANCER; TUMOR
AB Dimension reduction is a critical issue in the analysis of high dimensional datasets, because the high dimensionality of data set hurts generalization performance of classifiers. It consists of two types of methods, i.e. feature selection and feature extraction. Here we present a hybrid feature selection mechanism (HFS) which combines both filter and wrapper models for dimension reduction. In the first stage, we use the filter model to rank the features by the Relief algorithm between each feature and each class, and then choose the highest relevant features to the classes with the help of the threshold. In the second stage, we use Shepley value to evaluate the contribution of features to the classification task in the ranked feature subset. Experimental results show obviously that the HFS method can obtains better classification performance than solo Shepley value based or solo Relief algorithm based method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Relief Wrapper based Semi-feature Selection (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE semi-supervised learning; genetic algorithm; semi-feature selection
ID ALGORITHMS
AB Semi-supervised learning require new feature selection methods to work on unlabeled examples. Informed researches deal it with "filter" feature selection methods which may not work well for classification tasks. Genetic algorithm is one of widely used supervised feature selection methods. In this paper, we introduce a "wrapper-type" genetic algorithm based semi-feature selection method. In essence, it uses unlabeled examples to extend the initial labeled training set with the help of classifiers. Extensive experiments on publicly available datasets show that our proposed method, generally, outperforms both traditional supervised and state of-the-art "filter-type" semi-supervised feature selection algorithms by 1% to 7% in accuracy. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Labile Organic Carbon Pool of Forest Soil in the Badaling
   Mountainous Area of Beijing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Light fraction organic carbon; Dissolved organic carbon; Forest soil
ID VERTICAL-DISTRIBUTION
AB This study aimed to explore the effects of coniferous forest and broadleaf forest on soil labile organic carbon in the Badaling mountainous area of Beijing. The results showed that in the different types of vegetation, total soil organic carbon (SOC), light fraction organic carbon (LFOC) and dissolved organic carbon (DOC) varied by decreasing trend with increasing soil depth. The contents of LFOC and DOC in coniferous forest were significantly lower than those of broadleaf forest at soil depth of 0-10cm and 10-20cm. The ratio of LFOC content to the total SOC content ranged from 14.08% to 4.63%, while ratio of DOC content to the total SOC content ranged from 1.26% to 3.15%. The ratio of LFOC content to the total SOC content decreased with increasing soil depth, whereas the other ratios changed by opposite trend. A significant relationship was found between the LFOC and DOC; both of LFOC and DOC were significantly correlated with total SOC. Broadleaf forest is helpful to accumulate SOC. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Dual wavelet frame; Wavelet tight frames; Refinable functions;
   Asymptotic property
AB Wavelet tight frames have attracted more and more attention. In this paper, we show that there exist wavelet frames generated by two functions which have good dual wavelet frames, but for which the standard dual wavelet frame does not consist of wavelets. That is to say, the standard dual wavelet frame cannot be generated by the translations and dilations of a single function. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Numerical Simulation of Flow Field in Gas/Liquid Separators
   with Supersonic Wings (retracted article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE gas/liquid separator; natural gas flow; supersonic wing; numerical
   simulation
ID COMPUTATIONAL FLUID-DYNAMICS; NATURAL-GAS; NOZZLES; DEHYDRATION
AB The gas/liquid separator with a supersonic wing is a new apparatus which can be used to condense and separate water and heavy hydrocarbons from natural gas. It enables chemical-free operation to reduce the pollution of the environment. A new supersonic separator with a supersonic delta wing is designed for gas/liquid separation. The natural gas flow field in supersonic gas/liquid separators is numerical calculated with the RNG k- epsilon turbulence model. The numerical results show that water and heavy hydrocarbons can be condensed and separated from natural gas under the combined effects of the low temperature (-86 degrees C) and strong centrifugal field (600000 g. g is the acceleration of gravity). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE architectural structure; damage identification; support vector
   regression; least squares

TI RETRACTED: Controlling Vertex-Biconnectivity of UAVs Ad Hoc Network
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE UAVs ad hoc network; vertex-biconnectivity; connectivity controlling
ID CONNECTIVITY; MOVEMENT
AB Fault tolerance is a desirable property in UAVs Ad Hoc network, and biconnectivity is a baseline feature of fault tolerance. In this paper, a distributed movement strategy for achieving vertex-biconnectivity is developed. A team of UAVs form a defined chain-formation from base station to the explore UAV. The relay UAV adjusts its position according local information about the network topology that is at most two-hops away from itself. Experiment results show that the strategy can work well in static and dynamic scenarios, the communication topology graph of UAVs network obtain vertex-biconnectivity property asymptotically. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Chen Ling; Liang Jia-hong; Hu Zhi-wei] Natl Univ Def Technol, Sch Mechatron Engn & Automat, Changsha 410073, Hunan, Peoples R China.
RP Chen, L (reprint author), Natl Univ Def Technol, Sch Mechatron Engn & Automat, Changsha 410073, Hunan, Peoples R China.

DE gear enterprise; information integrated platform; integrated operation
   mode; networked manufacturing; Service-oriented Architecture; Web
   services
ID FRAMEWORK
AB To deal with the problems of information integration and data sharing among directed heterogeneous application systems in gear enterprises, a functional architecture of information integrated platform is proposed after detailedly analyzing the information integrated operation mode of gear enterprise networked manufacturing. The application integrated framework of gear enterprise is constructed with the technology of Service-oriented Architecture (SOA) and Web services, and the software architecture of application integrated framework is implemented in the. NET environment. Finally, example of actual hypoid gear networked manufacturing is introduced to demonstrate the practicability of the proposed platform. TI RETRACTED: Application Research On the Mobile Agent Security (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Secure mobile agent; strong non-designated proxy signature; multi-proxy
   agent
AB It is expected that mobile agent will be widely used for electronic commerce as an important key technology. If a mobile agent can sign a message in a remote server on behalf of a customer without exposing his/her private key, it can be used not only to search for special products or services, but also to make a contract with a remote server. To construct mobile agents, we used an RSA-based undetectable signature scheme, but it does not provide server's non-repudiation because the undetectable signature does not contain server's signature. Mobile agent is a very good application example of proxy signature, and the undetectable signature can be considered as an example of proxy signature. In this paper we show that secure mobile agent can be constructed using strong non-designated proxy signature which represents both the original signer's (customer) and the proxy signer's (remote server) signatures. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Effect of Oxyteracycline and Lead on the Enzyme Activity
   of Soil (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Oxytetracycline; Heavy metal; Enzyme activity; Combined pollution s
ID TETRACYCLINE RESIDUES; RESISTANCE; BACTERIA; MANURE
AB Effect of single and combined pollution of oxytetracycline (OTC) and Pb on enzyme activity was researched by using incubation experiments. The results showed catalase activity was inhibited in single and binary system at all incubation time except 100 mg (OTC+Pb)/kg treated soil at seventy-fifth day. Catalase activity of binary system was not significantly different from single pollution from fiftieth to seventy-fifth day. Urease activity was inhibited in single system (except Pb polluted soil at the first day) and binary system ((50 mg OTC + 100 mg Pb)/kg treated soil) from 1d to 15d, but the changes of urease activity was complicated at the later stage. It is difficult to assess the pollution level by enzyme activity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of Personal Handwriting Based on Method of
   Functional Data (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE functional data; handwriting; model; estimate
AB In this paper we choose "iccae", which is the initial of "2011 International Conference on Computer and Automation Engineering" as our sample, use what we call a dynamic model for handwriting. We demonstrate how the model can be fitted to the writing of a particular individual using repeated samples of their printing. We also investigate how well the model separates one person from another. At last, we pick out that a differential equation is a useful means of modeling this time-varying behavior. The paper gives some suggestion of computer's simulating persons' handwriting. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. DE Cockroach swarm optimization; Particle swarm optimization; Chaotic
   particle swarm optimization
AB In order to apply cockroach swarm optimization (CSO) algorithm to more function optimization and improve its accuracy, this paper improve CSO by modifying chase-swarming behavior of cockroach, and apply the modified CSO to optimize several Benchmark Problems. The results of simulation experiments illustrate that modified CSO has stronger convergence performance and highly-accuracy optimization results compared with Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) and Chaotic Particle Swarm Optimization (CPSO). TI RETRACTED: Design of a kind of broadband orthogonal mode converter
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Orthogonal-mode converter; waveguide E-T connectors; impedance matching
AB Orthogonal mode converter is the main electrical components of the dual-polarized antenna feed system. This paper designed a kind of waveguide orthogonal mode converter, which is used for tightening field test antenna. With a four-steps E-T structure, the converter achieves power equal portions and 180 degrees phase shift in the working frequency. The simulation results show that in the working frequency range, it achieves input VSWR of less than 1.1, the amplitude unbalance of less than 0.05dB and the phase unbalance of 180 degrees +/- 1 degrees. This device is used in the balance feeding system of dual-polarized antenna, can perform well. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Float Characteristic and its Control of the
   Microcystis (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Microcystis aeruginosa; Vertical distribution; Floating up velocity;
   Down flow; Air mixing
ID RESERVOIR; LAKE
AB Algae can cause much nuisance in lakes and reservoires due to bloomtorming and production of toxins and off-flavours. There are air sacs in the body of Microcystis aeruginosa to float Microcystis aeruginosa up to the upper layer water in order to obtain plenteous light for its growth and reproduction. The amount of Microcystis aeruginosa in the depth of 3 times water transparency is more than that in upside and under-side. The floating up velocity of Microcystis aeruginosa was measured under still water, the floating up velocity of 77% Microcystis aeruginosa is not more than 1cm/min, and there are 10% Microcystis aeruginosa whose floating up velocity is between 1 similar to 1.5cm/min, 6% between 1.5 similar to 2cm/min, and 7% more than 2cm/min. When the water flow gone downwards with the velocity of 1.65cm/min, Microcystis aeruginosa's floating up will be prevented. An air mixing system has been applied in a water source of Tianjin Jieyuan water plant to control the algae growth. It was found that the content of phytoplankton chlorophyll-a was reduced by 13.96% (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A survey of localization schemes in wireless sensor networks
   with mobile beacon (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wireless sensor network; localization; mobile beacon; path planning
AB Location information is critical essential and indispensable for many applications of wireless sensor networks. Beacon-based localization schemes are more precise than beacon-free ones, but the beacon nodes are more expensive than ordinary sensor nodes. Recently, there has been much focus on mobile-beacon based localization, for they can lower the cost while keeping the localization precision. This paper surveys the current state of the art for mobile-beacon based localization algorithms. We give the taxonomy of these schemes including range-base vs. range-free, single beacon vs. multi-beacons, omni-directional vs. directional antenna. Moreover, we also give a review of path planning methods which are critical to localization algorithm with mobile beacon, and we classify them into static and real-time schemes. We briefly introduce the steps of each localization and path planning algorithm, which serves as an introduction and survey for researchers interested in the area of localization of wireless sensor networks. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Cui Huan-qing] Shandong Univ Sci & Technol, Coll Informat Sci & Engn, Qingdao 266510, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Satellite's orbital dynamic and stable regions near
   equilibrium points of asteroid (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE asteroid; equilibrium point; orbital resonance; stable region
AB In order to study the satellite's moving features and the size of stable reigns around the center equilibrium points of asteroid, 1:1 resonant orbits theory are applied in this paper. First the Hamilton function described by Delaunay variable is simplified to Schubart standard. Secondly the simplified mathematical model is used to discuss the form of orbital motion, vibration period of satellites which locate orbit the asteroid's equilibrium points and the relationship between each other. And then Asteroid Vesta is taken as a simulation example to verify the correctness of these conclusions above. Finally, exploiting the properties of energy integral of Schubart standard, the formula of deducing the radius of stable region around the center points is given, which is also applied to analyze the properties of orbital motions both inside and outside of the stable region. The research in this article not only can help us better understand the equilibrium points of asteroids and the dynamical environments in the vicinity of which but also can it supply theoretical basis in designing the orbit around the equilibrium points around the asteroid. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Real-time Recognition System for Circular Signal Based On
   Hough Transform And Parallel Computing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE hough transform; circle recognition; parallel compute; realtime
   detection
ID ALGORITHM
AB Ship traffic lights is a constantly changing light and dark circular spot. To quickly and error-free receive the signal light in an complex environment the recognition system needs to identify intensity and shape of the light signal. Hough transform is a description for the boundary and shape of area and commonly be used to extract curve from a complex background. But its two disadvantages, massive storage requirement and high cost of computation, limited its application in real-time recognition system. This paper presents an integrated optimization algorithm which is focus on reducing the sampling points, reducing dimensions and utilize parallel computing methods. The system can recognize circular signal in real-time from a series of continuous images(size: 800x600 pixels) and make close to 100% accuracy. At the same time as the characteristics of parallel computing, the computing power of the system is easy to expand. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Cui Zhi; Li Yongjian] Yancheng Inst Technol, Dept Mech Engn, Yancheng 224051, Peoples R China.
RP Cui, Z (reprint author), Yancheng Inst Technol, Dept Mech Engn, Yancheng 224051, Peoples R China.
EM cuizhi@ycit.cn

TI RETRACTED: An Exploratory Study on Dilute-Acid Hydrolysis of Water
   Hyacinth to Furfural (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Dilute-acid hydrolysis; Furfural; Water hyacinth; Response surface
   methodology; Box-Behnken design
ID EICHHORNIA-CRASSIPES; ETHANOL; BIOCONVERSION; OPTIMIZATION; PLANT
AB Water hyacinth is becoming an environmental problem in lakes, ponds and waterways in many parts of the world. In this study, its application as raw material for furfural production was investigated. Response surface methodology (RSM) was employed to study the proper process parameters to determine the optimal furfural yield from water hyacinth. Experiments were carried out as per Box-Behnken surface statistical design with four input parameters namely temperature (T : 160-220 degrees C), sulphric acid concentration (C-H2SO4: 0.1-0.9 mol/L), liquid/solid ratio (L/S : 20-80, w/w), hydrolysis time (t : 30-130 min). Regression analysis showed good fit of the experimental data to the second-order polynomial model with coefficient of determination (R-2) value of 0.9102 and Fisher F-value of 8.69. Optimization of T (185.5 degrees C), c(H2SO4) (0.9 mol/L), L/S (62, w/w), t (77 min) gave a maximum of 2.94 % furfural yield. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Dai, Chunai; Liu, Bo; Li, Zhenyou; Wang, Jin] Beijing Jiaotong Univ, Sch Sci, Beijing 100044, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Impacts of Human Disturbances to River Ecosystem (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE human disturbances; river ecosystem; river restoration
AB For centuries, Human beings developed a lot of water conservancy projects, these projects have played a significant role in civilizing process and brought serious negative impacts to environment as well. This paper research the impact of human activities to river ecosystem among the Yangtze River. Through data analysis of manual activities to river bend, straighten and water flows, we try to discuss the interference effect to ecological system on the lower Jingjiang of Yangtze River. Meanwhile, the study attempts put some forward countermeasures to river restoration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study on Herbicidal Activity in Vitro Exposed to
   Naphthoquinones (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Photoinhibiton; Hill activity; 1,4-Naphthoquinones; In vitro
ID HEMOLYTIC-ACTIVITY; 2-HYDROXY-1,4-NAPHTHOQUINONE; NEPHROTOXICITY;
   GENOTOXICITY
AB In this paper, the photoinhibition of four naphthoquinone compounds including Atovaquone, Buparvaquone, Menadione and 2-hydroxy-1,4-naphthoquinone were determined. And the preliminary study on the influencing factors and the mechanism of photoinhibition was performed based on some molecular descriptors calculated by the quantum chemistry calculation. The results showed that the inhibitions of Hill activity by four 1,4-naphthoquinone compounds presented the same trends and dose-effect relationships. Among them, Buparvaquone had the highest inhibitory activity. The structure-activity relationship (SAR) analysis indicated that E-LUMO might be one of main factors affecting the inhibition of Hill activity by the chemicals having the similar structures with these compounds we tested. At the same time, the lipid/water partition coefficient (logP) and the diameter (Dia) of molecule were also the influencing factors. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Cadmium-induced Changes in Fine Structure of the Microalgae
   Chlamydomonas sp ICE-L from Antarctica (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Antarctica; Cadmium; Chlamydomonas sp ICE-L; Microalgae; Ultrastructure;
   Heavy metal
ID METALS
AB The ultrastructural changes of the Antarctic Chlamydomonas sp. ICE-L exposure to selected concentrations of cadmium were examined using ultramicrotomy and electron microtechnique in present paper. It is observed that starch grains and chloroplast were destroyed dramatically. Vacuole increased both in volume and in numbers, and protoplasm shrinked in the experimental groups treated with high CdCl2. Distorted membrane and indistinct cell wall were found at the same time. The experimental groups exposed to CdCl2 for 24 h showed that the mitochondria was hardly affected. Results showed that effect of CdCl2 on ICE-L was depended on treated dose and time. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Based on wavelet transform image reconstruction to study

DE sampling area; cascade complex transformation; watershed algorithm;
   particle statistics
AB At present, rain spectrum of image characteristics collection mainly completed by artificial detection, there are some questions that are process multifarious, time-consuming, low efficiency and certain subjectivity. Based on machine vision and image processing technology, raindrops spectrum was operated by traditional image processing method and the morphological algorithm, combining the wavelet multiresolution reconstruction analysis algorithm to processing raindrops spectrum. TI RETRACTED: A Constructive Method of Biorthogonal Vector-valued Finitely
   Supported Wavelets and Dual Frames with multi-scale (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE two-directional; biorthogonal; dual pairs; finite support; wavelet
   wraps; oversampling; pyramid decomposition scheme
ID PACKETS
AB In this paper, the notion of vector-valued multiresolution analysis and biorthogonal vector-valued wavelets are introduced. The existence of biorthogonal finitely supported vector-valued wavelets associated with a pair of biorthogonal finitely supported vector-valued scaling functions is discussed. Construction of wavelet bases is an important aspect of wavelet analysis, and there are many kinds of scalar scaling functions and scalar wavelet functions. A new procedure for designing a class of biorthogonal vector-valued finitely supported wavelet functions is proposed by virtue of multiresolution analysis approach and filter bank theory. A novel method constructing two-directional biorthogonal wavelet wraps. The notion of biorthogonal two-directional finitely supported bivariate wavelet wraps with three-scale is introduced. Their properties is investigated by means of time-frequency analysis method, matrix theory, convergence theorem and operator theory. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research for Mobile IPv6 Adopt in IOT (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Internet of Things; Mobile IPv6; Route Optimization; Security; Mobility
AB Internet of Things (IOT) is the most popular concept in current stage. It identifies and manages items through intelligent perception, recognition technology and ubiquitous network. In this paper, we put forward adopting Mobile IPv6 (MIPv6) in Internet of Things. Firstly, we make a brief introduction of the Internet of Things and Mobile IPv6, and then we analyze the address characteristics and security of Mobile IPv6. Based on this, we elaborate the advantage of Mobile IPv6 adopt in Internet of Things. Finally, we represent an application model of Internet of Things, which achieves the mutual communication between device nodes based on Mobile IPv6. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: A Multi-objective System Dynamic Model for Urban Ecological
   Water Demand Simulation: a Case Study of Dalian City, China (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE urban ecological water demand simulation; multi-objective system dynamic
   mode; Dalian City; water sustainable utilization
AB Water crisis has become the critical point in limiting cities' economical and social development nowadays. With the sharply increasing conflict of supply and demand of water resources, the prediction of ecological water demand is becoming an important part in urban water resource management. Thus, based on the overview of theories and methods for the calculation of urban ecological water demand, this paper introduces a multi-objective system dynamic model which combines system dynamic model with multi-ecosystem theory to simulate urban ecological water demand, with Dalian City, China as a case study. It is demonstrated that the proposed model can be an applicable and flexible method and it also provides an alternative approach for sustainable urban water utilization which can reconcile the conflict between urbanization process and water resource restraints. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Vehicle Rollover Warning Approach Based on Neural Network
   and Support Vector Machine (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE vehicle security; neural network; support vector machine; rollover
   warning
AB This paper studies the vehicle rollover warning based on the vehicle running state parameters which are easy for collecting. By taking advantages of neural network and support vector machine, this paper analyzes the probabilities of the vehicle rollover in the scenario of single lane change and establishes a warning model which could predict the rollover 0.4 seconds in advance for a particular type of vehicle. According to the validation experiments on VeDYNA which is a vehicle dynamic simulation software, the results validate the warning model's good performance with the maximum error as 0.04 second and no missing cases which indicates its validity for rollover warning. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Real-Time High Precision Pulse Width Measurement Based On
   VxWorks (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE UAV; VxWorks; real-time; high-precision; pulse width measurement
AB Small Unmanned aerial vehicles commonly use PWM signals for servo control. In order to verify the flight controller design, it is necessary to measure the PWM control signals. There are two difficulties: real-time and high precision. The PWM signal must be measured per 20ms punctually and the pulse width must be accurate to 0.001ms. In this paper, a new pulse width measuring method based on VxWorks and PCI8554 timer card is introduced, including the structure of measurement system, measurement algorithm and VxWorks driver developing techniques of PCI device. By testing, this measurement system's real-time and accuracy performance satisfied UAV test facilities' requirements. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: An Optical 3D Localization System for Large Volume Assembly
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE large-scale metrology; computer-aid assembly; wMPS; automation
   coordinate tracking
ID METROLOGY
AB Precision spatial 3D localization is important for complex geometry and large-scale assembly in industrial environments. Current solutions for these problems are either unreliable or too expensive. In this paper, we present an optical location system based on rotating planar laser beams. In this system, sensor acquires location by measuring bearing respect to two or more transmitters. The key feature of the system is the ability to simultaneously measure multiple targets. Initially, we introduced the components of system. Following introduction, we discuss the metrology process models and the bearing measurement principal. At last, we build a prototype platform including three transmitters and one sensor to verify the method. The results of the experiments show that the repeatability accuracy of angle measurement is better than 2 arc second and the coordinate deviations is less than 0.5mm in 5mx5mx3m area. According to the principal of the system, the location accuracy will not increase with space, if the number of transmitters is enough. Therefore, this system can achieve relative high precision, and can satisfy the need of large-scale assembly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Duanmu Qiong; Yang Xueyou; Zhu Jigui; Ye Shenghua] Tianjin Univ, State Key Lab Precis Measuring Technol & Instrume, Tianjin 300072, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Predictive Control Based on PID Neural Network (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES

DE neural network; fuzzy control; large delay system; nonlinear control;
   simulation
AB Aiming at the control feature of large delay system like ships, designing a 2-rank derivative multi-step neural network predictive model and the algorithm, and presenting a fuzzy control scheme based on the model with PID Neural Network and fuzzy CMAC controller, we solve the problems of model online identification and controller online design in traditional adaptive control, so that the high precision output fellow-up control of systems with large delay and uncertain nonlinear features can be realized. Simulation results show that the method had perfect control effect. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Hydro-Geochemical Markers for Identification of Petroleum
   Biodegradation in Shallow Groundwater (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Shallow groundwater; Petroleum contamination; Hydro-geochemical markers;
   Biodegradation
ID RISK-ASSESSMENT
AB The biodegradation processes are closely related to the hydro-geochemical activities. To realize the transport and fate of petroleum contaminants in subsurface, an insight into the identification of the biodegradation is of notable significance. In this work, several typical sensitive redox components as hydro-geochemical markers include DO, Eh, NO3-, NO2-, dissolved Mn and Fe, SO42-, S-2(-), HCO3- and pH were investigated to identify the biodegradation pathways in groundwater. The analysis demonstrated that the major biotic activity was sulfate reduction in groundwater during monitoring period. Sulfate serving as the major electron acceptors was critical for oxidizing hydrocarbons, which also leaded to interactions with other hydro-geochemical markers. Then a statistical model was built to verify above conclusions that the hydro-geochemical environment was mainly controlled by the regional background and sulfate reduction process tied in closely with TPH, while the biodegradation products were interconnected with dissolved Mn and Fe, HCO3- and pH. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Fan, W.; Yang, Y. S.] Chinese Acad Sci, NE Inst Geog & Agroecol, Changchun 130012, Peoples R China.
RP Fan, W (reprint author), Chinese Acad Sci, NE Inst Geog & Agroecol, Changchun 130012, Peoples R China.
EM fanwei203@126.com

TI RETRACTED: The Study on Regional Environmental Risk Based on GIS
   Population Model (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Population density; Environmental risk assessment; Gis modeling; Remote
   sensing; Dalian
AB The results of environmental risk accidents have important relations with the spatial distribution of population. In this paper, by combining the habitations extracted from the ALOS remote sensing images in 2008 with the statistical population data of Dalian, the author simulated the population density based on GIS modeling. The average relative error between GIS-based simulation results of population and statistical data is 9.78%, the accuracy is high, and simulation results could reflect the actual spatial distribution of population. The population distribution and HOTSPOT are analyzed, which are followed by calculating the number of residents under environmental hazard within fire-protection distance and sanitary protection zone of Songmudao Chemical Industry Park (SCIP) and Dagushan Harbor Industrial Park (DHIP). Specific research conclusions are as followed: Firstly, the distribution of Dalian population density has showed an apparent spatial autocorrelation with the test value of Moran's I being 0.86. Secondly, there is a strong heterogeneous trend of population density and seven HOTSPOTS are founded including Dalian metropolis, Jinzhou urban area, Maqiaozi of Dalian Development Area, urban zone in Lushun, the urban area of Wafangdian, Pulandian and Zhuanghe City. Thirdly, there are 7603 and 1332 residents within the state specified fire-protection distance of 150 m, while 15637 and 13552 residents correspondingly within the state specified sanitary protection distance of 1 km buffering of SCIP and DHIP. Finally, there really exists a great difference between the number of residents under environmental hazard calculated by statistical population data and population density results which are stimulated by GIS modeling, the average relative error of the results is up to 81.4%. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: "An Algorithm of Fast Duplex Mining Frequent Neighboring
   Class Set" (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE numerical index; anti-code; top-down search; neighboring class weight;
   spatial data mining
AB In the course of mining frequent neighboring class set, present algorithms have some redundant candidate and repetitive computing, which are only able to efficiently extract short frequent neighboring class set, and so this paper proposes an algorithm of fast duplex mining frequent neighboring class set, which is suitable for mining any frequent neighboring class set. This algorithm adopts two methods to generate candidate frequent neighboring class set in the mining course. One is using top-down search strategy to generate candidate by numerical index, the other is using anti-code of front this candidate to generate next candidate frequent neighboring class set. The course of top-down search strategy used by the algorithm isn't different from traditional top-down search strategy, which uses numerical index to generates k-subset of (k+1)-non frequent neighboring class set. By the two methods, the algorithm may delete redundant candidate and repetitive computing. The algorithm creates digital database of neighboring class set via neighboring class weight, according to character of database, it also uses digit logical operation to computes support. The result of experiment indicates that the algorithm is faster and more efficient than present algorithms when mining frequent neighboring class set in large spatial data. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Fang, Gang; Liu, Fu-Ming; Xiong, Jiang; Du, Xiang-Lin; Tu, Cheng-sheng] Chongqing Three Gorges Univ, Coll Math & Comp Sci, Chongqing 404000, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Responses of soil and ecosystem respiration to soil
   temperature and moisture of a poplar plantation in Northern China
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE soil respiration; ecosystem respiration; eddy covariance method; poplar
   plantation forestry Ecosystem
ID CARBON-DIOXIDE; SPRUCE FOREST; CO2 EFFLUX; PINE; EXCHANGE; SITES
AB Ecosystem respiration (ER) and soil respiration (SR) are responding to soil moisture and temperature in different ways due to biological and physical processes operating within an ecosystem. We examined daily and seasonal ecosystem respiration and soil respiration of a poplar plantation located in the temperate climate in northern China by using the eddy covariance and soil respiration chamber methodologies respectively during the entire growing seasons in 2007 and 2009. We analyzed the different responses of ecosystem respiration and soil respiration to soil temperature and soil moisture. The soil respiration of the growing seasons was 519.29 and 495.69 gCm(-2)y(-1) in 2007 and 2009, comparing to ecosystem respiration of the growing season was 701.42 and 594.70 gCm(-2)y(-1) in the two years. On an average, the sum of soil respiration and ecosystem respiration in the growing season in the wetter year was larger than that in the drier year. Soil temperature was the main drive factor of soil respiration during 2 years. Ecosystem respiration was more affected by soil temperature in the wetter year comparing to that it was more controlled by soil moisture in the drier year. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Fang Xianrui; Zhang Zhiqiang] Beijing Forestry Univ, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Effect of Light Intensity Field on Wheat Yield in Agriculture
   Ecosystems (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Agro-forestry ecosystems; light intensity field; shelterbelt; shading
AB This paper based on the measured of light intensity and wheat production within the shelterbelt, with surfer graphics software, correlation analysis and regression analysis of classical statistical methods to analyze relation between wheat yield and light intensity within agro-forestry system. The results showed that the order of average light intensity was: south >west >east >north of the shelterbelt. Wheat yields can be divided into four regions: greater than 810g/m2 for the high yield areas; between 740.51 and 809.35g/m2 for the level-producing areas; 600-740.51g/m2 were cut areas; less than 600 g/m2 were serious cut areas. Judged by wheat yield divided regions above, wheat yield reduction was not serious, but relatively large distributed of area on the east side of shelterbelt; seriously cut areas mainly distribute in the north of shelterbelt; east and south of shelterbelt almost did not have serious cut areas; The size of correlation between light intensity and yield per unit area was north of shelterbelt (0.850) > south of shelterbelt (0.564) > west of shelterbelt (0.554) > east of shelterbelt (0.474). The relationship between light and yield in north of shelterbelt was consistent with Compound model, the south of shelterbelt is consistent with Exponential model; the scale of shading was: north of shelterbelt was about 0-0.7H, south of shelterbelt was about 0-0.3H, east of shelterbelt was about 0-0.3H, west of shelterbelt was about 0-0.5H. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Assessment of Ecological Environment of River Ecosystem in
   Suburb of Beijing Based on PSR Model (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ecological environmental assessment; river; Pressure-state-response
   model; Decision Support System
AB To evaluate ecological environment of river system in suburbs of Beijing efficiently, Pressure-State-Response model theory was explained, comprehensive assessment index system and fuzzy probability assessment model were built. The proposed methodologies have been used to assess ecological environment of famous Andamu river folk-custom tourism area of Beijing, China. Modeling results concluded that the naturalness level of ecological environment within the study area can be divided into 4 grades: (I) Natural degree; (II) Near-natural degree; (III) Degraded degree; (IV) Artificial degree. The total ecological environment state of Andamu river belonged to degraded degree, which signified restoration measures were needed urgently. Decision Support System (DSS) of river ecological environment assessment was also built by programming Visual Basic language to help visualize the distribution of different ecological environment naturalness grades of studied river system. The assessing results fit the field survey well and can be used for restoration and future management of river system. Restoration measures for different ecological environment levels were also recommended. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Recycling of the Spent Lithium Ion Batteries (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Li-ion batteries; Spent batteries; Recycling
ID SOLVENT-EXTRACTION; RECOVERY
AB The Li-ion battery is a most attractive energy source for portable electronic products. With its consumption enhancing, there will be a large amount of spent Li-ion batteries in the following years. Unless the spent batteries would be disposed appropriately, they might cause serious environmental problems especially soil and groundwater contamination because they contain a lot of valuable metal resources. Recovery of spent batteries is becoming a pressing issue. This paper aims at introducing and comparing several methods to recover metals and materials from spent Li-ion batteries. The conventional recycling methods are sometimes sophisticated, and the development of an economical and simple synthetic route for recycling is quite worthy of consideration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Application of Adaptive Spectral-line Enhancer in Bioradar
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE bioradar; error rate; adaptive spectral-line enhancement; variable
   step-size LMS
AB When bioradar detects the survivals under the ruins, it is hard to find the ideal signal as reference in signal-processing. A variable step-size LMS adaptive spectral-line enhancement algorithm based on error rate is introduced and applied to the signal-processing of bioradar by studying a number of conventional adaptive algorithms. This algorithm doesn't need an ideal signal as reference with good convergence, small steady-state error and good robustness. MATLAB simulation has proved that it is effective in signal-processing of bioradar. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Wavelet SVM Regression Algorithm and Its Application in
   Chaotic Time Series Prediction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Wavelet; kernel function; support vector machine; chaotic time series
AB A permissible wavelet support vector kernel function, namely, wavelet kernel function, which is based on t wavelet theory and SVM kernel method, is proposed. Then the wavelet kernel function is used to construct the SVM regression algorithm by which the chaotic time series prediction model is established. The experiment results show that SVM regression algorithm based on wavelet kernel function has good prediction performance to the chaotic time series. Its regression modeling ability is better than that of standard SVM as a whole. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research on Flight Mishap 10000-Hour-Rate Prediction Method
   Based on Markov Chain (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Flight mishap; 10000-Hour-Rate; Markov chain; Prediction method
AB A flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate prediction method, which is based on Markov chain analysis, is proposed. Firstly, Markov chain model of flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate series is established which can use the state transition law of Markov chain to depict the fluctuant characteristic contained in the historical data. Then through extrapolating the model the flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate in future year can be predicted. The experiment example on U. S. Air Force shows that the method is precise, simple, and easy to be understood for flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate prediction problem. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Flight Mishap 10000-Hour-Rate Prediction Model Based on
   Principal Components Mean Generating Function (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Flight mishap; principal component; 10000-Hour-Rate; mean generating
   function; prediction model
AB The time series of the flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate usually take on a certain fluctuation law, which can lead to some difficulties in modelling and predicting. A modelling and predicting method based on principal components mean generating function for flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate is proposed. The method adopts the memory idea before and after system state and the phase space expansion technology to solve the modelling the predicting of the fluctuation data series. The experiment result shows that, the method has a simple modelling process and a good prediction to flight mishap 10000-Hour-Rate, and is a simple and feasible method of flight mishap prediction. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE Fuzzy model; neural network; membership function; system identification
AB For many shortcomings of the traditional fuzzy identification model, an adaptive pi-sigma neural network system identification model based on Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy system is proposed. TI RETRACTED: Prediction of Flight Mishap 10000-Hour-Rate Based on
   Grey-Markov Hybrid Model (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Flight mishap; 10000-Hour-Rate; Grey model; Markov model; hybird
   prediction
AB A hybrid prediction model of flight mishap 10000-hour-rate, based on Grey model and Markov model, is proposed. Firstly, Grey model of flight mishap 10000-hour-rate is constructed, which can extract its trend information. Then using the residual information of extraction process aforementioned Markov model is built, which can depict the fluctuation law. The simulation example of U S Air Force shows that the method has a good performance with feature of novelty, simplicity, comprehensibility and prediction result. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Investigation of the Temperature Field of Working Face by
   Different Turbulence Models (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE turbulence model; working face; temperature field; numerical simulation
AB Four turbulence models are used to simulate the temperature field and the velocity field of the working face by FLUENT, to analyse the applicability of the models. The mass weighted mean values of the temperature of the sections along the channel is compared with the temperature measured in mine. The analytical results show that the excursion between the simulation result of the standard k-e model and the measured temperature is the hugest one, the largest excursion is about 0.3 degrees C. After a comprehensive comparison, it could be concluded that all models the paper used are suitable for simulating the flow field in working face. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on the Affect of Returning Farmland to Forest Project
   on Regional Ecological Risk in Mudanjiang City (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Returning Farmland to Forest Project; Regional Ecological Risk
   Assessment; Landscape Indexes; Eco-Environmental Resilience; Mudanjiang
AB Long-term deforestation and over-harvesting directly led to serious soil erosion and sharp forest deterioration, and the Eco-Environment in Mudanjiang became worse and worse. So the government there took the Returning Farmland to Forest Project (RFFP) firstly in Heilongjiang Province in China in 1999. On the basis of deeply understanding the Eco-Environmental problem of soil erosion and the Ecological Risk Definition, this paper put forward an Ecological Risk Assessment Model with Landscape Indexes and Eco-Environment Resilience. This model firstly calculated the landscape indexes of every sample by fragstats and then obtained the spatial distribution of Ecological Risk by ordinary Kruger interpolation. The results showed that: the landscape fragmentation improved after the RFFP, the Eco-Environment Resilience increased significantly because the forest area increased obviously and the serious soil erosion was controlled by the high vegetation cover, which in the end made the Ecological Risk drop down rapidly, from 0.003-0.952 to 0.003-0.310. The area proportion of minor, slight and moderate risk increased separately from 7.65%. 13.71% and 21.39% to 18.85%. 33.04% and 33.24%, while the intense and server declined respectively from 31.46% and 25.79% to 14.88% and 0%. In a word, the model possessed advantages of intuition and simplicity and could descript the regional ecological risk quantitatively and its spatial distribution intuitively. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Gao, Fengjie; Zhang, Bai; Wang, Zongming] Chinese Acad Sci, NE Inst Geog & Agroecol, Weishan Rd 3195, Changchun 130012, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Gradient-based Threshold Segmentation Technology (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE image segmentation; otsu method; threshold value; gradient; fused
   algorithm
AB For the Image threshold segmentation, local contrast information is not sufficient used for threshold, the border is a single pixel wide, but is deviation from the true boundary point. Gradient segmentation does not take full advantage of global information, which can get the real boundary points, and affected by noise with not complete single-pixel contour. By analyzing the threshold segmentation and gradient segmentation, fused with which a segmentation algorithm is proposed. The histogram threshold is studied in three ways: interactive, iterative and the Otsu method, and the wide valley impact on image segmentation is analyzed, the algorithm of selecting the best threshold is designed. The optimal threshold is researched on the gradient mean of the same gray value, which integrates the local gradient and global threshold. Experimental results show that the algorithm not only considers the adjacent consistency of the image information, but also taking into account the local contrast, and improve the effect of simple threshold, which is an effective and practical image segmentation algorithm. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Transition Region-based Gradient Image Segmentation
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE gradient image; transition region; threshold segment; fusion algorithm
AB For the gradient image threshold segmentation, threshold selection is not fully take into account the boundary features in the edge function of MATLAB. By analyzing high gradient magnitude or local bigger change of gradient image boundary region, the transition region extraction algorithm is present. The gradient and entropy is studied, and fusion algorithm of them is designed. The total transition region is composed of pixels with high gradient magnitude and the larger local entropy, then threshold selected based on transition region histogram, the boundary segmentation can be realized. Experiments show that the algorithm is effective and practical. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Pre-Concentration of Nickel on Alumina Loaded with
   Dimethylglyoxime and Determination by AAS (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Alumina; Nickel; Dimethylglyoxime; Pre-concentration and separation; AAS
AB The absorption behavior of modified alumina loaded with dimethylglyoxime for nickel is studied. The conditions of adsorption and elution of nickel is established by experiment. A new method of pre-concentration, separation and analysis by Atomic Absorbance Spectrophotometry (AAS) for nickel on modified alumina loaded with dimethylglyoxime is proposed. The results show that modified alumina loaded with dimethylglyoxime for nickel has better adsorptive power at pH 9, and the capacity of adsorption is 25 mg/g. The elution efficiency is 100% when nickel is eluted by 5 mL 2mol/L hydrochloric acid. The modified alumina loaded with dimethylglyoxime can be used three times repeatedly. The proposed method has been applied to determine nickel in groundwater samples with satisfactory results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Gao Junjie; Xu Nannan; Wang Xiaohui] Shenyang Ligong Univ, Sch Environm & Chem Engn, Shenyang 110159, Peoples R China.
