TI RETRACTED: Design of Management system in Graduation Thesis (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Soil indexes; Auto-correlation distance; Shear wave velocity
AB The stability of foundation depends on spatial average property of soil in some area, so the spatial variability of soil parameters need be considered in the processing of probability analysis. Soil spatial variability is related to soil point variability with the reduction factor of variance in random field theory, while the reduction factor of variance depends on both soil auto-correlation distance and spatial area. So auto-correlation distance is the key to the study on spatial characteristic. A systematic study is carried out on the peculiarities of auto-correlation distance of soil parameters in construction field. According to the datum of static cone penetration test curve, different ways to obtain auto-correlation distance are compared by large calculation. The sampling space effect on auto-correlation distance is studied. The feasibility of calculation horizontal auto-correlation distance by using of shear wave velocity is discussed. The peculiarities of auto-correlation distance of soil parameters are obtained by comparing of auto-correlation distance of different soil parameters and by comparing between vertical and horizontal auto-correlation distance of the same soil parameters. It has been shown that the auto-correlation distance of soil parameters has the peculiarity of transversely cross-isotropy. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 N China Univ Technol, Coll Architecture, Beijing 100144, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Enhanced Nitrogen Removal in Subsurface Wastewater
   Infiltration System (SWIS) Using a Novel Bio-substrate (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE sewage treatment; infiltration; nitrogen; nitrification;
   denitrification; bio-substrate
ID AERATION
AB To enhance biological nitrogen removal in a subsurface wastewater infiltration system (SWIS), a novel bio-substrate was developed composed of 25% (mass mixture ratio) activated sludge, and 75% other components (meadow brown soil, grass carbon, cinder, and zeolite). SWIS was filled with meadow brown soil and constructed subsurface wastewater infiltration system (CSWIS) was filled with the bio-substrate. Microbial activities of the bio-substrate, ammonia nitrogen (NH4+-N) and total nitrogen (TN) removal effects were studied in both SWIS and CSWIS. The pilot-scale experiments showed that, at a hydraulic loading rate of 4 cm day(-1), CSWIS converted 88.1% of NH4+-N to nitrate nitrogen (NOx-N) and biodegraded 81.4% of TN, 10.1 and 10.7% higher than SWIS, respectively. On average, influent and effluent concentrations of NH4+-N during the whole experiment period were 25.0 and 2.2 mg L-1, respectively, 40.0 and 4.6 mg L-1 for TN in CSWIS. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Y. H.; Li, H. B.; Sun, T. H.; Wang, X.] Shenyang Univ, Key Lab Ecoremediat & Resource Reuse, Minist Educ, Shenyang 110044, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Research on Soil Water Retaining Capacity of Typical Forests
   in Jinyun Mountain (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE forest types; soil water; soil porosity; water conservation
AB The purpose of this paper is to provide a basis for construction of water conservation type of vegetation. In this paper, the forest soil pore distribution and water storage properties of four typical forests (mixed wood, broadleaf forest, bamboo forest and shrub forest) in Jinyun Mountain were compared. The water holding capacity of soil non-capillary of shrub forest is 88.24 millimeter, 83.52 millimeter in mixed wood, 75.96 millimeter in broadleaf forest, and 63.48 millimeter in the bamboo forest. The saturation water capacity of shrub forest is 361.62 millimeter, 323.16 millimeter in mixed wood, 295.62 millimeter in broadleaf forest, and 267.92 millimeter in the bamboo forest. The results indicated that the water holding capacity of soil non-capillary from high to low is shrub forest > mixed wood > broadleaf forest > bamboo forest. The shrub forest and mixed wood have higher water conservation function than the bamboo forest. Therefore, it is proposed that in the future the shrub forest and mixed wood should be afforested and managed firstly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Li, Yang; Rao, Liangyi; Wang, Baitian] Beijing Forestry Univ, Coll Soil & Water Conservat, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.
RP Wang, BT (reprint author), Beijing Forestry Univ, Coll Soil & Water Conservat, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Design of Two Types of Moisture Measurement Instruments with
   Microwave (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE microwave; moisture measurement; dryness; attenuation
AB Two types of moisture measurement instruments were designed separately with microwave dryness method and attenuation method. The principles of the moisture instruments were analyzed theoretically, and the systems of two instruments were designed and compared. The results show that the moisture instrument with microwave dryness method has the characteristics of high precision and high speed, and the moisture instrument with microwave attenuation method can be used in the online measurement system with much higher speed but low precision. TI RETRACTED: The Degradation of Menadione in Soil (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Menadionein; Soil; Degradation
AB Effects of environmental conditions on degradation of menadione was studied in laboratory. Results shown that degradation rate of menadione were positively related to initial concentration, however, negatively related to the organic matter content. In the other hand, the degradation of menadionein soil was affected by soil microorganisms. The results showed that menadione could be easily degraded in soil. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: The Automatic Solar Tracking System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE double-rocker mechanism; automatic solar tracking; photovoltaic arrays
AB In order to improve the utilization rate of solar energy, the automatic solar tracking device driven directly by stepping motor emerges as the times require. However, with the relatively small torque and high cost, the stepping motor only can drive a limited number of panels. To solve this problem, an improved automatic solar tracking system is proposed, in this system double-rocker mechanism driven by stepping motor is used effectively to control a large number of photovoltaic arrays in horizontal and pitch direction. The experimental results show that, the system we proposed not only can automatically track the position of the sun Real-time and accurately, but also reduce the cost effectively, the generation efficiency is increased by 35% compared with the fixed photovoltaic arrays. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Evaluation of Values of Ecosystem Service Function of the
   Plain Forestry in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE plain forestry; ecosystem service; evaluation of values
ID VALUATION
AB In this paper, the market value method, shadow engineering method, opportunity cost method, substitute expense method and data of investigate are used to value the ecosystem service functions of the plain forestry in China. The valuation reveals that the total ecological value is estimated up to RMB 3097.49x10(8) Yuan per annum, of which, about RMB 306.77x10(8) Yuan is of the output of standing trees, about RMB 903.15x10(8) Yuan of erosion control, about RMB 496.39x10(8) Yuan of carbon fixation and oxygen production, about RMB 948.41x10(8) Yuan of air quality purifying, about RMB 393.78x10(8) Yuan of reducing wind and stabilizing sand, and about RMB 48.98x10(8) Yuan of recreation and ecotourism. the ecosystem service functions of the plain forestry in China provides the average value of RMB 12346.26 Yuan/(hm(2).a). Compared to the direct benefits of forest ecosystem, indirect benefits are more important for the survival of human being. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Carbon stock and storage potential as affected by land-use in
   meadow steppe of Northeast China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Carbon; meadow steppe; storage potential; land-use; SOC
ID SOIL CARBON; TERRESTRIAL ECOSYSTEMS; PLANT DIVERSITY; CLIMATE-CHANGE;
   GRASSLANDS; PRODUCTIVITY; NITROGEN; CYCLE; SINK; SEQUESTRATION
AB Accurately predicting terrestrial carbon (C) storage requires understanding the stock and storage potential of C, because it helps us understand how ecosystems would respond to natural and anthropogenic disturbances under different management strategies. We investigated organic C storage in aboveground biomass, litter, roots, and soil organic matter (SOM) in six land-use types (i.e. artificial pasture, AP; natural meadow, NM; corn plantation, CP; bare land, BL; pasturable grassland, PG; and enclosed grassland, EG) in meadow steppe of Northeast China. The primary objective of this study was to ascertain the impact of different land-use types on the stock and storage potential of C. The results revealed that the total C storage (including aboveground biomass, litter, roots, and SOM, i.e. 0-100cm soil layer) was significantly different between one and another type among the five pairs (P < 0.05), and varied from 5829.4gC m(-2) to 16451.6gC m(-2). The C stored in the aboveground biomass was less than 2014.2gC m(-2), accounting for negligible amounts (< 1% of the total) of total C storage except corn plantation in the ecosystem. The amount of C stored in SOM accounted for over 90% of the total C storage in AP, NM, BL, PG, and EG, and the C stored in litter was very low (< 1%), compared to other pools in the ecosystem. The amount of C stored in the roots varied from 0gC m(-2) for plot BL and CP to 450.6gC m(-2) for plot AP2, and it accounted for less than 5% of C storage in the grassland. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Lian, Peiyong; Ding, Fan] Chinese Acad Sci, Inst Appl Ecol, Shenyang 110016, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Sulphide Precipitation Integrated Membrane for Heavy
   Metal Pollution of Groundwater (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE heavy metal; Na2S; sulfide precipitation; membrane unit
AB Heavy metals are common pollutants in contamination-involved emergencies. During recent years, heavy-metal-contaminated emergencies tend to occur more frequently with high intensity. The sulphide precipitation integrated membrane reactor is used to treat heavy-metal-contaminated water with Na2S acting as precipitant for heavy metals. Through pilot test, the qualities of effluent satisfy the class III water quality of "quality standard for ground water" (GB14848-93). Thus the sulphide precipitation integrated membrane reactor is proved as an effective method for removing the heavy metal in groundwater with high efficiency. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Lian, Xinying; Wang, Heli; Shen, Liang; Qi, Jingxian; Sun, Huichao] China Univ Geosci, 29 XUEYUAN Rd, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.
RP Wang, HL (reprint author), China Univ Geosci, 29 XUEYUAN Rd, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.
EM wangheli@cugb.edu.cn
CR Chao Li, 2008, ACTA SCI CIRCUMSTANT

TI RETRACTED: Improved Mono-Window Algorithm to Retrieve Lake Surface
   Temperature Using HJ-IRS Thermal Infrared Data (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Lake surface temperature; Mono-window algorithm; MODTRAN; HJ-IRS
AB Remote sensing data has an important application value and scientific significance. in retrieval of lake surface temperature (LST). On September 6, 2008, China successfully launched two optical small satellites (respectively called HJ-1A, HJ-1B.) to monitor and predicate environment and disaster. HJ-1B satellite includes an infrared camera (IRS). The camera has a thermal infrared band which can dynamically monitor LST of large river basins in 4 days. HJ-IRS is a new sensor, so there are few papers researching on the retrieval of LST. The main goal of this paper is to introduce a practical method to obtain LST from HJ-IRS thermal data. In this paper, we reviewed primary algorithms of LST retrieval and mainly analyzed Qin's mono-window algorithm retrieving LST from Landsat TM6 (Thematic Mapper) thermal data. This algorithm included two empirical relationships about atmospheric transmittance and atmospheric average temperature. But these relationships are only suitable for TM6. So on the basis of the spectral response function of HJ-IRS thermal band we use radiance transfer software MODTRAN4 to simulate and calculate new coefficients in the two relationships. New algorithm requires three parameters: emissivity, vertical water vapor column and atmospheric temperature about 2 meters above the ground. We use two images of Lake Taihu to retrieve LST and validate the improved algorithm. Bias of LST retrieved from HJ-IRS data and the field measurements are smaller than 1.2K, which means this algorithm is applicable for HJ-IRS thermal band to retrieve LST. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Liang Shanshan; Zhang Bing; Li Junsheng; Zhang Hao; Shen Qian] Chinese Acad Sci, Ctr Earth Observat & Digital Earth, 9th Dengzhuang S Rd, Beijing 10094, Peoples R China.
RP Liang, SS (reprint author), Chinese Acad Sci, Ctr Earth Observat & Digital Earth, 9th Dengzhuang S Rd, Beijing 10094, Peoples R China.
EM Ssliang@ceode.ac.cn

TI RETRACTED: Design and realization of GIS color management (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE color management; GIS; color space; profile; conversion
AB With the development of press technology and personalization of map, the accuracy of map color is increasingly demanded. People want to achieve the WYSIWYG effect. However, because of the hardware characters of the input and output devices and the lack of color management in GIS softwares, the colors in the GIS mapping process are inevitably changed. In this paper, based on the analysis of the reasons that the map colors are changed during mapping in GIS, study the realization of color management in GIS, construct a GIS color management model, and present a GIS color management system realization method. Based on this study, realize the GIS color management module with the object-oriented method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: An effective method of locating license plate in complex
   Scenes (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE LPRS; license plate location; 1-D discrete wavelet transform; median
   filtering; binarization; morphology operation; region-labeling
AB License plate recognition system (LPRS) is one of the most important parts of the intelligent transportation system (ITS), and the license plate location is the most important step of the LPRS, it derectly affects the performance of the character segmentation and recognition afterward. In this paper, an effective algorithm of lisence plate location is proposed. In this method, Firstly we obtain high frequency coefficient through 1-D discrete wavelet transform. Then we process the image with median filtering, binarization and morphology operation. Finally, we label and record the connected regions. Then we can locate the candidate license plates according to the region information. Experiment proved that our method performs well in the long range and complex scenes, and performs well on located speed and robustness. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ling, Jianing; Xie, Mei; Li, Yun] Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Sch Elect Engn, Chengdu 611731, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Network Reliability Prediction Based on Support Vector
   Machine (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE support vector machine; nonlinear regression; network reliability
   prediction; influencing factors
AB Network reliability prediction is significant to make up the strategy for network management. In order to solve the local optimum of BP neural network, support vector machine(SVM) is proposed to predict network reliability in the paper. In the study, Grid method is applied to select optimal parameters of support vector machine. Thus, network reliability prediction model by SVM has four input nodes and one output node. The experimental network reliability data are applied to study the superiority of support vector machine. The comparison of network reliability prediction error between support vector machine and BP neural network demonstrates that network reliability prediction ability of support vector machine is better than that of BP neural network. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Network Safety Accessment by Least Squares Support Vector
   Machine Classifier (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE network safety accessment; least squares support vector machine;
   classification
ID SYSTEMS
AB In order to solve the local optimum of BP neural network, least squares support vector machine(LSSVM) is proposed to access network safety in the paper. The least squares support vector machine classifier is used to solve the nonlinear classification problem in the network safety accessment, which can solve the quadric programming problem, which has the stronger classification ability than other prediction methods. The network safety accessment data are applied to study the superiority of least squares support vector machine. The comparison of network safety accessment between least squares support vector machine and BP neural network, which indicates that network safety accessment ability of least squares support vector machine is better than that of BP neural network. TI RETRACTED: Screening and Flocculating Properties of the
   Bioflocculant-Producing Mutant P33 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Mutant; bioflocculant; flocculating activity; oily wastewater
ID BACILLUS-FIRMUS; REMOVAL
AB Microorganisms with high oil degrading performance are essential for bioremediation of soil contaminated with crude oil. A positive end dilution method was employed for the selection of crude oil-degrading functional consortium from contaminated soil. The selected consortium was consisted of Rhizobiales sp., Pseudomonas sp., Brucella sp., Bacillus sp., Rhodococcus sp., Microbacterium sp. and Roseomonas sp. and removed nearly 52.1% of crude oil at initial concentration of 10,000 mg/L at 30 degrees C within 7 days, with removal of aliphatic hydrocarbons by 71.4% and aromatic hydrocarbons by 36.0%, respectively. The effectiveness of the consortium for bioaugmentation was confirmed with microcosm test by contaminated soil (1.0 kg) from Karemary Oilfield, China. The removal efficiency of crude oil was enhanced to > 50% in microcosms with the consortium compared with 8-13% or lower in controls over a 60 day period. The crude oil removal reaction was probably first order reaction and the rate was greatly enhanced by bioaugmentation. Supplementation of nitrogen and phosphate sources had limited effect on the oil removal in the tested soil. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Liu, Chunshuang; Zhao, Dongfeng; Zhang, Yunbo; Li, Zheng; Huang, Subing] China Univ Petr, Coll Chem & Chem Engn, QEDA, POB 2620,66 Changjiang W Rd, Qingdao 266555, Peoples R China.

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE heading face; multicomponent; mix ventilation; temperature field;
   parallel calculation
AB A multicomponent single-phase model was set for high-temperature heading face in this study, based on the mass conservation law, the momentum conservation law and the energy conservation law. The standard wall function was used to correlate the physical quantities near the wall and in the turbulence kern zone. Parellel calculation method was used to simulate the distribution of the temperature field and the flow field. The calculation results show that, the temperature of the airflow goes up nonlinearly along the channel from the heading and the distribution of the temperature field depends on the characteristic of the flow field. Then the temperature curves of heading face with air injection, whose temperatures are different, were analyzed. The section which is 7m far from the heading is the inflection point for all of the curves. The temperature gradient along the vertical direction increases quickly, but the largest temperature difference is less than 3K. So the comfort of human is satisfied under each temperature of the injection air. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE Bridge deck; Flutter derivatives; Parameter identification; Moving least
   squares method
AB For the sake of increasing the precision of identifying flutter derivatives of bridge decks and the stability of convergence in the process of nonlinear least-square iteration, based on the decaying free motion records of bridge deck segment model, a new method was put forward to identify flutter derivatives of bridge deck. Based on a thin plate and the Chongqing CaiyUanba bridge over Yangtze river, the wind tunnel tests of their section models were carried out, and their flutter derivatives were identified by the new method. The results have indicated the effectiveness of the method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study and Application of Rainwater Quality Assessment Model
   Based on Radial Basis Function Artificial Neural Network (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Radial basis function artificial neural network; Drinking water source
   based on rainwater harvesting; Water quality assessment; K-means dynamic
   clustering algorithm
AB Aiming to the problems existing in water quality comprehensive assessment model and method, the paper establishes K-means dynamic clustering algorithm applicable to rainwater quality assessment, which by adding inferior class V water quality standard based on the Surface Water Environmental Quality Standard(GB3838-2002), generating training samples and testing samples through random uniformly insert values between every two assessment standards and normalization processing the training samples and the testing samples, where the model have one network input layer with 6 nodes, one output layer with 1 nodes and one hidden layer whose nodes number can be automatically determined by network training. The model output is continuous variation value, which not only satisfies the demand of water quality assessment but also has quantitative evaluation effect. It is used to assess the water quality of drinking water source based on rainwater harvesting in Xifeng District Qingyang City Gansu Province. The assessment result shows that the water quality of different underlying surface lies between III similar to V. Compared the assessment results to which obtained by principal component analysis method, we find the RBF-ANN model output assessment result is scientific, reasonable and intuitive. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE application server; network management agent; SNMP; NGN
AB The telecommunication application server(AS) is an important part of the value-added service network in the next generation network(NGN) as the support platform. Remote, unified and secure management to a variety of services is implemented after the remote network management of the telecommunications application server. The network management system based on Simple Network Management Protocol(SNMP) is decided to utilized to analyze and study the network managed objects in AS because of the integration of telecommunications networks and computer networks on the network management and convenient, economical and flexible features of SNMP protocol. The network management agent module of AS is designed and an example is illustrated the details of the model. Results indicate the good performance of the network management agent. DE Multi-Agent; safe community; injury; Distributed
AB According to the data from the Ministry of Health, about 2 million persons suffer injuries every year in china. Among them, 700 000 to 750 000 died due to injury. Injury monitoring data contributes to reducing the threat to life and property. Agent's autonomy, initiative, social greatly contribute to solving a distributed, structured and semi-structured injury information. TI RETRACTED: Soil Organic Carbon and C: N Ratio in Mountain Forestlands of
   the Jinyun (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE soil organic carbon; density; C:N ratio; Jinyun Mountain
ID STORAGE; VEGETATION; GRASSLANDS; PATTERNS; CLIMATE
AB Under the background of global warming, soil organic carbon (SOC) pool in forest systems has become one of the most important issues in the study of global carbon cycle. Soils under five forest types (Lindera kwangtungensis x Cunninghamia lanceolata mixed forest(GS), Pinus massonianaxLindera kwangtungensis x Symplocos setchuanensis mixed forest(MGS), Phyllostachys pubescens x Pinus massoniana x Symplocos setchuanensis mixed forest(MMS), Gordonia acuminate x Adinandra bockiana mixed forest(SS) and Phyllostachys pubescens forest(M)) were collected in Jinyun Mountain of Chongqing City for the determination of SOC and total N content. Then the characteristics of SOC and C: N ratio of these forest types were analyzed respectively. The results showed that: SOC content and density decreased with the increase of soil depth and different among five forest types. The SOC density of five forest types was: GS (24.53 +/- 0.059 kg/m(2))>MGS (21.01 +/- 0.024 kg/m(2))>MMS (12.07 +/- 0.020 kg/m(2))>M (10.22 +/- 0.036 kg/m(2))>SS (7.72 +/- 0.015 kg/m(2)). The SOC storage of five forest plots were mainly in. and. horizon and the percentages of SOC storage in these horizons were 64.52% (GS), 81.59% (MGS), 93.36% (MMS), 94.92% (SS) and 86.03% (M) respectively. The order of the average C: N ratio was: MGS (20.53)> GS (13.05)> M (9.34)> MMS (7.49)> SS (2.96). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE computer teaching; classroom assessment; evaluation system; data mining;

AB As colleges and universities in recent years, the scale of the rapid expansion and the continuing reform of the educational system to improve university teaching management and assessment of classroom teaching workload of teachers in colleges increases every year, its complexity is also rising. The computer teaching reform as the high education reform pioneer has obtained some preliminary results. TI RETRACTED: Research of MPPT for Photovoltaic Generation Based on Cloud
   Model (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE photovoltaic power generation; MPPT; cloud model
ID POWER POINT TRACKING; ALGORITHM
AB The cloud model is a mathematical representation to fuzziness and randomness in linguistic concepts. It represents a qualitative concept with expected value Ex, entropy En and hyper entropy He, and integrates the fuzziness and randomness of a linguistic concept in a unified way. This model is a new method for transformation between qualitative and quantitative in the knowledge. This paper is introduced MPPT (maximum power point tracking, MPPT) controller based two- dimensional cloud model through analysis of auto-optimization MPPT control of photovoltaic power system and combining theory of cloud model. Simulation result shows that the cloud controller is simple and easy, directly perceived through the senses, and has strong robustness, better control performance. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Development and Practice in City Level of Material Flow
   Analysis (MFA) in China (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE material flow analysis (MFA); environmental capacity; material
   productivity (MP); Tianjin city
AB On the basis of reviewing and summarizing the experience of MFA in china and abroad, the research framework of regional MFA are proposed, meanwhile the method was applied in city level, and analyzing the material flows in Tianjin city from 1998 to 2007. The results indicated that the total material consumption of Tianjin was 97.25 million tons in 2007. The amount of imported materials accounted for 46 percent of direct material input, and 40 percent of it was coal; it indicated that Tianjin largely depended on external resource. Moreover, the environmental capacity of Tianjin was at the saturated state, with water seriously polluted. The material productivity was being improved, but the efficiency of resources utilization was in a lower level. Finally, accordingly measures and suggestions were proposed to resolve the existing problems. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Investigation of protein fouling on poly (acrylic
   acid)-graft-polypropylene membrane by streaming potential measurement
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE pH sensitivity; Bovine serum albumin; microfiltration; antifouling;
   streaming potential
AB The fouling behavior of Bovine serum albumin (BSA) on Poly(acrylic acid)-graft-polypropylene membrane was studied by flux and streaming potential mearurement. A pair of electrode was used to measure the streaming potential of PP and grafted membranes. The zeta potential of grafted membranes calculated by streaming potential was negative in most pH range. The results show that the grafted membranes are markedly pH-dependence on both water permeability and antifouling behavior. All membranes show the most serious fouling behavior at pH 4.7(the isoelectric point IEP of BSA) and the smallest flux decline at pH 3. Compared with the ungrafted PP membrane, grafted membranes show more serious fouling behavior at pH 3, whereas 18% grafted membrane has a certain antifouling behavior at pH 4.7 and 8. The streaming potential of membranes changes with the BSA fouling on membrane. Therefore the streaming potential of membrane could be a adjutant means to evaluate fouling behaviour. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on online shopping consumption characteristics of
   college students IN Beijing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE College students; online shopping; consumption
AB In this paper, the college students in Beijing as the research object, 569 Beijing college students are involved in the questionnaire survey about the online shopping problem. Research index involves the group characteristics, website category, product category, payment form, logistics distribution and rights complaints of network shopping. Based on the statistical analysis of feedback data, it is shown that 76% of Beijing college students have had experience of online shopping, among which the ratio between boys and girls is 79:73. Most of the online shopping commodities belong to the category of sportswear and stationery. 85% of the students will be influenced by the evaluation and assessment from online shops to make consumptions. In addition, the survey also found that University students are dissatisfied with the logistics related to online shopping and the corresponding rights defense, which should be greatly strengthened. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE biological phosphorus removal; chemical phosphorus removal; biological
   aerated filter; domestic wastewater
AB Hydrolysis acidification/pre-denitrification biological aerated filter was adopted in an domestic wastewater treatment plant. The effluent was accorded with A standard in the Integrated Wastewater Discharge Standard(GB18918-2002), in which the effluent phosphorus was demanded below 0.5mg/L. Through analysis on the process biological phosphorus removal, biological method can be found to total phosphorus 1.5 mg/L. If you reach level to A emissions standards, phosphorus chemical experiment research, finally determined by strategy for the CN pool, point for adding potions FeCl3, dosing quantity for 35mg/L. TI RETRACTED: Fuzzy Random Reliability of Anchoring Depth for Rigid
   Anti-Slide Piles (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Rigid Anti-Slide Piles; Fuzzy Random Reliability; Analysis Model
AB The unstable mode of the rigid pile structure is mainly the pressure instability of soil at the pile side in the anchoring section. According to the extreme values of the pile's side pressure at the two depth places below the anti-slide pile surface, the structure functions are respectively established to analyze the reliability of anchoring depth for rigid anti-slide piles under the two extreme values, and then with the consideration of the randomness and fuzziness in the reliability analysis for the anti-slide pile structure, the fuzzy random reliability analysis model is established. Taking the calculation of a rigid anti-slide pile for example, the fuzzy reliability index and fuzzy reliability of the structure are obtained, and the calculated results are consistent with the classical theory limit state factors. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Application of Matter Element Evaluation for Risk Control
   in Construction Project (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Matter Element; Fuzzy Comprehensive judgment; Risk
AB It is a precondition to have a quantitative description of project risk for its management. As a tool, Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation based on matter element model provides a way to calculate risks. This paper introduces the common theory of fuzzy matter element evaluation, puts up general procedures of risk evaluation based on fuzzy matter element evaluation, and establishes model of matter element risk evaluation as well as comprehensive evaluation method based on fuzzy matter element. This paper, through an real project, analyses risks exist in the project of Caiyuanba Bridge in Chongqing from the view of proprietor with fuzzy matter element evaluation applied, the results verifies the superiority and feasibility of the method and its good efficiency in project risk management. TI RETRACTED: Safety Evaluation System for Bridges Structure under
   Overloaded Vehicles (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Bridge Structure; Reliability Analysis; Overloaded Vehicles; Safety
AB It Load from overloaded vehicles far exceeds the design load, which severely threaten the safe operation of highway bridges and is one of the main causes of bridge collapse in recent years. This paper analyzes in detail the variation of the reliability index of flexural members of in-service bridges with the correction coefficient of vehicle live load effect and calculates respectively the reliability index of flexural members corresponding to different live load effect correction coefficient, adopting the statistic parameter of resistance and load effect suggested by Unified Design Standards for the structure reliability of highway engineering. Calculations show that overloaded transportation has significant effect on the safety of bridge members and bridge structure. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Importance Assessment of Members-Continuous Multi-span
   Stone-Arch Bridge Collapsing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Continuous Multi-span Stone-arch bridge; Collapse; Weakness; Finite
   Element Simulation
AB The Taking progressive collapses of a stone arch bridge for example, a three-dimension finite element model for stone-arch bridge is established by using large general-purpose finite element software. The whole collapse process of the bridge is simulated by means of contact algorithm and birth-death element method, to analyse possible causes resulting in collapse and to make importance assessment to each part of the bridge, thus, weakness of members and structure of the bridge during collapsing is concluded. DE OBIA; VHR; spectrum; texture; segmentation; classification
ID REMOTE-SENSING DATA; COVER CLASSIFICATION; MULTIRESOLUTION
AB In this paper, we proposed a contextual and Object-based Image Analysis (OBIA) classification approach through the experiment, which was using Cognition Network Language (CNL) of commercial software eCognition Developer. Combination of spectrum and texture explored the rich information contents in the Very High-spatial Resolution (VHR) satellite imagery. Meanwhile, contextual relation was adopted in the experiment to improve the classification accuracy. In the research, a few land cover characteristics (contrast, entropy, etc.) were studied for the local land covers. By the experiment, six different classes were extracted: building, road, forest, water, farmland and bare soil. 94.05% classification overall accuracy and 0.92 Kappa coefficient were achieved by the approach for the complex land covers. Data set was five bands QuickBird imagery located nearby Kunming Dianchi Lake (KDL), which is a very important highland lake in China, also in the world. The results may be used in lake protection, environment protection, land planning and land use management, and government decision making around KDL. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design of a CAB for the Field-Programmable Analog Array
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Field-Programmable Analog Array; Configurable Analog Blocks; Fully
   Differential Difference Amplifier; Aanalog Signal Processing
ID DIFFERENTIAL-DIFFERENCE AMPLIFIER; BLOCK
AB This paper presents a flexible CAB (configurable analog blocks) topology for field programmable analog arrays (FPAA). A fully differential difference amplifier (DDA) was used as the core circuit block in the CAB. The CAB is mainly composed of DDA, several programmable capacitor arrays (PCAs), and programmable resistor arrays (PRAs). The DDA_based circuits often provide high input impedance and simple external circuitry, and therefore are competitive to the opamp-based circuits. The proposed DDA_based CAB has been designed in a 0.35 mu m CMOS+EEPROM process. Simulation results show that the presented CAB is powerful enough to implement the fundamental and certain complex analog functions, for instance, integrator, filters, subtracter etc. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Nonlinear state feedback based wheel slip control for
   automotive with switching dynamics of hydraulic actuator explicitly
   considered (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Wheel slip control; switched control; Lyapunov theory; nonlinear state
   feedback
AB Vehicular hydraulic brake system inherits switching dynamics from the actuator. Accordingly, a switched control approach, composed of three local nonlinear state feedback controllers, is presented to converge the wheel slip to the target point. The stability is analyzed using Lyapunov theory. Both analysis and simulation show that the controller is also highly robust to the actuator control. With a simple structure and few parameters, the approach is applicable in practice. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Dynamic Nearest Neighborhood Collaboration Target Tracking
   for WSN (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE wireless sensor network; target tracking; nearest neighborhood
   collaboration; kalman filter
ID WIRELESS SENSOR NETWORKS
AB Target tracking is one of the most important applications for wireless sensor networks. Generally, multi-sensors working collaboratively can achieve better performance but with high-energy consumption in target tracking. In this paper, a dynamically clustering algorithm, called nearest neighborhood collaboration, is proposed for collaborative target tracking in wireless sensor networks. It selects cluster head based on minimum distance between predicted target position and sensor nodes. Cluster head forms the cluster of tasking sensors in its neighborhood and fulfills estimation update, next state prediction, and executes information fusion based on central Kalman Filter. Simulation results show that, compared with existing sensor scheduling algorithm, the proposed multisensor scheduling scheme not only achieve superior tracking accuracy but also energy saving, it is also robust to the uncertainty of process noise. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Characteristics of membrane fouling of dye wastewater
   treatment by combined MBR (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE combined MBR; EPS; membrane fouling; cake layer resistance; protein
ID SUBSTANCES; BIOREACTOR
AB This study focused on the membrane fouling during a long term operation by the combined MBR adopted to treat the synthetic dyeing wastewater. The extracellular polymeric substances (EPS) as a major fouling component in membrane bioreactor (MBR) systems were investigated. Results showed that the cake layer resistance accounted for more than 60% in the total resistance while the internal membrane resistance took a possession of less than 10%. Analysis also illustrated that higher proportion of protein in the EPS both of the active sludge and the foulants on the membrane surface than other kinds of wastewater MBR treatments. UV-visible spectral scanning was used in the experiment, detecting some dye intermediates existed in the MBR effluent. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Performance Evaluation of Adaptive Scheduling Algorithm for
   Multi-function Phased Array Radars (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Phased array radar; Scheduling algorithm; Performance evaluation;
   Priority
AB A performance evaluation technique of adaptive scheduling algorithm is presented for multi-function phased array radars. First, the basic model of radar task is built, and the test environment for performance evaluation is described, which includes a set of scenarios with different target sets. The environment proposed is used for evaluating the performance of scheduling algorithm with different task request scales. Then, three quantified performance metric indices are presented, which are successful scheduling ratio (SSR), time utilizing ratio (TUR) and expected time shifting ratio (ETSR). The SSR, TUR and ETSR quantify the task scheduling capability, the usage of time resource and scheduled task time control of adaptive scheduling algorithm, respectively. Meanwhile, a new synthetic adaptive scheduling algorithm is proposed based on task function priority and task deadline. The experiment results show the advantage of new scheduling algorithm and the validation of performance evaluation method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Adaptive Real-time Divisible Load Scheduling Algorithm for
   Unknown Network Parameters (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Load allocation; Divisible load; Real-time; Parameter estimation
AB An adaptive real-time divisible load scheduling algorithm including parameter estimation of network and allocation of divisible load is presented for unknown network system. Firstly, the scheduling model for real-time divisible load is built, which can satisfy the restriction of task deadline with the minimal network resources. And then the method that estimates network parameter values using a small fraction of the total load is given. Furthermore, optimal processor sequence and processor number is analyzed based on divisible load theory. Lastly the adaptive load allocation method is proposed for real-time tasks with bus network architecture. The validity of the proposed algorithm is proved by both theoretical analysis and simulation results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   Induced Fluorescence Technology (Retracted Article)

DE Laser induced fluorescence; Dental pulp vitality; Detection; Fiber
ID DOPPLER FLOWMETRY; OXIMETRY
AB The state of dental pulp vitality is the key to human teeth healthy whether or not, to effectively detect tooth, the technology of laser induced fluorescence was used to detect dental pulp vitality. The principle that tooth can be excitated fluorescence in the short wavelength irradiation source was analyzed, and the relation between the intensity of tooth fluorescence and the dental pulp vitality were studied, the detection system of dental pulp vitality was designed. Base on detection circuit and gather system, the overall design of fluorescence signal detection system and signal amplification processing were studied and analyzed; ADS7804 and AT89C51 were used to design and gather fluorescence signal coming from tooth, and detection circuit performance was discussed. Through experimentation, different incident laser power or different laser wavelength bring different the fluorescence intensity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research Photoelectricity Array Sensor Logic Circuit Design
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE photoelectricity array sensor; CPLD; logical sequence; drive circuit
ID LASER
AB To realize the collection of the high-speed photoelectricity array sensor, the CPLD technology was proposed to design its driving logic circuit. the basic working principle of photoelectricity array sensor and its timing requirements were analyzed. According to the requirement the complex sequence and photoelectricity array sensor periphery drive circuit was designed when high-speed linear photoelectricity array sensor chip collect image: The photoelectricity array sensor signal acquisition work principle and design principle of the outer circuit was analyzed; The design of photoelectricity array sensor periphery driver circuit was proposed and the relationship between signal timing photoelectricity array sensor was analyzed, Combined with the given clock signal, The design of photoelectricity array sensor logical sequence driving circuit was proposed by using CPLD, The key technology of the circuit design was analyzed, photoelectricity array sensor driver timing circuit design was given, the circuit design was simulated by CPLD internal simulation tools. TI RETRACTED: Air traffic flow prediction based on least squares support
   vector regression (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE air traffic flow; least squares support vector regression; prediction
   model; optimization conditions
AB Air traffic flow prediction is the very important to make up the development strategy. Least squares support vector regression is a kind of improved support vector regression, which has stronger prediction ability than support vector regression. Thus, least squares support vector regression is proposed in the Air traffic flow prediction. Grid method is applied to gain the parameters of least squares support vector regression. Air traffic flow from 1993 to 2005 in east China is applied in the experiment to testify the effectiveness of the proposed method. Therefore, least squares support vector regression prediction is very high application values in the Air traffic flow prediction. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Numerical simulation of average salinity in the northern
   South China Sea (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE northern South China Sea; Salinity; Kuroshio Current; diluted water
AB The Princeton Ocean Model (POM) is adopted to simulate the circulation and seasonal variation of average salinity in the northern South China Sea (SCS), and the influence of the Kuroshio Current and river diluted water on the distribution of salinity is also discussed. According to the simulation results, the salinity field changed significantly with seasons in general. The invasion of the Kuroshio is strongest in winter and is weakest in summer. The low salinity area in the vicinity of the Pearl River estuary is mainly affected by river runoff, and usually gets maximum impact in summer. In summary, the monthly variation of salinity has a strong correlation of the Kuroshio and the river diluted water. And these phenomena are consistent with actual measurements. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on the Application of Digital Content Management
   System Based on Data Warehouse and Data Mining Technology (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE digital content management system; data warehouse; data mining
   technology; OAIS
AB At present, digital content has permeated every part of human social life, and has become a valuable resource. However, while the vast amounts of information continue to occur, human beings are persecuted by the loss of information, especially those carrying human culture and civilization. The prolonged preservation technology of digital content faces enormous challenges. Therefore, the managers should consider how to supervise, manage and utilize the digital content for a long time by the scientific and reasonable measures. OAIS provides a conceptual model for the long-term preservation of digital content, it satisfy the basic need of the long-term preservation of digital content from the aspect of system function. But in the practice of preservation, the explicit data model is necessary, moreover, the model should meet the management need of whole life cycle in the long-term preservation of digital content, meanwhile it's necessary to choose the coding formats of media files. In this paper, firstly, we study the digital content management data model and propose a 7-layer reference model of digital content management according to the hierarchical idea. And then using data mining techniques, we implicit in all the associated data layer data extraction, comparison, analysis, and selectively format digital information for maintenance and preservation according to the appropriate standards. Finally, we process the corresponding data resources through data warehouse and online analytical. At the same time, establish the function of the system of internal links and with the external interface, and a series of high-level services on top of these interfaces. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Design of Vehicle Detection and Identification System
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE compound system; piezoelectric sensor; ultrasonic sensor; LPC2210
AB Intelligent Transportation System is the trend of the future traffic, its key technology- the research of Automatic Vehicle Identification(AVI) has the far-reaching significance. Based on the analysis of current models of AVI, this thesis designed a compound system using piezoelectric sensor and ultrasonic sensor. The system used the philips's ARM7TDMI-S nuclear and bus open MCU LPC2210 as the control core, a large number of effective feature information acquired by two sensors input MCU via the serial port, then achieved vehicle automatic identification through software programming. The system has high accuracy and practicality. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Improving differential evolution using hybrid strategies for
   multimodal optimization (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Differential evolution; evolutionary computation; multimodal
   optimization; global optimization
ID ALGORITHM
AB Differential evolution (DE) is a new evolutionary optimization technique. It has shown good performance in many optimization problems. However, it easily falls into local minima in solving complex multimodal problems. In this paper, we propose an improved DE variant by employing hybrid strategies for solving multimodal problems. The proposed approach is called HDE, which utilizes opposition-based learning concept and optional external archive. Experiments on a multimodal benchmark set show that HDE achieves good solutions in many test cases. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A hybrid quantum-behaved differential evolution algorithm
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Differential evolution; quantum; evolutionary computation; global
   optimization
ID OPTIMIZATION
AB Differential Evolution (DE) is a recently proposed intelligent optimization algorithm, which has shown excellent search abilities in many real world and benchmark optimization problems. In order to enhance the performance of DE, this paper presents a hybrid DE algorithm, called HQDE, which employs a quantum-behaved mechanism and adaptive parameter control. To verify the performance of the proposed approach, ten well-known benchmark optimization problems were selected in the experiments. Simulation results demonstrate that HQDE obtains better performance than standard DE and another improved DE variant. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Simulation of Resistivity Logging While Drilling using the
   Automatic Adaptive hp-FEM (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE hp-finite element method; resistivity; Maxwell's equations; automatic
   adaptively
ID FINITE-ELEMENT-METHOD; P-VERSION; 1-DIMENSION
AB The accurate analysis of Logging While Drilling (LWD) is an important issue in oil engineering. In this paper, a novel high efficient and high precision fully automatic energy-norm based hp-adaptive Finite Element method applied to LWD formation resistivity log response is presented. The methodology can refinement the element mesh in different directions or using different order of basis functions for different element mesh, improved the calculation speed and reduced the number of degrees of freedom of the response of LWD. The resistivity curves have the same detection characteristics with the real logging tools, proved the correctness of the simulation results. Finally, comparisons in both of h-adaptive finite element method and p-adaptive finite element method are presented, which demonstrate a very good computational performance. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Application of Set Pair Analysis on Groundwater Quality
   Prediction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Set pair analysis (SPA); groundwater quality; prediction
AB Based on set pair analysis (SPA) theory, this paper propose a new method to resolve the predict problem of groundwater quality. Considering the certainties and uncertainties in the dynamic environment of groundwater, the identity-discrepant-contrary (IDC) pattern in set pair analysis theory is used for classification and measurement. Then a case study is given, the result shoes that this method is effective for the prediction in this area. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Influence of Coastal Land Use Change to Land Surface
   Temperature (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE LUCC; Land Surface Temperature; Salt Water Intrusion; Laizhou Bay
ID TM DATA
AB Based on the same temporal remote sensing images of high resolution Landsat TM(ETM+), the land use and land cover change(LUCC) maps were acquired through visualization classification. Along with land use maps, two periods of LST(land surface temperature) were retrieved using method of atmospheric correction. To explain the influence of saltwater in coastal area, the study area was divided into three subregions of freshwater area, saltwater area, and transitional type water area according to corresponding salt water intrusion data over the past 20 years. The results showed that the area of culturing water and farmland increased significantly. At the same time, the area of beach and saline-alkali had a substantial reduction and the area of urban and rural settlements increased considerably. As the distance from the sea increasing (from saltwater area and transitional type water area to freshwater area), there was a decreasing trend in LST because of changes in vegetation cover and water surface area. With the influence of coastal economic development and salt water intrusion, the land use and land cover changed significantly, so did the land surface temperature. There was a decrease of LST in study area, the average LST was 30.72 degrees C in 1987 and 29.69 degrees C in 2000. The LST of 2000 reduced by 1.03 degrees C compared with that of 1987. Seawater intrusion significantly affected the spatial pattern of land cover and changes. LUCC was impacted evidently on the spatial distribution and changes of LST in the study area of Laizhou bay coastal areas. The change of LST is closely related to change of land use. This study would provide scientific reference and basis for decision making for ecological and environmental protection along coastal wetlands and beach land development. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Incorporating discriminative neighborhood preserving
   constraints for improved support vector classification (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE supervised machine learning; support vector machine; manifold learning;
   discriminative neighborhood preserving constraints
ID CLASS VARIANCE; RECOGNITION; MACHINES
AB In this paper a new SVM-based classification model is proposed by adding discriminative neighborhood preserving constraints. It obtains separating hyperplane from the combination of the support vector of the traditional SVM as well as the geometric and discriminant structure arise from the within-class and between-class neighborhood preserving matrices. These matrices characterize the two kinds of neighborhood geometric structures of data manifolds that are more helpful for obtaining consistent separating hyperplane than the isolated support vectors. The proposed model can be deduced to the generalized framework of SVM with some extra preprocessing for efficient and uniform computation, which makes it more attractive for real world applications. Experimental results on public data sets show that the proposed method has comparable or better generalization ability compared to some related SVMs algorithms. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Feasibility Analysis of Application of Combined Chilled
   Ceilings and Displacement Ventilation Systems in South-China (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Chilled ceilings; Displacement ventilation; Feasibility analysis
ID COOLING SYSTEM; AIR; PERFORMANCE; SIMULATION; CLIMATE; CFD; HOT
AB This paper reviews state of the art of combined chilled ceilings and displacement ventilation (CC/DV) systems all over the world. The feasibility of the application of the combined systems in South-China area is analyzed. However, there exist three main problems such as panel surface condensation, first investment cost and enough cooling capacity to be solved. Several methods were illustrated to prevent the condensation of the combined systems in three aspects. The high investment cost problem can be solved with the development and production of new independent terminal products of CC systems. Many products can meet the cooling load requirements in most cases which are suitable for applying the combined CC/DV systems. Finally the development of combined systems in the South-China region in the future is prospected. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
